long: i do not like the army because we never have any time to ourself and we are not getting the training we should get. there is only one thing i like to do in this camp and that is dancing but on fridays we stay in to clean and scrub our barracks so that stops me from going to the dance on friday night

outfits_comment: because they are different from white people
long: well as far as the army is, i think it is all-right. and a good thing to have, but it is just the way some co. treat there men. other are o.k. i like it my-self but i don't like the out-outfit i am in.

outfits_comment: a negro should stay in his place.
long: i dont have any thing els to say about the army i will say i dont like this much around here.

outfits_comment: according to north or south
long: i think i deserve a right to have a slight pick on what i like to do only for the reason that enough men are in service than can take  infantry than  as far as the way they use you. i don't think there is any  of using the men as they are used. a man deserves a pick in some respect to the other. he should take an interest in all officers that give him a chance. others will not give an inch for fear that he will take a mile.
drop some old ideas

outfits_comment: it makes better training to keep them separate
long: when i enlisted the army board said if i enlisted i would get what i wanted and i had to go soon anyway so i enlisted for the air corp but they put me in the infantry and anyway i would not have been in as yet if he hadnt talked me into enlisting and i really would and could do more back on the farm and my wife and kids would be a lot better off. but if i had to be in the army and could take what i wanted i would still take the ground crew in the air corp.

outfits_comment: they work better separate
long: if i will help conditions is ok.
it to hard to make soldier after you are 28 years of age. i would rather work in a coal mine were i had a job for 9 years and understand it very well.
in answer to no 36, there is no place there or in the succeeding question for a person who has been the support of an aged mother or father as head of the family to signify the same as in my case.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
long: this private is 42 yrs of age and having a hell of a time trying to do thing the young soldiers do easily
why does some fellows get a deferment & others as to go to a army camp?

is doing his part very well he is a work both in defense factores and in actual combat- he too is making supreme sacrifice, and it is my opinion that more people should except him into the mode of amerian living. let him enjoy those rights and freedoms we white people have shared.

outfits_comment: because negro  while don't live tighter where i came from
because they can't get along with each other
long: well i think some of the questions on here was worth while but some of them weren't and i don't see why they have things like this if they don't try to please all the soldiers and they can't please all of them.

question 58 through 63 - the negro are alright in their place - whether its in civilian life or military - but most of them if given a few extra privileges seem to think they've been given the right to take over. they should be definitely kept separated on army posts - anyway i'm still a southerner at heart.

outfits_comment: cause too much trouble if they were together
long: would like to have officers you could depend on instead of the namby pamby ones we have had in the past two years. give us some with common sense  and some (at least) military training before they are commissioned.

outfits_comment: what have we in common with a negro? they should stay in their place.
not in the same barrack.

long: if the u.s. army would slect there o.c.s.m form the rank there would be more work by e.m. to reach the top it is to easy to make 2nd if you are a civilian and when he come to a company the e.m. know more than he does therefore i doesn't get along so there goes a good out outfit. most of them are look for a silver box than look out for the men he has been intrust with.  if a men can and is willing to make air corp. why not let him go. just he has had a court martial. that happen before the war. and he trying to do his best now.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: we are fighting the nazis because of their prejudice against the jews, negro etc. if we treat the negro as an outcast we are not using logic.
long: i would like to take this opportunity to speak my mind. they say it is a soldier's privilege to ""bitch"". since i come in this highly disorganized 45th division i have found out what sectionalism is at first hand. this division is primarily the oklahoma nat. guard. many so-called ""yankees"" have been placed in this division upon completion of their basic training. the thing that hits you first is that unless you are an ""oky"" you haven't a chance. and in my 6th month in this outfit i have been reliving the civil war which we thought was settled. as a result of this ""feuding"" the morale is very low - nobody gives a damn about anything! although i hate to say it - the happiest day of my life (outside of getting an honorable discharge) would be the day when i was transferred from this outfit!!!

outfits_comment: there would be too much friction
same reason.
long: question #5. pretaining to the branch of the service you would choose now. being an enlisted man, who enlisted for the air force ground crew, but instead was put in the infantry. i think it very unfair for the simple reason, that any man who enlists should be able to chose his branch, before entering and get that particular branch he enlists for.

outfits_comment: they wouldn't get along with each other
long: 1. why the allotments are held up for three or for months at a time. 2. what chance has a little guy got in this war i mean in business

i would like to make you see a little light on the subject of our laundry. the pay each and every month $1.50, one dollar and fifty cents that is for twice a month. i surely believe that is to much to much to pay for dont you? if it could be arranged, that we send it once a week and receive it in 4 days after that would suit every soldier in camp.  the barbers are lousy and not outfit to cut a slice of meat. they dont know the first thing in cutting hair. to pay 40 cents for a cheap haircut is robbery. they make a wholesale profit. a fair price of 25 cents or 30 cents is surely enough profit for and income. i get my hair cut now by a buddy in my barrack. he sure can cut fine. and only a quarter.

outfits_comment: well they couldn't get along very good.
long: well to my thought the on all (ok).

most of the boys in my outfit come from where negro stay on their side of the street and they don't like them and they fight each other when they are together. i don't think they should be in the same camp together. they are giving us the same training they have been giving us for the last two years. it isn't doing us much good i don't think.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: we are all in this for the cause and see no reason why they shouldn't't be allowed & fight with us side by side
long: the classification of the individual soldier is still not what it should be. after a certain length of time a soldier that is not qualified for the line of duty he is in should be placed without question in his proper place. there are too many men in the service that are in outfits where they are not beneficial at all. a man 5 ft. 125 lbs. that tires quickly is put into the infantry while a man 6 ft. 175 lbs is put driving a jeep or truck or put on a job that does not require much physical work at all

outfits_comment: makes it uniform
long: 1. the army does not give an opportunity to show your ability. 2. it is a very poor system to put enlisted or drafted men in an old national guard outfit because he hasn't a chance for an advancement in account of all national guardsmen come from about the same state, and too much partiality prevails.

outfits_comment: it is better this way. it is hard to break a custom or a tradition which has been going on for a good many years.
long: this is probably the only time i will ever have  of expressing myself about this particular outfit. to begin with there is much to much favoritism. if your not from oklahoma you can't get fair play let alone a chance to better oneself. the food in this particular camp is bad not their fault though i honestly believe that you should look into the situation immediately. the commanding officer threatens his men with physical violence in order that his orders may be carried out and has been carried out to some extent. it seems that anyone who had some education or political pull back in oklahoma received a commission. i repeat, there is much to much favoritism. it can stand a looking into. over 100 soldiers in my outfit who are from the north not one is a noncom officer.

outfits_comment: but in combat it should not make any difference
long: why don't somebody bet my outfit on the ball?
i stress that, boys from the north, should not be, with boys from the south and west in the same outfit, our  outfit, would be a better one.

outfits_comment: when together i think they would make a better fighting unit (under their own command)
long: this is fair chance for any soldier to express his own opinion, and i think its a very good idea. after a man is in the army for a while i think he knows whats it all about.

outfits_comment: negro & white boys just don't get along.
long: my appinion of the army is that there is to many little untrained officers trying to run it, there is times when orders are changed three or four times before they make up their minds what kinds of uniforms men will wear out to the field thats what disgusts men.  in my line of duty as transportation  i finds out that drivers would take more interest if they did not have to make  &  with the company two & three times each week.  & also that our lots could be improved, lately its not so good.

some people can take to the army like a duck to water. others can't living decently with a nice job you like to choose own friends and sort of having a will or mind to do your own thinking. the army has change me very much and if i was discharge honorably it would take me at least a full year to readjust myself to civilian living stop forming bad habits i have contacted. i miss mom & pop the folks. for the short time we are stationed in this country maybe a few months the army should stationed a soldier near his home for the weekend this makes good soldiers. a.w.o.l. would never happen. the soldier would be happy and contented as long as in the good old u.s.a.

outfits_comment: because myself would soldier with them, don't think any more white would like
long: on the question about the niggers and white in the same outfit. don't think they they would work a tall, cause most of the boys down south don't like them but boys up north or yankees like them the same as another

outfits_comment: most of them smell like a goat.
long: this outfit was originally natl. guards. we have been mobilized 29 men. if we are to be a  fighting outfit, why in the hell can't we get in & help fight this thing out instead of moving from one army camp to another in the u.s.  there will be a lot of these "90 day wonders' 'shirtails" get their ass shot off if we ever do see combat, because they don't know as much as the average enlisted man.  the food hasn't been so good lately, but no soldier will starve on what we are getting. the soldier from the north doesn't put his heart into the thing & take the right attitude.

outfits_comment: because they are of different color and just don't like them
long: i dont think i like my company because i'm not from oklahoma or in on their words a rebel we don't get a fair chance to do anything like it comes to getting furloughs or passes and furthermore when it comes to extra work well we get in i mean the yanks get it all the time what do they think they are fighting the civil war again. and furthermore the meals we get are lousy so i eat at the service club or p.x., maybe you won't believe me about the food we get but its the darn truth about it and i will swear to it all myself and the clothing they give us don't even outfit us at all.
no recreational questions are asked outside the service clubs. i believe there should be more organized sports between co's & bn.  classification of the soldier should be given more thought.

outfits_comment: i don't think they should mix
not in the same camp they should be in separate outfits.

long: well colored people don't stand much chance of getting anywhere in the south. most of the fellers from the  south west call them every thing and treat them like rot on the ground.  in other these same fellers have them working on there farms for nothing , in other tenmant farmers and share cropper

outfits_comment: because i think they would lower the morale of the white people.

long: say why not ask how the food is in the army; it is hill here. and just where is all the butter going they say the army is getting it that is a lie, i know the army is hard it has got to be but give us food. all i can say is i sure like to talk over the air for just one day, and let them on the out side know how it is on the inside.  they say the man in the army is, o k, hell for get it lets end the war so we all can go home.

outfits_comment: if everyone had my view points as to race, color, or creed, it would be one outfit. personally, i'd rather be with colored than with southerners.
long: if i were a leader of an armed force i'd have everything balanced perfectly. i wouldn't put northerners in with an already organized southern outfit. what chance has a "yankee" private, when all non-coms and commissioned officers are all southerners. naturally since they (south) hate us, there is no chance in the world of getting ahead. if a yankee does a minor misgrace he is punished heavily. if a rebel does a major offense, he would probably be made a non-comm. if you're not in good with the 1st sergeant, you might as well wear fatigues all day long. if you offend a non-comm - (off duty) you'll probably be the sorriest man in the army. the captain doesn't know his men as well as he should. he knows just the ones that he knew in civilian life, and they're the ones who get everything. this is not just my opinion, the same answers will probably be given by some 5,000 more "yankees." i've seen men need non-coms, (men who probably don't know the difference between an 03 and m.i.) just because they were good friends w/the sergeant. later on, these men were busted because it was too evident, that they did not't know anything. but the ones that replaced them were just as bad. if it weren't for my parants i'd rather desert, than go across with an outfit like this.

outfits_comment: because of less trouble
long: (the 25th div no fuck good) (the food is sorry as hell and jusa poor) (a negro is negro guy where you find)(the noncom are dirty chicken shits) (the leader are all cut throat for higher comm.) (if it wasn't for the px having candy and popcorn etc. i go hurry)(but you find them who love the army)

outfits_comment: be case the most af the boy is white in the have trouble with the negro
long: wit this divisoin hase been going van the hill ever since 1942 in it stride going vancor in it no are an tap put it an the bathas in it sixy is long is not got a white hell officer a first class prteret know men then came af them in i bu leive if the boy no are busted up the skills in one place in the yank in a another it wood be a good bunch in the algie wood satdg, but on er how laters of yankees shot gold brick an us in it make everything poty for the rest  of them dont gre aney thing but  for thir peple but in a fill blooded soldger in with be the kept of mi life i love mi peple in nil first for themwith that a bust all i gotz lay but i sent lids by be out in the miltery service i cant march in yaer ty old in brakes

i have been greatly disappointed with my position in the army. i volunteered for the air corps to have a chance to fly but under circumstances i have never had that chance. as a fact i have never had the opportunity to be around any air crafts of any kind. i also like action and travelling which i have now none of either

outfits_comment: more can be accomplished by separate units to achieve victory if they were separated. negro can adapt themselves to different climate than the white physically etc.
long: the army sales talk to us when we were civilians regarding that we would be placed to work in the army which we are better suited for proved to be a farce. i am just one of the many who are in the same position we are doing work which we dislike, have no interest in. i feel sincerely that my army career has been a failure because of this. if ever i live thru this war and go home again i shall feel that my time past in the organization has been lost. the whole thing boils down to the fact that it isn't what you know in the army but who you know in order to be successful. because of these disappointments we cannot help but feel that we are "suckers" to fight and die in order that others will become rich. when i came in to the army i was full of ambition and hopes. today i am broken in spirit and have lost all sparks that i possessed toward achievement. only a transfer to a suitable line of work can restore my hopes etc again.

outfits_comment: they don't mix.
long: the question of whether negro and white soldiers should be in the same outfit together or not. i don't think they should because the racial  division would constantly cause friction and friction in any groupe will tear down carful organization. it destroyes unity or  and unity is essential to disiplin and the backbone of the army is  an disiplin

when a man is drafted, he is put where the army has to fill a quota and not where he is best suited. a great deal of good talent etc. is lost this way and the man put in where he is not best fitted loses his interest and ambitious of becoming a good soldier.  men in vital war industries should not be drafted whether single of married. women or others cannot replace a man who has bee trained for a years at certain job and do it a particle as well.  "red tape" in the army is too much and disgusts a man very much. someday is will 'cause a great deal of legal trouble providing the authorities do not quiet it down as usual.
the 4th no good i have been in 2 yers i aine not a soldier i dont no

outfits_comment: a negro wouldn't have a chance in my outfit.
long: my outfit has very poor cooperation because the noncom's try to cut each others throats for their stripes. the officers doesn't try cooperate at all times. i can't see why it is so disorganized. the men bitch too much. our morale has always been way high until we got our own chickens the food is good but the cooks are very poor. if you think that poor chow doesn't lower the spirit of a man your wrong. try eating with us & doing our job and see how long you stay in good spirits. it will, bad chow, break the hell out of any outfit. its the way the cook's perpare the food we do get the keep you going. not the amount or kind.

outfits_comment: if they were together they would start too many fights
i don't know
long: i notice the questionnaire did not't mention any thing concerning the army food, it seem to me the longer a soldier remains in the service the lousier the food gets.

outfits_comment: because we don't like negro are from oklahoma
long: i think it is good thing to have  come to a  camp just to fiend out what a pvt. think obout the war i think the questionnaire is very good thing?
the only thing i don't like that i am in the guard squadron in is very  inforce

i think permanent guard duty is to much to ask anybody to pull.. let everyone do his share of it. we need made experienced cooks,and (not)? just men called cooks. guards need warmer clothes and more time off. some outfits are treated better than others. we should all be treated the same. we all came in for the same reason. we should win the war soon and wipe the axis off the map. we have too many 90 day officers. we need more morale building and more of chaplains and not 7 day a week jobs. 6 days is enough.

i like the army very well all except the outfit that i am in the guard squadron. they tell us when we come in we would be on six hours and off eighteen. it is the other way . we can't get any furlough on this outfit like they should be given. they let about four go ever two month. they keep telling us that they will let more go next time. i think if i was in some other outfit i would feel more like a soldier.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: they are just as good as i am.
long: how about stopping men like captain rickenbacker from taken it apon himself to speak for the soldiers. lets not have another prohibition. lets give our working people a better chance to earn a living and not keep degrading them. people in defense plants are working 60 to 70 hrs a week and 7 days a week these days. so lets not say they are slackers and should be in the army. capital has just the same amount of power to prevent strikes and labor disturbances as do the working people. so lets not blame the worker.

outfits_comment: because they are not as clean as  white people are
long: i am a farmer and worked on all my life and i dont seem to be fitted anywhere if i had the chance to go back i would feel that i could help win the war better that way than being in the army i am sure that i would do all i could to make production that means a lot.

i believe if these wasn't so much politics & red tape that we could have had this war over in the summer of 43. are earlier.  the negro race is making a place for them self. they will have more privileges & will deserve them. there will have to be a limit set though.

outfits_comment: negro have different habits, standard of living, and speech

long: i think this questionnaire is a very good idea.
it is a very good questionnaire and covers the current situations very good.

outfits_comment: they will make better soldiers in their own outfit
long: the questions asked should give good idea of how the soldier feels as a whole

outfits_comment: no white would think of living that close to a negro.
long: i think the present day officers are to familiar with their men therefore, they don't get the proper respect and discipline that is an officers due. i don't think that co, commanders have the proper authority over their co's as the the higher ups step in and try to run the co's too much it leaves the impression that c.o.'s don't trust the co commanders.
it any is bag but  be . i hope but good  to the army  about.

i believe the army could be a little more careful in selecting its men for combatant service. there were many men who came into the army with non-combatant stamped on the top of their service record. this was of course for general service with non-combatant duties. however after a white a man was either general or limited service. those that were non-combatant were disregarded and put in the field. many of them have very poor eyesight, anywhere from 20/200 to 20/400, but because they have 20/30 vision with glasses they can do any combat work. this is fine, but what if the glasses are broken, and you can't see, and maybe men lives depend on you. one can't carry two or three pairs of glasses around in combat. i stopped college to enlist in all (3) branches & couldn't, they told me i might lose my glasses, then where would i be. havever the draft had other ideas, so i ended up in the infantry, one of the best combatant units.

outfits_comment: to give ...(?) a better opportunity to get its credit, should credit be ...(?)
long: their are some questions, where the printed answers do not give you enough leeway one way or another.

outfits_comment: i think keeping the race together, they should be able to work better
long: there isn't much that i can comment about.  but one thing it gave some good questions in it.  one question what branch of the service you would like to be in.  also how we are treated in the army, but i guess they are gone the best, to no that they can.  signed, yours truly  no name

the army is a place where men get to be well trained. they get a cooperative attitude. a fellow that does not know how to take orders and obey them the army is grand place for him to get his training.
most of the questions are pretty fair and you have a good chance to give your our indeal

officers should be men that are congenial and friendlyyet firm. they should not be egotistical individuals. this applies mostly to medical officers who think, because they come in the army as 1st lieutenant. that they are better than the men under their command. they should be trained just as we are for 13 weeks. so that they may better understand the feelings of the men that they command. men should be picked for noncoms on their ability not on how much an officer likes the individual. after 13 weeks. basic training soldiers should be either kept in an outfit of reclassified. why put under-weight, bad eyes and bad feet in an infantry regiment?

i think that we should not enlarge the army. any more than it is, & fully equip the men we have in the service, it is just a lot of eye wash & a false front, when there is an inspection by wash.officials, to borrow equipment from a bn or reg. to put a fully equipped company on parade & make the inspectors believe, every one is fully. equipped. this has been done as i have helped do it. we don't have an army for show, we are at war.

outfits_comment: most white soldiers would try to overrun the negro soldiers
long: i i think this questionnaire is a good idea  ii i hope the data collected will be read.  iii the preant - day army is softening up - as a whole, we are not nearly as tough as we were when we came in. non-comm's are to easy with the man under them.  iv a lot of the ratings passed out are on the old army ""sucking"" basis - hence, a lot of reliable jobs are being held by incompetant men. this problem always has been, and always will be, so what's the use of saying amything about it. although i try to do my part while in the army, i want to be the first to apply for a discharge, when the war is over.

outfits_comment: i dont like negro
long: if it was peace times i had rather be out of the army. but as it is i can take anything any body is can. since body has to be highest might as well be me as anybody els
the only squak i really have is not poor treatment but this sense of confinement.

when the men were classified when they came into the army some of them it seems to me were put in the wrong branch of the service and they should be reclassified as to the job they had in civilian life in some cases this was done but in many other cases it was not

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
long: question (7) bus  should have more buses - and they should run on a prescribed schedule. (en) should know what is happened all the time
i believe that this questionnaire is a good idea and helps a soldier find out a few things from answering the questions.

outfits_comment: i think they should be in they one camp
long: i would like to be down south so i could be close to my mother i could take care of here
i think this is a good way to find out every bodyes idea of his brother american.

outfits_comment: that depends on the negro himself. how does he like the idea.
long: in all i believe we have the men, material, brains to do a good job in licking the axis. i believe an ary is as good if not better than any in the world. however, i believe it could be a lot better. we have an army being run on the same principal as germany did in world war 1 . for instance our officers are not encouraged to mix with the men. the average soldier is below his social level. is that democratic. in spite of my criticisms i think when we get rolling we'll knock the hell out of the axis.

i was in the medicals corps before coming to this dump but being that i was a ia man i was transferred to the infantry which i hate + want no part of. i had about 9 months of med. training and technician and then getting transferred to the infantry is a disgrace to have to be treated this way. up unntil the time i was transferred to the infantry i was very well satisfied with the army life but this is too much for me to take and enjoy just being in the infantry, i know i could be satisfied if i was back in my old outfit, this is too much for me and i will never give my best to the infantry.

we haft to eat at other co. mess halls. i don't know if it is the cooks, or the food but it could be a lot better.  if we had a messhall of our own i am sure it would help. we onely have 4 messhalls for five companies.
i think this camp isn't getting enough to eat. and the pvt.  has very little time for him self, if any. if you are a pvt.  you will have to hand shake with the noncom to get alone.

outfits_comment: if each group would cast tradition and  aside i see no reason they could not soldier shoulder to shoulder.
long: no 6. that answer applies up to recently. i have received a change which may change this picture. no 8. this answer applies to what i have seen of the army so far. no 16 i will receive a sergeant rating in a few days. no 20 this picture may change for the better if changes now in progress prove satisfactory. no 23 this answer applies up to now. but things are improveing. no 32 if i were given a job along the line i am trained in i could do the army a lot of good. but as a plain inf man at which i am no good, i could do a lot more outside. no 41. the training i have had so far will do me little or no good after the war is over i hope to get a spot in the army yet though which will further the training i had when i came in the army.no 46 & 47 i believe money has a lot to do with it. no 56 & 51 i have had no contact with either. no 53,54,56 i know nothing or very little of these people. 55 o think the laboring people in general are but i do think the unions and  are feathering their nests.
the service is ok but the infantry is not so good for there not chance of coming back.

outfits_comment: because the colored and white races should not mix.
long: i do not think the army is fair to some people who are physical unfit for drill work and & they make them do it. i think they could have a little better medical service

outfits_comment: racial hatereds would still cause many complications, but only with the southern boys
long: question (11) if i were at a camp in my own state and was able to get home once in a while, and i think that goes for every one. if i could see my wife and family, i would enjoy the army a very lot better than i do now. i think that would lift the morale of all the boys. they would work harder and face anything before them
the food could be better then it is, it sure is terebly

i think this questionnaire is a wise thing to have on getting opinions, but i have noticed, and i will stress that the classification of men into the army is all a rush and waste of time, for an example a tool and die maker before his enduction with 7 years is classed as a cooks helper. time, energy and above all efficiency is going to win this war. why not make use of it in the proper manner.
officers should treat their soldiers & they would get better results the men should be in put in outfits they are most suited for, do to health - or brains

i think soldiers should be put in outfits that they can do the most good. i worked in a store for 8 years and when i came in, they placed me in a machine outfit - which i know nothing about and which i can't grasp at all.

outfits_comment: let the negro together and let the white together
long: one thing i dont like is out all day in the cold weather and the eats we have some times
i've been awol once and am expecting to leave again if given much more detail & extra duty.
why not give a special test for all noncoms, so all will have a fair chance, and not some pet the sgt. likes

outfits_comment: a white man and a negro differ essentially in character.
long: don't know why so much emphasis was put on the colored-white question. personally, always got along well with colored people, whom i like for their many sterling qualities. however, the subject is bound to be a touchy one in a camp of this immense size, where naturally many men from the south are quartered. naturally, colored soldiers would be in the minority, so - who doesn't know how any southern man feels toward a colored one? enough said.

i think a soldier should have better transportation too and from home and even to the closest town. i think its pretty rotten. some of our buses hare at camp are awfully bad. if parents or wife come to visit they should at least get good buses to ride in. the ones we have are jalopies from 1860. that's the way the look anyway. springs pushed out of the seats so no cover on seats. and there pretty dirty.
i got rejected three times and they put me in the toughest outfit. negro soldiers are o.k. in the north but in the south they are treated pretty tough.

outfits_comment: in outfits as a whole, i think separating them would work much better.
long: i think that issuing this questionnaire was very wise, and thoughful in giving the soldiers of the united states army a chance to express their  views of the united states army and similiar instance about the war.

1. grand idea to get the "inner-pulse" of soldiers - hope the information will really be used, and not "just recorded" after all, the soldiers should win the war, and should get some consideration. - especially better food, and more sleep-

it is hard for a man that always did his work to his best ability and find out that his officers or co. does not seem to think so and he stays the same in rank. it is not fair in a way at all. it dont make him feel like he did a good job so therefore he slacks up on his job. spoils his morale on his work. as far as every thing is concerned that is alright. i cant see why a fellow cant wear a bought your sun hat in the service. i think it makes the uniforms look better. as long as he in the us. i should think that he is entilled to wear. they put out this new green felt but for enlisted men in army & navy  and pay $5.50 for them and then that he cant wear a bought hat. they will not issue them  why cant we?
i believe the practice of the army sending men a great distance from their homes (while in the u.s.) is wrong. if a man could get home once in a while i don't believe he would be so dissatisfied.

outfits_comment: there is a difference in living conditions between the two races.
long: i think one mistake was made by drafting men over 38 years old as it seems most medical cases were in camps and hospitals men of that age and over. they are able to do more for this war in factories and other outside jobs than to be in the army with the younger men as officers over them. they are not quick minded and have not the ability of the younger boys to grasp things and to do a job in a hurry and by that hinder the progress of the armed forces.

outfits_comment: i am not opposed to having negro in my outfit
long: i think a negro should have an equal rights with white people because thats one thing we are fighting for, "that all men are created equal"

negro should be given a better life than he now has. i don't believe in negro and white people mixing but a negro is a human being and a citizen and should be given a chance to live a little like one.
is it fair for anyone to obtain a commissin in the army by political influence?

i believe that the army would be a pretty good place if they did not't have to many recruit officers. i don't believe that a man should be an officer with out he has at least five years in the service.
i think that all p.t. should be run by civilians an not soldiers.

outfits_comment: because there would be too many fights amongst the white and blacks
long: if negro & whites were in same outfits, naturally there would be much blood shed. it would lead into serious developments, in the future. in fact i believe we would be fighting two wars, negro & the axis.

negro should be givien the same privileges in the army that we have. because we are all fighting for the same things. but white soldiers should not be allowed to live in the same quarters with them. are have to mingle with them in any public are unpublic place.

outfits_comment: i would want to go "over the hill" if i were put in an outfit with negro and so would any other southerner.
long: this questionnaire asked how i liked the army well before the war i liked it alright for i was in a pursuit squadron where all officers were flyers who had won their bars by going to school the hard way and not by knowing some big shot or politician, which is the circumstances now. i don't begrudge anyone for taking all they can get out of this army. i begrudge the army for being that easy. i think that every man should stand an exam for all he gets in the army. there is too much politics in the army. it's not the question of how good a worker you are in the army nowadays but how good a politician you are. with the officers it's the same thing. they do as much "bricking over" that they can't look after the enlisted personnel under them, naturally, the enlisted men catch the brunt of it all. the officers now a days think too much of their selves and that is all they look out for. i am speaking of the officers in the air corps with whom i have had dealings with.

outfits_comment: i think there would be trouble always between them
long: a lot of the negro i think that we should treat them fair but not too give them to much power in what we are doing or going to do in the future.
this quistionnire doesn't cover army life enough. it only touches the highest points and doesn't go deep enough.

outfits_comment: there would be trouble all the time
long: i think it is a good thing if the right ones read it

outfits_comment: mainly for ther own ease and comfort
the wouldn't get along any to good in the same outfit.

long: one question that should have been asked is the pay of the soldier today. the american soldier is the best soldier in the world. but not the highest paid soldier. i think that a buck private should draw at least 65 dollars a month. as for the rest of the questionnaire i think that it was fine. i also think that a soldier should not have to pay income tax.

i think the boys should be placed where they can do the the things they know, so as, to better serve themselves & country. that out ccommission officers & enlisted men should not be so far apart and work to help each other & our cause.
it is a good idea

something should be done about the food situation. it should be equal. some outfits get plenty to eat and others just have enough to get by.  army is swell for a man. it lears him to use his initiative. some of the officers are hard to get along with

i think divisions or outfits should be shifted from different parts of the u.s.a. not to stay in one camp over a pirod of 6 month it disincourages the soldier to stay at one camp. which makes him dislike the army, but me i love t army of the good old u.s.a.

something should be done about the food situation. it should be equal. some outfits get plenty to eat and others just have enough to get by.  army is swell for a man. it  him to use his initiative. some of the officers are hard to get along with.

outfits_comment: they can get along better in their own outfits.
long: i think it is a pretty good questionnaire.

i believe that soldiers on a whole are not given a far chance to do the job that they are best prepared for and interested in. i also think that if they were given that chance they would take a great deal more interest in doing their jobs. i myself, if not left to work my farm, should have had a mechanic job in the army.

i think our officers are to young and are not very reliable for the position they hold. we have 3 not over 21 and think they can win this war by themselves. they won't give there non coms any backing and run them down to much. the non comm is never right.

i'm not complaining, and i want to do all i can to help win the war. but i know i could do much more on the farm. my dad lives on a 240 acre farm, and one man can't take care of that much land. i have farmed all my life almost.
negro is all right in their place but i dont want to be in the same outfits
i would like to see our young officers get more training on the handling of men and the  between the officers

outfits_comment: same as answer 60.
long: to my opinion the majority of the men in the army did not't expressed any too anxious desired to fight for his freedom. i am no judge of men. maybe when they faced the test they are just as anxious

most or all americans are willing to do their share in protecting their country but married men with families don't see the point of being away from those families if they don't think they are doing any good for their country in their present places and several in our outfit don't including myself.
win this war to help us all is my opinion on the war and soon.

outfits_comment: because thy cant see every thing the same as we can.
long: i think it is good to have these so that they can find out just about what the average soldier would like best of all and it gives them a chance to give it to them.
the questionnaire is too much in detail i think it is very good & it will give you a good idea what the army of today is doing for the young men.
it is a good way to find out the kind of life a soldier wants to live, or what he thinks of the army.

outfits_comment: cause the white and the negro might have trouble.
long: i think this questionnaire is a very fine questions and like thinks like that helps out a person and tell him things that he never knew before in his life.
i think the questionnaire are a good thing cause that give the e.m. men a chance to say what they thing

i would like to see better sergeants in this army because they are stripe happy and they like to climb over us. i think they should take a little easy on us it is a little hard work for us. and i would like to know how could you get a rating in the army.

outfits_comment: i would not want to sleep in the same place, and i don't think you would.
long: well i dont have much to say only, i would like to get out of the army or get some thing i like. the place is fairly good, and the  will  i guess. but i dont think you will take on as much weight. may be some day i will get to talk to you in person, i sue hope so. i sure hope you would try and get me transfer to that camp at chambersbury,  that is an american depot

outfits_comment: same as question. number - 60.
long: they left out the food. here i think there should be something done about it. some soldiers get all the food those are so called chow huns. if you don't get there first well your out of luck. they ought to have different system too see that some doesn't get it all while others half too go over too the p.x. and buy their old stale sandwich. there is no table maners at all. some of the fellows even grabe the food out of your hands. when you go up for coffe or something and come back somebody takes your bread. personal if i should happen too go out for dinner at somebody's place i don't thing i could know how too eat. i'm too getting the same way cause if you don't you go out half starved.

outfits_comment: a negro would probably feel better and have more pride in his outfit were he not in the minority.
long: the army doesn't give the soldier any training that would be useful in future life. the common soldier learns no trade or craft nor gains no experience in any industry that would serve him later on. he does not further his education. the classification tests are a farce, they are not used to put a soldier in his proper niche. {] i will not regret having been in the army because it has improved my health and my body, it has given me more confidence in myself and will discipline me for any hardships that await me in the future.  most of the boys believe the navy has more advantages than the army.
i think it is a good way to find out what the people think about things.

outfits_comment: some of them ought to be pusht up as a blind for the whites to fight.
long: i think it is a good thing to fine out how the enlisted men really likes the army and how they are getting alone in service.

outfits_comment: always keep them separate that make best soldiers
because they don't mix
i like them because they are the greatest morale builders.
long: i was always interested in aeronautics & tried to get into the air corp but my eyes weren't good enough. that left nothing for me to do but wait for the draft.  i was a chemist in a steel mill before being drafted & had an interesting job. i like chemistry very much & with 3 years experience at it i surely do think i would be worth more to the medical corp than the infantry as a messenger.  the above is my reason for the answer to question 52. "what system is used in classifying & placing men?"  i think there would be more interest shown by the men if they were placed where they were most suited. until then, there will be a lot of dissatisfied soldiers.

outfits_comment: probably best to have volunteers for mixed outfits.
long: selection & placing of men is sometimes very poor. psychology is completely & foolishly ignored sometimes even physical qualifications are ignored. result is misfits reducing efficiency. fentive outfit. about the war- we should know exactly what we are fighting for & not be told of the nebulous 4 freedoms. give us concrete details & start working on them now, even as we fight for after the war it may very likely be too late. i'll willingly risk my life if i know i am fighting for something that will benefit humanity but will begrudge my service for another tragical "versailles."
actually i think this branch of the service is one hell of an outfit because they run the hell out of a person.

outfits_comment: i believe the negro would feel out of place in that case
long: in question no. 63 i believe also that the negro can fight better when they are together

as far as my rights of speech is concerned, this questionnaire is a very good idea to see what men really think or like to say in regards of the army and may i add it will bring out the bad points or maybe things will be changed? the army as a whole is a very good place for training & teaching & discipline. as for the army its one the beam, but its the camp your in that changes a lot of opinions.

outfits_comment: when it come to where a negro is allowed in a white outfit then i say to hell with the whole country
long: you ask a lot of question about negro and white, what in the hell are you up to are you trying to interbreed the negro with the white so as to build up a slave labor for  big business

outfits_comment: to be together would most sure to breed discontent amongst the men
long: i think this questionnaire has been very fair in its selections of its questions and their reason.
i don't like the army one bit, but i am in american and i'll do my share until i get out of here. then when i am needed i'll come back.

outfits_comment: because white & negro don't mix
long: being in the infantry i do not have any comments.

outfits_comment: some colored are o.k. but the majority are too unclean. disease rate too high.
long: this survey is really o.k. for one thing it gives a fellow an opportunity to give a complete opinion of army life and affairs.

i have been in three camps and the bus transportation was fairly good, but when a soldier in this camp is lucky enough to get a pass a couple of times a week he has the worst time trying to get transportation to town. we are at one end of the post and the bus station is approximately 3 mile away. one dinky bus comes up to our end of the post every half hour to haul soldiers to the bus station then we have to wait in line for another one up there. there should be a lot more buses provided for this post so we can sit down once in a while and don't have to spend half of our pass time waiting in line for a bus. they jam 50 soldiers in a 30 capacity bus.

i think it would do more good to take all soldier boy over 30 years of age that some from farms and put them back on the farm. i believe they would do more good there than could in the army. after all there has got to some one left on the farm to raise food for the soldiers. food play a big part in winning the war.

outfits_comment: i do not like to mingle with negro
long: you did not ask did we have plenty to eat. sometimes the food is poor and sometime good.

as far as i am concerned i am very well satisfied with the army and have plenty of interest and i am going to put 30 years in. food is excellent clothing is fine and instructers are efficient the army has plenty of opportunities for anyone who wants to get somewheres.

outfits_comment: they work better in separate groups.
long: i don't thing it is right to take any boy under 20 yrs. old into the army. most boys under 20 have never been away from home for a very long period of time.

the only thing i can't see about the army is the way men are transferred in grade from one camp to another and after being taught perhaps for years one type of work, is expected to go to another camp and perhaps be given another type of work which he is expected to be able to do simply because he holds the rating that fits that job. about 50% of the soldiers transferred with my outfit eventually were busted simply because they were unable to perform the job expected of them, when they had been trained in another type of work
well theres one thing i dont like about the state its to damn cold here....

outfits_comment: refer to no. 60
long: i think that the officers lower the  morale of the soldiers by the stories they tell.

outfits_comment: same as preceding questions keep peace within the outfits!
long: i think the questions about negro are superfluous. even though i'm from the north i'm sure i wouldn't want to share px{army exchange], or service clubs or be in the same outfits.  one trouble with present army is that it too often requires a "break" to get into something worthwhile where you are properly placed. however they seem to be trying earnestly to remedy this condition.

outfits_comment: i believe that they should have equal rights and privileges, but both whites and negro would get along better among themselves
long: i take comments in this particular case to mean gripes, and i have a few. #1 . the army does not seem to have a very good system of selecting noncom officers, and does not seem to realize that importance of selecting the right ones. they are the leaders who live with the men and give most of the orders to the men. one non-competent noncom can wreck a whole organization.  there has been a good deal written about the army classification system, but i have failed to see it at work in our organizations. when i entered the army i was told that i had done very well in my intelligence test and i can admit without bragging that i am a better than average mechanic. on the other hand, (over) i am not in very good physical condition, and can not get along too well with people. to and behold, here i am in the infantry, where ruggedness and leadership are at a premium, and intelligence seems merely to be a hindrance.  the conditioning we get seems to be to sporadic. for a week or two we will be worked almost beyond endurance and then we well kill time for a few weeks. the training program seems to be very shortsighted in this and a number of other ways. for instance, we spend weeks leaving the assembly and functioning of a weapon we will never have an opportunity of handling. i could cite examples like this all day, but i am running out of paper and wind, but give me an address to mail to in the atterbury crier, and i will be glad to keep you posted and offer amateur advice

my advise about the air corps. i dont know how the line out outfit is. is that they have to money bosses. one man tell you one thing and another man tell you another. and now a non-comm has no more privilige then a pvt. the pvt. are having it lots easey then we did.  and here in the u.s. we should have more privilege then we get. and when we go over see all privileges should be cut out. and fight and get this thing over with.

at the local theater, the doors for officers & enlisted men should be opened at the same time. showing preference to the officers fifteen cents admission & showing more courtesy is causing ill feeling among the enlisted men which should not exist during war time. as long as one theater services both classes of men, equality should be shown for the goodofmoral of all concerned. this is probably the most noticed & prevailing fault of eglin field. we are all in the army to serve.
they show to damn much distinction between officers and enlisted men when attending the theater. i think officers should try to cooperate more with enlisted men.

outfits_comment: by all means keep them separated
good idea to keep them separated, keep down trouble
long: i think the army is unfair to most tech. school men in, that they are in school and casual outfits from six to ten months, with out the chance for ratings or furloughs that other branches of the service offers.
in most of the camps (six) i have found that some of the officers do not seem to be very friendly. in most cases they seem to think they are better than the enlisted men.

personally i'm not one who gripes. i live for today and do not fret the day i haven't seen. i do what i'm told and do it just as well as the next soldier. if i'm helping to win this war, i am wondering when i'll start. if chopping wood, k.p. picking up cigarettes, matches etc is being a soldier and helping to get this war over with then i'll be damned. i don't want to be a civilian again until after the war, but some kind of defense job would be doing more for my country then what i'm doing now. as far as myself, i'm not helping one bit and the future as far as i see it doesn't hold anything in store for me as far as being a soldier.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
long: promotions are usually given for longevity or favoritism and not for personal ability.
all i want is a discharge after the war

outfits_comment: see question 60
long: these questionnaires should bring about a few small changes for the good of the individual and army as a whole.  i think there was too much indecision shown by cades at camp where i received my basic training and from talking with many others came to the conclusion it was a general state. that was in june to sept. 1941, however so maybe this condition was cleared up.
the army is a good place for every man if he is able to be in the army.
shouldn't't we lessen the barrier between enlisted men and officers?

outfits_comment: they would tend to separate anyway, so efficiency would be lost if they were placed in the same outfit.
long: think this is a splendid idea. hope that the results are acted upon in so far as they represent the thought of the majority of thinking soldiers regarding problems that are not merely selfish and personal. would be a tragedy if these results would simply collect statistical dust in some hidden shelf in washington. one small gripe: are you familiar with the poor service and cavalier treatment usually accorded soldiers in many px? could be looked into.

outfits_comment: they work better when working with their own race.
long: organization commanders should encourage rather than discourage men from transferring to new, stations or branches, or for making applications to officers training schools. one requisite for choosing officers should be a complete understanding of human nature.
older men where drafted with expectation of taking places of younger men for combat duty, however these younger men could not be removed for jobs the older could do and where relegated to scrap heap.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: but not in same room eating or sleeping.
long: i think this is a good questionnaire for a soldier that's always kicking about things of the army way. also it gives him and ideal of what he might expect of doing and getting while being in the army.

outfits_comment: their living conditions have been different in civilian life, so i feel they would be just as uncomfortable as white race.
long: i am an ordinary pvt. in the army, giving up no more or no less than millions of others so i will try to do my best and make the best of it for myself what ever my lot may be and hope for a speedy and, and a victorious united nations with peace terms at our own dictates.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: should have separate sleeping quarters, though

long: experienced men should be put into jobs which they are best qualified for and positions which they are experienced.  many gruadates of technical schools are never given an oportunity to use their training.

outfits_comment: they would feel more natural among themselves just as the different national combat groups serving in england feel at home with people of their own.
long: i would like to see some sort of rating examinations in the noncom grades. these exams could count halfway toward attainment of a higher grade, the other half being seniority, leadership and longevity in the army. at present there are too much politics and "pull" in ratings and in a large outfit a soldier may never get promoted if he doesn't personally know any of the upper-bracket men.

outfits_comment: the good record the negro will establish will be their's alone.
long: a questionnaire of this sort is not qjuite what i would like to have in expressing my views entirely. it is, however, a good idea to have these quizzes as it enables a man to express his honest and innermost thoughts. still each answer seems as though it should be qualified or, at least, explained. for instance, i believe that the negro should be granted the same privileges as a white, but, however, not all at once, for i dont believe the vast majority of them are capable of using those privileges as yet. perhaps, education and a closer contact with refined people will better outfit them for those responsibilities.

outfits_comment: it doesn't look good for a negro and a white man to be together
a white man will not obey a negro, or vice- versa
long: i think a soldier should be stationed at his home town if possible, he would see more of his people, and take more interest in his work, in other words it would be like a cilvilian job  i would want a rating because it would mean more money
in answering no 54 i would want to explain my present job to him and by abilities and see if he thought i was doing as much good at the job i now hold there i could do in some other work -
i either want to do something besides what i am doing or get out of the army as soon as possible.

outfits_comment: the same as question 62
long: pertaining to our work here & at other fields & posts, i feel that the government is wasting valuable manpower & money by training men for certain specific duties & then placing them in jobs that less skilled men could handle. for example: we have a depot here at which quite a few civilians work as mechanics, machinests, etc, while on the line we have men who have been equally if not better trained to qualify in the same positions. why not work enlisted men in the sub-depots and release the civilian workmen for private indrusty where they are badly needed.

questions 50 and 51 are two questions i'm not able to answer, because i've never been run in by a town police or an m.p. either. and all i could tell about the fairness of the town police and m.p. toward a soldier is hear say and not what i know.

outfits_comment: blood that won't intermix should not fight side by side in battle.
long: the white & negro question is of long standing. a negro should have all rights and freedom as he has in our country. he is a human being and has feelings and a soul, given him by god. however god has placed between us a barrier of color. so therefore we must accept this barrier and live, fight, and play separately with no malice or ill-feeling between us. since we respect each other as free red-blooded men but realize intermingling freely presents unsurmountable obstacles.

outfits_comment: they should have their own negro officer but when necessary all (white & black) should work together and fight together
long: i don't believe that the army changes a man actually but in giving authority to some, it sometime goes wrong & the individual takes uneccesary advantages there is in some enstances to much of a division between enlisted men & officers example (allowing all officers & wives or friend into theaters before enlisted men) this question is pretty much complete but some questions are not clear and do not entirely cover the subject & some of the answers to be selected from do not clearly explain them or answer the question

outfits_comment: white boys    and better
long: i would stay in the army if i could get a increase in my pay as i can just make it.   as all my laundry cleaning  take a little. the army is a good place if the boys would get together and wash like people should.

outfits_comment: because of race.

long: this is a very good idea and i hope that some of my thoughts will aid our government in bringing about a more unified army and government.

outfits_comment: same as 60 above

long: when i enlisted in the army i was given personnel work for about 9 months and liked it very much. after that time that particular section was broken up and i was put in in operations against my will. since that time i have been lax and not at all interested in the work because i hate it.  why the hell]/] don't the army put a man where they can get the most out of him and give him a job he likes.  i am waisting my time and drawing $78.00 a month for nothing.
i am not a very good writer and i cant think of any thing to say. but i do think we are doing a good job.

it seems that the men that want to go accross to combat do not get to go where the men who do that will not to go home to go. there is definetey a waist of man power & equipment at all fields and especially here. men & goods that could & want to be used against the enemy. i think all men who volinteered into the service should be given first choice over all thing's alone the men who hung back until they were drafted.
personally, i have no objection to being around negro as long as they don't abuse there privileges and me.

outfits_comment: not now. the civil war hasn't been completely forgotten yet.
long: question 51 - the m.p. here seem to step out of the way at times to make trouble. don't know about other places in war times

i am referring to question #20. i am not interested in my job, because ther is practically nothing to do. i feel that i have the  qualifications for a better job,  one in which i would be of some use to the

outfits_comment: southern boys & negro boys would have a war with each other if they were together
long: southern men don't feel like the men from the northern states do about negro and for this reason  think the negro  would do better if they were kept in a separate outfit.

in all probability we will have another depression if we don't have something done now to prevent it (40) in most post theaters there is to much distinction giving officers and wives comparing to enlisted men and wives because i dont like my or another man wive  out of line for an hour or so of pleasure in a theater.

outfits_comment: white and negro soldiers together would not work out at all
long: enlisted men's ratings are not controlled enough in the army. in a new outfit too many green men with only a technical school diploma are given too high a rating whereas in an old outfit in wartime everybody is behind in the ratings. the old men aren't high enough and the new men have not a chance. in many cases a new outfit moves in with an old one and there is plenty of friction.

you separate the negro from the white but you don't separate the northern negro from the southern negro and when you try to put those two together well it doesn't seem to work out to well from what i have seen of them.
this questionnaire deals too greatly with the status of negro. why not make a separate form for negro? naturally anyone will recommend giving negro more opportunity.

outfits_comment: about the same as #60 and #62
i am a southerner
i'm a rebel
long: it isn't fair for two men doing the same thing to be rated differently. a man in an old outfit should rate the same as a man in a new one if they have been in the same length of time.
there is to much standing in line waiting to get orders and most places of entertainment a soldier always has to stand in line and wait
why is it left up to non commissioned officers to pick men for a rating?

you cant please everyone all the time. i dont like the idea of mixing races. you could suggest taking a soldier's income tax out, like his insurance it wouldn't "hurt" so bad. after all its a darn good army to be in.
the questionnaire doesn't taken in enough life within the camp, such as living conditions etc.

speaking of our theater why does the enlisted man, all ranks, have to stand in line and wait until all commissioned officers and civilians are seated before he is allowed to enter. why should our off duty passes be good only until 10:45 pm when all other outfits on the field are good until 1 am
my reason for not liking foreign service is because i hate to think of killing anyone

outfits_comment: boys from the south could not be satisfied in the same outfit with negro.

long: if this war is fought to a finish like it should be, there should be no more war for a much longer time than twenty five years. after the war a system of policing should be set up so that no country could ever endanger the world again. no one country should have any more power than any other because that is the cause of the wars. the man in control of a warring faction is very seldom more than a puppet who is put in that position for a purpose either good or bad.

i would want very much to be a first class mechanic but i know now that being away from school for 16 years it is pretty hard to study about something you don't know anything about. i feel as though a man should be put to work on the line for about two months and then sent to school to study the theory of the plane and i think he would get much more from it
i think a soldier would do more work and better work if he were placed in a section of the country where he liked it best.

regardless of rank of any man in the army the majority of the men are working to-gather. if a private is doing his best at what he has been assigned (and often he has been given something he knew nothing of before) he is doing as much his part as any non-comm or officer -- the best he can. we are working to-gather and not for each other. if some in authority would realize this they would get better co-operation from the men below them.
it seems more from the north are placed in camps in the south farther way from their home than the south. why is this or prehaps its so - so maybe.

(1) if the army wastes money to train men for certain fields & believe they should be put to some use  (2) also i believe we aught to have a better clasification system of men in the armed forces in order to put their civl knowledge to use in the army. (i know of a good many instances where this has not been done (3) all increases in rank should be made by competive exams

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: everybody is alike.
long: none.

to my mind questions 53 through 63 are entirely out of place in this questionnaire. from the looks of it, this questionnaire has for its purpose the improvement of the whole army, not to stir up old questions decided in 1865. let's get the war over first, then worry about the negro. they seem to be getting along all right without any complaint, so why not leave well enough alone. the answers to these questions should be predictable merely on the basis of the place of the answerers residence. () question 49 defends in its answer a) a/on whether a soldier is in the outfit for which is is suited b) whether his personality makes him adapt himself easily to a different kind of life and c) whether he has any latent ability in the field in which he is in
the white & negro questions are silly on my part. why don't you let us beef about the chow!

outfits_comment: black & white won't mix.
long: to much devoted to race not enough to the well fair of the white soldier.

outfits_comment: they must show the public what they can do themselves
because white people & negro never did get along.

long: men longest in service should get chance to get overseas, even though they are said to be indispensable where they are at. many commanding officers will not transfer the to an active unit, and good men go sour on the routine job they have.
why not let every one select his job that he is best qualified for. instead of putting him in a place that he is not at all interested place all service men officers and enlisted men on equal bases.
there is too many men in the army now and they do not know what to do with us. this has been vacation and the treatment has been good by both man - come and commisioned  officers.

outfits_comment: who wants to mix with them (i dont)
long: eats in most parts of the army is foul - i think is is inexperienced personnel doing the cooking  there is too many men in the army doing nothing worth while that could be doing a great deal in war production service.  have a better program of handing out ratings. some outfits are very slow while other are very fast.  the midnight curfew is very good if soldier could stay until midnight most have to be home by 2245.

outfits_comment: negro think they are as good whites and whites know they are better it will not work

long: you might ask if the person being questioned would be doing more for the cause & war; if he were put on a job he handled well in civilian life. the army has about as many jobs to offer as can be found in the u.s.a. some men are trained for jobs that could be filled by men who have already had experience in that line of work & could handle it equally as well or better.

outfits_comment: i have worked both and it is definitely my opinion they should work separate.
they shouldn't't be allowed to mix when possible.
long: i believe this a very good plan in feeling out every mans attitude about his army life and conditions for the betterment of all concerned.

outfits_comment: if they are in the same outfit preference would be shown one way or the other
long: in my opinion this questionnaire is trying to find out what a cross section of the soldier thinks about army life as a whole and whether compulsory military training would be held in a favorable regard after the war is over. after sixteen months of army life i have formed through personal experience and observation that the army is a great political machine, for instance a clerk in a office comes in contact with the officer in charge every day, and gets higher ratings as he goes along where as a mechanic on the line or other worker never come in contact with the officer and never get advanced.

outfits_comment: there would be to many fight with the negro and the white

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: it is the only way for understanding each other
long: speaking about transportation, why must a soldier on furlough be kicked around on trains or buses. civilians who have no place to go but are riding just to be doing something. soldiers have stand up most of their trips on trains and eat last on dining cars. if this question were asked each soldier, he would have plenty to say. a soldier on furlough is just a dog when it comes to riding a bus or train on furlough. i am not referring to army buses or trains. i think civilians who have only good reasons to ride buses or trains should be allowed to use then.
are these questionnaire a waste of time or are they really used to help the service men now and after the war?

outfits_comment: they wouldn't get along together
long: should ask more questions in general, more about the war. how their living conditions are in the army, and what they think about them.

outfits_comment: they get along much better in an outfit of their own.
long: i think all experienced farm labor should be entitled to help their country by raising food & supplies for the fighting men & production workers.
i like the army pretty much but at times it gets worrisome but after all its not so bad. i would like it swell if i were stationed closer to home.

the questionnaire is a good one. one of the faults of this army are the red tape in - valued causing an additional expenditure of money and what do they accomplish. are the opinions of an ordinary soldier taken in and digested by the "higher ups" or so called officers - - - no; whether the opinions be good or bad they never have a chance, for the simple reason the guy doesn't have enough rank. now you - - - will you look at this questionnaire - - - maybe - - - will you look at all of them and take action  to the likes and dislikes of the thousands of questionnaires. or just file them in the wastepaper basket, if you dont, why are the men  administering this questionnaire being paid, time, travel,  printing etc - - act, with speed and accuracy after all this war runs that way - - -speed and accuracy in everything.

i believe skilled mechanics & workmen 35 & over should be taken from the army by the government & placed in defense jobs in cases where the soldier can't secure a defense letter and younger men be placed in the army. no man over 35 is any good as a fighter and only wastes taxpayers money as a soldier which only makes for a high rate of casualities and a longer war. all other old men who are unskilled should be placed on farms where they can do some good.
i was a printer for the u.s. army map service before the wor. i think i would be of more service in a map unit, instead of an infantry outfit
for all i have to say it would take a sheet of paper a mile long. so i won't say it.
i think this  or near by towns could arrange for some entertainment for the soldiers
they should get a furlough at least every four month i think
we don't have enough recreation when we do have time off.

outfits_comment: because the south don't like negro that good.
long: i think they should get old officers for co. commanders. because a 1st. lieutenant. being in the army for 2 or 3 years don't know enough about handling men.
some of the officers are not fair to the men
why did not't they ask the soldier about the red cross is it so full of  that they are afraid to do so. for if so they are right there is very little good comes from the red cross as it is.

this questionnaire has asked quite a few questions about negro. my only comment is that they should not be forced to be together, i don't believe the negro, like to mix with white people any more than whites like to mix with negro.

outfits_comment: one would make a grave mistake if he tried to mix them up

long: my captain is not just, and he does not give us much time off, he give us extra duty for no reason, single men get leave from camp only on sat. from 5 o'clock and we have to be back at 11 p.m. we cannot get in town till about 8 p.m. so i believe that camp buckner is the worst camp in the u.s.a. and the morale in this camp is very low, in fact some of the lieutenant. are complaining

i would like to say again, that there are many men in this camp who are physically unfit to be here. it doesn't do any good to go to the dispensary because they won't listen to you or call you outfit. many men are too old. some on limited service would be turned down by insurance companies. i myself was turned down on insurance before entering service. these men all would be valuable men on the outside. but i believe detrimental in the service. why do they keep complaining about man power and keep it all bottled up. it's an expense to everybody.
the worst thing we have here is inskictions it makes a soldier hate his own officers. once in a while is and enough but things here has been run in the ground.

outfits_comment: would be for benefit of both races
long: in question number 24, it is an ambiguos question.  i think it is worthwhile, while i am in the army, but not for civilian life or when i leave the army.

outfits_comment: they can't work together.
long: i think it was a good thing to get a few oppinions of some of the men.
that they shouldn't't expect the same service from an olderly soldgier; that they should take in consideration a man over 40 can't not be as active as a younger one.

the war dept. should select more officers from the ranks to lead men; instead of some of the officers driving the men when they can't do the job themselves. men will do the job well if the officers would use common ways of handling the men. maybe the standards of officers are to high, but what i have seen here in this camp, a person had rather be enlisted anytime, than to be an officer. the officers think they are much to good for the men.

i would like to know why our outfit only, doesnot get a week end pass of an overnight pass. for every other outfit in this camp does i know. they just let the married men get them. for i think we are just in getting one. we are all soldiers in the army. haulf the time we are lucky to get an 8 hr pass. for i know our outfit would be more pleased with the army then ever before i that would just happen. i thank you.
explain someday just what good will be derived from this

outfits_comment: i do not know how the black soldiers take to whites.
because some of the negro people are very dirty and
when men live, bath, sleep and eat together negro become very un-desirable for their odor and habits.
long: the army is a great help to those who would only realize the fact and use it to good advantage. to the others it is a breeding place for discontempt and criminal intentions. while based in the u.s. it's my opinion the men should have a little more liberty. and camps like this should be banned.

this war is serious - we are playing for "keeps." - resposibility and promotions should be made on the basis of ability - "not personality." thorough training requires - thoughtful truly - rigid desicipling synchronized with general adaptabilty to vizulize an ultimate result. personally - so far as advancement is concerned - i could junk many of the books i have purchased. lets put the son of the millionaire with the bricklayer - make the best man an n.co. damn - the bickerings and trivial difference make merit - the basis of promotion

outfits_comment: because there is a lot of negro that don't like the whites
long: i am satisfied in the army, but i am married and my wife is all alone and i don't like the south its too hot down here, but otherwise i think the army life is all right. the civilians down here don't treat a soldier very good as they do in the north.
