outfits_comment: some ar not so clene as the wihte people

long: to have more cooperation better the officer and the men and to get to know them better

i have been in this army for nine months, went to an a.m. school for 4 1/2 months, went to an advanced school for one month. had promises of a rating after the school and also promises of a furlough after 6 months i have neither now and cant possibly get a furlough to get home to see my wife which i was willing to give up to come into this army & fight for our country. in this outfit one reason for not getting a furlough is not enough time but if nine months dont entitle a fellow to a furlough i wonder how long he will have to stay in before he gets one. it is only in this outfit that furloughs are not given out. all the rest of the outfits on this field have their furloughs when their time comes up. they could keep the fellows more satisfied and they would work better if they were given their furloughs.

i personally don't care to mix with negro but i realize that they are also playing a part in this war. this war may help but i don't believe we will ever be able to mix races as the french do - the american outlook on such things is different. the countries we are fighting use men wearing glasses in the front lines - why don't we? i have not done one single thing since i've been in the army except fall in - fall out - skin it back and sign here. is this country fighting or only wasting money? why can't the army take tests for promotions and not rely on drag & seniority, the nay does.
about the negro i dont think the negro and white should be in the same word in the hospital

1. why let civilians take up space in our theater, to buy from the px?  2. why not let fellows working on the line have furloughs? they would be much more satisfied if they could see their brothers sisters folks + sweethearts.  3. i've been in the army 10 months, graduated from technical school as power plant specialist on a plane. that work calls for a rating of some kind + fellows that have been in 3 months are corporals taking care of the latrine. we studied hard for seven months to get a specialists rating. why can't we have one?

1. why do officers and civilians have more rights in our base theaterthan us soldiers we pay as much as they do. 2. why can't us soldiers that are working out on the line get furloughs? and the fellows that work in the offices get them. when we ask them for one they always give us some kind of excuse. 3. and why doesn't us fellows get ratings that work on the line? after all we work longer than the men in the office and we get all over oil and grease but the men in the office still have more nights for furloughs and ratings

we spend to much time doing nothing to help win the war. most of us would have done more for our country at home the same length of time we have been in the army. the food is not what most people in civilian life think a soldier is getting. and that is why most of them is giving up a lot of things.

outfits_comment: we was always a fine people and we give them  later.
long: i am a  orderly and could do much more in civilian life to win this war. i am over age and had the wrong conception of this army in the first place. this is a young mans war to fight. i mean actually in combat. i know i could not stand for the drilling and fighting as were a man half my age.  there fore i think i would be of more value on the outside doing war work and buying bonds.

we spend too much time doing nothing. the food is not what a soldier considers good, just a mess cooked up by a bunch of boys. the boys, all of them are wanting to be of some benefit in helping to win the war. but its a slim chance they have here. no matter how hard you work, in this particular squadron you never get a rating. i also think that all limited-service men should be put in a defense factory to help with the manpower shortage. there they could do more in winning the war. (sooner.)
my opinion is that if we would get over there and start fighting we would get this thing over with.
why does a soldier have o beg for a furlough when hes been in 11 months, & then only given the runaround?

outfits_comment: never put them together because of friction between them.
long: i'm particularly peeved because of s.s. recruits getting ratings like sgts and above after 3 to 6 mos. service while it takes volunteers twice to three times longer to make the same ratings.

outfits_comment: because thy get along better with there kind

long: this questionnaire is all right. it gives us enlisted men a chance to express our minds.

outfits_comment: southern people do not put negro on social equality
long: at the rate this war is going it can last indefinitely as i don't think we're doing as much as we could to bring it to a close. all the common people are anixous to end the war as soon as possible so that they may return home to their loved ones and a normal way of life. to many people are using this war as a get rich quick ckeme. soldiere are fighting this war and paying for it. for example i am a s/sgt and have charge of thirteen men. we buy war bonds and donate to the red cross every month. this month we bought $400 worth of bonds and donated $44 to the red cross. that's why i say we are fighting the war and paying for it. let's get it over with

for the air mechanic student, who spends 6 months, and about $1500 of the government money going to school, it is a waste of it. they don't give him a chance when he gets through school. one forgets all he learns in school.

outfits_comment: i'm still from the south.
most any peoples are better satisfied to themselves and among their own kind.
long: despite the fact, that regardless of race-creed-or color, were all allies - colored people really seem to enjoy being together and separated from the white people because they understand each other better - and in being in separate outfits avoid confusion and have a feeling of accomplishment and a better chance for competitive achievements.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: negro can labor better in heat and bad conditions and the white men have the intelligence to operate more complicated machines
long: any soldier who has received specialized training when assigned to an outfit you be entitled to a rating. where i am now you have to belong to a clan or an organization to get a rating. my ideas of officers and non-coms are fellows who should be leaders not men to kick the fellow below them like sand under their shoes.  when you are entitled to a furlough you should be able to get it with out begging and tipping the higher ups.

outfits_comment: give them a better chance for advancement
i think it would cause less trouble, especially here in the south.
long: i have been in the army seven months and i can not get a furlough. and there is no reason for not getting it sometimes we have two many men for the amount of work we have here. the only time they give a furlough is when it is an emergency.

i think men in the army should be put in service where they are best qualified as to the work they did in civilian life. promises should not be made to soldiers by officers when they know they will not be granted them. a soldier should be given a furlough as often as he is eligible instead of letting some have two when some have had none

outfits_comment: same reason
long: i think the army camps are run too much like a kindergarten. we are not treated like grown men. more like a bunch of kids. there is no system what ever. they tell you one thing one day and the next day they curse you out for not doing something entirely different from what was first told us. also, they send us to an a.m. school to be specialists and we got to a camp afterwards to do k.p. not that i object to k.p. but why should a fellow go to a.m. school to get it? we could pull k.p. without going to a.m. school. also they put non coms over us on the line that have never been to an a.m. school. in other words i think they run the army just backwards.

outfits_comment: prejudice
long: good questionnaire. its up to you to get action on the results.

outfits_comment: until the present conditions & friction is eliminated defnitely a good policy
long: according to the failure of former international diplomatic organizations, a revised form of the league of nations with enforcement facilities & compulsory membership, should be formed as part of a plan for total victory in this war.

i have been in the u.s. army for eight months. i spent four months going to a.m. school and five weeks of schooling at baltimore. we had promises of ratings and furloughs after finishing school and have had neither as yet. with no hope of getting any in this outfit. the reason we haven't got a furlough is because  i haven't had enough time in the army. if eight months is not enough how long is enough? if the fellows would work better and be more satisfied if they could get furloughs. this is the only outfit on the post that don't allow furloughs only in case of emergency. and why? what became of the 3 day passes.

we were promised ratings if we would go to a.m. school. i promised all the dirty work if we did not't go. the way it has turned out the general duty bay have all the rating & we have none. we were told the general duty soldiers would pull k.p. & etc. & we wouldn't, hell we are the ones doing it, while our planes do without us, but the latrine can't do without their orderlys for a k.p. hitch. we have from 10 to 20 men to each plane & we can't do our honest share of work. i was separated from my wife that i had been married to for 5 years while theres still plenty of young men left in my home town that got married just to dodge the draft. then they asked if we think we are getting treated fair. they treat us like school boys when after all i am a full grown man willing to do a full days work.

outfits_comment: tho i do approve of white officers
long: in my opinion the morale of soldiers on this field is very low, especially in my outfit. the officers talk about cooperation but they don't cooperate with us. in our outfit it seems that a m/sgt has more authority that a commissioned officer i know of some case where he assumed things that he shouldn't't have. the chow here is terrible. and i am supposed to be a specialist but i have to do common duty. in our outfit we have 200 mechanics for 5 aircraft. i know of me who "washed out" of the tech school i attended and are now st sgt but i am a specialist but am still a buck private. all total i think this is a piss poor outfit and could give more statements for my reason in saying that. excuse my slang. please!!

outfits_comment: because the white and the negro are hard to get along.
long: i don't believe they should take a married man away from his family to a differed state, when in his own state he got the same kind of camps. and better chance to be close to his family and any case i believe when a married man is drafted he should stay in his own state.

outfits_comment: the whites and negro will never mix to the extent of living together
long: i would like to know why a man with ability enough to pass his i.q. test with a high enough grade for the government to send him to a technical school and spend the peoples money training him for a job isn't worth more to the government and deserves more money than an ordinary man who did not get the grade on his i.q. example: there is a man in this outfit who was a master mechanic outside. he was an american and thought it his duty as a single man to join the army and do his part. he has been in 12 month now and has been through an a.m. school and an advanced school. why is he still a private and cannot get even a furlough when some men come in and make sgt in 5 months and get a furlough in 5 or six months

outfits_comment: would be better for morale
long: why should we who have gone to school & work kp & why we who have had practical mechanical training & can prove we know more than non-comm over us on  get no chance to work--why do we get promises of ratings & then don't get them--we go to school & have been in army 10 months & are still buck privates but others who have less time in army have staff ratings. some in army without schooling & previous experiences get ratings 6 weeks after coming in--we get no chance to work--20 or 30 men working on a plane--& we loaf 75% of time--nothing to do--hell! ship us to some other base & open up another squad-- wake up! damn it!

outfits_comment: too many white soldiers are prejudiced against the negro
long: i'd like to see action on this questionnaire. a little more cooperation from our superior officers in regard to a mans abilities. duties. & furloughs. to consider him as a man and not something not outfit to associate with. too many non coms here forget that they were once privates. i also would like to see my superior officers keep their word & give a definite answer when a question is asked from them. i would also like to see the men go on furloughs during slack periods.

outfits_comment: they work better alone in one group.
white and negro don't mix.

long: i am an expert mathematician and know the operation of fire control instruments but at my age (37) the physical requirements of field service keeps me rather tired out continually i feel that i could be a valuable asset to the army attached to a field artillery or air corps technical school or air ordnance plant much more so than my present job
i think there is too much congestion one officer tells you one thing another tells you another thing.
i believe that married men in pease times make better soldiers than single men, they do not get in as much trouble

no other comments other than to say that the negro should be given as much chance as possible to succeed in life. if a negro is willing to fight and die alongside of you he should be given as much chance of getting ahead as the white people have. just because a man is born colored should not condemn him the rest of his life. this is what we are fighting for, equality for all regardless of race, creed and religion.

i found no question about inspections. we have far to many of them and gain nothing in the way of valueabl information. it takes us to much working hours and the men must work over time to gain back the lost time. this lowers their morale. inspections are necessary but lets have a few less.  this is war but i still think the enlisted men should have passes more often. this will raise their morale and i believe better work would result.
i think this a good idea and it should help at least a little bit.
i think some of the officers should practice more what they preach

in this particular camp we do not have enough recreation all we have is a show. no dances - no towns worth while to go to - if they are they are off limits.  i don't like the army and i'm in it just to get the war over with.

outfits_comment: too much race hatred
long: too much race hatred

outfits_comment: should not be mixed in with white soldiers at all
long: i believe each soldier should be given more of a chance to prove his ability and the right kind of work

outfits_comment: the same reason as in 62.
same as question 60 & 62
long: they expect a lot in a short time about the work. just as you are getting things into your head about the instruments and things about a howitzer, they have you worried about some sort of an examination. we are crowed in our barracks now and have a hard time keeping everything straight. i think it would be better to have more time on the howitzers and learn every particle that's to be known and not worry about all kinds of examinations. i work hard to make our section the best in the battery, and i don't mean maybe.

i think the negro should be classed as equal to white people because we are all fighting for the same cause and a negro is black because his mother and father were black. i think color prejudice should be wiped out.

outfits_comment: they get along better among themselfs
long: medical treatment are pretty bad

outfits_comment: keep them in place

long: i have no other comments then that they had to many inspection and a little to much to the extream on them

outfits_comment: same reason i put on question 62
long: the question that dealt with asking the president three questions i would like to go oversea instead of staying here i realize my job in the army has it purpose in winning the war but i joined to army to see action and go across. i hope that this day will come soon.

outfits_comment: did you ever smell a billy goat?
long: negro and whites should never under any circumstance be quartered or fed to-gather. the southerners would be very much opposed to it -- and i do mean opposed -- from the beginning and the northerners would regret it eventually. the negro themselves would be lost if put on an equal footing with the whites. it is my contention that very few negro can use authority properly.

there is only one comment or gripe as i might say - in our outfit we have quite a few men whom have had quite a bit of experience on the line + who are graduate mechanics from a. m. school. i for one. yet, they will put us on guard + put new men out on the line that have had practically no experience with airplanes whatsoever. why - in all of god's world, do they do those things?

good idea it tells how majority of men feel about the war and it gives confidence and realization of what we are really fighting for freedom of speech there was no gun pushed in my back telling me where to put my x mark
if this questionnaire filled in would be of any help, then it would be a good thing, otherwise i cant see any use for it as personal opinions don't win wars.

outfits_comment: no white soldier wants to work with a negro, and they are not good mixers
well i just don't like the  like i'm no way. the  are very poor at this camp now. i feel as if  is more at home then in the army. i have only got one  and only bad feet
long: well i just don't like the army life in no way. the eats are very poor at this camp now. i feel as if i could do more at home than in the army i have only got one eye and very bad feet.

some of these questions may never come to pass. we may never have some of the things it mentions such as jobs after the war. it digs in to the private affairs of some persons answering this questionnaire.

outfits_comment: because of riots which will take place most of the time.
long: being that i have only been in the army seven months i haven't had the chance to take place in actual combat duty, i am hardly in a position to state any comments towards the army or against it. but up till now the army seems to be all right. that is if a soldier could get into some thing he is interested. but it seems that once you get into a branch, or outfit your stuck + can't get out unless you have some sort of enfluence or some one pulling strings for you.
as a guard i have very little freedom. very seldom can get out of camp to relieve your mind from your duty for a little while

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: i believe they should be separate and still in same outfit, it's possible to work for the same ideals and end.
long: i believe some questions on the statues of the soldier, being released from the service, should be included in a survey of the sod. as example. will the ex soldier get a job will he be refused his job he held privious to being drafted not enough stress on soldiers place after war. some questions were too general, for example dealing with negro. most of question fair however not enough choice what the people of big cities think of soldiers coming into town for a little recreation, most of them look down and just think of getting his money.

outfits_comment: the colored soldiers can operate better if they are put together & the same to the white soldiers.
long: the first thing about all of this questionnaire it is to find out my opinion as a soldier. since i enlisted in the army i have been on guard duty. i myself being young & quite active could could contribute my services to my country very much better if i could be put in a fighting branch. i have tried to be transferred and they tell me you can transfer out of the air camp. i would enlist for four years if i could only get out of here. having a fair knowledge of the army & its ways of operation and also having a love to be a top rated soldier. i could readily say, that i would be a 100% more good to the army in the young man's place. guard takes all of the good things out of a young man & makes him feel as if he doesn't have a thing left to live for. guard should be for older men that can't qualify for overseas service. the army is not making a man out of me, but destroying me. i enlisted to become a good soldier & a good built man.

i personally think the negro should have as much rights as the whites, there fighting for the country too. but people of the south don't look at that say, they too selfish. some army camps a very good and some other a very poor. i think the enlisted men should have more of a chance, to transferred from the air corp to any branch of the service.
i think all men over 38 would be of more serves on farms or war plants than in the serves for most of them are not outfit for comfort serves

why doesn't the government discharge all men over 38 and all limited service men to work as farm labor or to go in defense factories as the work these men do here is of no value to the war effort, the biggest majority of these men are not qualified for army work and could do more to help their country in these war industries, the government is needing these men now according to reports as now is the time to act.

outfits_comment: same
long: in this particular outfit, they could be more fair in giving out ratings, and not just pick out the men they know best. in my opinion they should be very careful in choosing non-coms. also they are not very fair about giving out furloughs, they give out to some men who have been here six or even five months, while some one else who has been here longer can't get any at all. also, when one man in the outfit has to fall out for a roll call, everyone should have to.

outfits_comment: they should be separate for their own good

long: we should have saturday afternoon and wednsday after noon off. every body but the 87th med amb. bn. does.
i find most of the question satisfactory to my opinion

outfits_comment: there will be less confusion.
long: am not sure this is the thing to write here, but it's my opinion - read it or leave it. it happens that i could have been deferred and turned it down. i wanted to go & i want to do my duty more. something must be done to keep the men in the correct rank. one cannot respect a man who is far above him and who all the men in the squadron knows can't cut the buck. there is either far too many stripes in this army or else not enough. too many stripes are obtained by favoritism and that is bad for the u.s. army, because it will not get the men past in combat. don't get me wrong, i'm not  am only giving you my opinion.

outfits_comment: but they should have separate barracks.

i think a negro should have some rights, but after all a negro is a different race of people. i dont like to see them mistreated, but they should stay in their place. but i dont think a commission officer + enlisted man should come under two different classes, you must remember you have some good friends that are trying to get a head but, dont like to break off friendship, that is the only thing that the army have got that we dont like. ever man is , the lord dont pick them by to die.
long: i think a negro should have some rights, but after all a negro is a different race of people. i don' t like to see them miss-treated, but they should stay in their place. but i don't think a commission officer & enlisted man should come under two different classes. you must remember you have some good friends that are trying to get a head but, don't like to break off friendship. that is the only thing that the army has got that we dont like. ever man is equal, the lord dont pick them by  to die.
yes i would like to say a little, i could do a lot more if i was back home working in a deffense plant a lot more good i could do to help win the war.

i think that a soldier with a trade with years of experience should be placed in an outfit where his skills can best be used and there would be reasonable  for him which would create a lot more cooperation on both sides

outfits_comment: too close relationship, and then again i would want to almost sleep with them.
long: the questionnaire as i have seen it has been rather liberal, although it stresses the negro question a little too much. it did not't give us enough questions on the camp itself, which in my mind is very important thing to discuss so that the war department could get a general comparison. also a lot of us could get a load off our chests in saying that this post is lousy, literaly speaking.

outfits_comment: i think they would feel better being together.
long: i did not think that any conditions such as exist here could be found in this country. very unsanitary conditions outside camp. rents are sky high. people in the state hate most of us. i have been here since july and pray every night that i can be sent to africa instead of staying here. we have 5 men in stockade and 1 mental case which is a lot for this small outfit and i blame it all on this area.

outfits_comment: there is often trouble if the whites are put in with the negro
long: there is a rule in our outfit that a soldier can only get three overnight passes a week and the magarity of the men can't get a pass when  he wants one. if a soldier is offduty he should be able to go off of the post if his conduct is good other wise no.
allow the soldiers to wear garrison hats outside of camp. regular furloughs. be stationed close to your home & love ones so you can see them every so often.

outfits_comment: given the same opertunities
long: a soldier should be given a furlough every three months at least. why do we have to work thanksgiving easter

outfits_comment: jealousy over ranks causes fights. also it may lead to white's going with negro girls.
long: i would like to see action taken in these surveys. another survey asked what hats we prefer. all or most agreed on hats with visors. why have not we got them?

outfits_comment: well, habbits & thoughts differ between negro & white
long: i think that this questionnaire is pretty good, and i hope it is given enough consideration. i'm sure it would help soldiers, people, and the government in general. i thank you

i think that a soldiers free time should be his own to do with what he pleases as long as his behavior merits him free time. his free time should be between retreat and reveille, unless he's on special duty like k.p. or guard duty, and he should be allowed to come and go as he pleases during that time. i don't think his training should interfere with this time because all work and no play isn't fair to the individual who has be raised an american with an inborn since of independence & freedom and would make a better soldier if left to make his own decisions as to how he wants that time spent. if a person proves himself dependable why hold him down to a lot of rules and regulations that really aren't necessary.

when men come in to the army they are classified and then sent to some branch where the cannot adjust themselves. i.e. a mechanic in civilian life is sent to infantry where he could do more good in an ordnance co..

outfits_comment: i would never want to sleep next to one
long: none.

the questionnaire is good idea if it would be of any good to the soldier. it is just a waste of time for the war dept makes there army regulations and rules to make a soldier miserable. such as not allowing them on the streets after dark or not allowed to buy a drink when off duty

outfits_comment: to avoid differences of opinion

long: for better morale in the army i think steps should be taken to improve living conditions for army wives.  majority of soldiers are married as long as their wives are with them they are contented even in the army.  thank you
these questionnaire are a very  of the differenc opinion of the people. and a great school, for men to express their feeling towards the army life
i want to be tranfered from this camp.

my honest opinion of this outfit is that there is too many things going on that has nothing to do in training of men. one thing is the planting of trees. another thing is that things are too strict and men do not ever get a compliment for what they accomplish to help boost the morale. seneroity should count a great delaware al in selecting men for advancement. men who have not a high i.q. would make better officers than a man who has a high i.q but hasn't had the experience  service that a man with a low i.q has had.

before the war i never visited in the south and i see no reason why we couldn't have stayed in the north even tho' it was farther from my home state. if i survive this war and am discharged from the army it is my sincere wish that i will never have to live or visit in the south.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
long: we should have better
i think this is a fine idea and will make a better army.

in some parts of the usa people are taught differently of the negro. they have in parts a dislike and in other parts are about equal as they don't have that feelings as the other parts of the states do in some parts white children and negro go to the same school together and other parts they have separate school

outfits_comment: because of disturbint & disinterested in trying to win war.
long: hoping i have answered all these questions as near wright as i see these now and before entering the army. hoping it will be over soon so i can get back and have a home. thanking you.

if no other questions are considered please consider the 11-12 questions i think the main reason a married soldier is disatisfied with army life is because he is usally separated from his family further than would be necessary.

outfits_comment: because most negro are   and not clean.
long: i think this outfit should have sat. afternoons off. for games

outfits_comment: it would never do for negro to be with the whites. south in the south
long: i think soldier should have more of a right to transfer to outfits they would like to be in, for they would work harder ever way they could and they wouldn't feel like they were being drove to do things

outfits_comment: because the white and negro solider wood soon mix
long: this questionnaire has covered about every thing except i think that there is a lot on  thing done that there is of no benefits to wining the war. and that cost the government $1000 of dollars. in witch coud be make to a grate benfite to the soldiers an to the government it self.

for a medical outfit we have a pretty fair outfit but we all lack training. (i have finished basic and most of advanced training) we don't have enough organization and the officers could be better trained. too much of our time is devoted to trivial matters and little training is given in the essential things. our noncom officers are not chose fairely, not according to grade and ability but according to personality. we are considered part of a field army and as a result we get only field rations, which are poor, also food is not properly prepared, our cooks never went to any school for cooks. one is fresh from civilian life and was a plumber.
one thing wrong with this camp is that they don't give us good enough eats. they give all the best food to the officers and we take whats left. they should have a separate mess hall for the officers.

some camps are o.k. some are not i have been the same camp about 6 months, i think soldiers should get moved to different camps oftener, that way time passes quicker, and the soldier does not have as much time to think about home. i would like to keep on the move and see different parts of the country soldiers should have more rights in the army than they should, they don't have enough enterainment in camp  we scrub the barracks more than we train.
i would like to get sat. evening off, and we need more training in the field. but i think this outfit is ready to go over.
the chow at this camp is o.k. but we dont get enough of it. 1 slice of  bread  per man. they throw away a lot of bread when the men here want it.

outfits_comment: they work with another negro better then they would with a white man

long: there is one thing i don't like about the army there is to many noncommision officers, and here in this camp the food is terrible.

outfits_comment: the work differently as a whole and better units would develop if segreated.
long: #33 - the possibilities of another war are more than that if no new policy of world police force and world legeslature and executive is set up.  we cannot expect either that by merely winning a war and letting the matter drop  we can hope permenant peace.  its doubtful at any rate,  #

outfits_comment: they should be put where the most efficiency can be attained.
long: more common leave(?) should be used by officers and non-coms. there has been to little of it in this men's army. a course in simple psychology would help out many officers and non-coms to be better and stable leaders. too much individualism and egotism of high non-coms including officers, has been a bad example to green recruits. it breeds hatred & dislike and new men do not corporate officers this behind much leadership. too-much "chicken-shit." pardon me if that's wrong in putting but that is lowfield(?)
question 45 - united states is fighting to keep this country as it was, & make sure that it stays that way. (coded in . 20)

outfits_comment: it would lower the efficiency of the white outfits
they might get idea to change and turn the whole outfit against us.
long: there is no kicking - when a man as the commander leaves and the co. brightens up - everyone goes at ease - they are happy they must be afraid of the comm.  when the second in coman. takes over we all do twice as much work no matter how hard it is and do it willingly well you figure it out.

outfits_comment: i don't like them.
due to racial friction
long: the negro is liked much less below the mason dixon line. i have noticed that the southern people do not get along with them as well as mid. western or northern people.
i think the name should be put on in order to help the individual who answers the question. in a country like ours each soldiers problem should be dealt with personal.

long: as a veteran of world war i. i believe in striking while the iron is hot.

i think we should have less inspections and wednesday and saturday afternoon off and three day pass so we can go sane where as the towns are so small here it is over crowded and nothing to do when we are off duty.

i am 39 years old & i like the army very much. it has done a lot for me. i am not going to get out of the army on account of my age. i have never felt better in my life as i do now. eating more than i ever ate in my life.
don't like to have to sing (this is the army mister jones), to get a pass, thats a lot of hooey.

(1) we should have sat. & wednesday afternoon off. because everybody but the 37th med. amb. bn get them off. (2) now we got to sang to get a pass to go to town, and resitght our guard rule too. we got to go to the first sgt and sang (this is the army mr. jones (3) they even tell you where you can go at night time, and that is my time

a. about the recreation concerning the area of this camp, they charge you double of what soldiers should have to pay compared to what they make. all whiskey stores are off limits and i think they should sell to soldier's at a small quanity. b. i think, that this is really a fine idea because the everyone gets a chance to catch up on what he's been thinking all at one time.

we who are over 1000 miles from home should get longer time for furlough and everyone should have a furlough more often. it takes the grind out of this training and everyone would feel more cheerful if they could go home and see there friends and love ones once in a while. we are stuck off here in a hell-hole and nothing to do but drink beer. i don't drink and it is not fair to force fellows like me to sit around and watch me get drunk and raise hell. this would drive a man to drink. we also have too damn many inspections.

in answering question no. 24 i would say that about one third of my time is spent in worthwhile training. the rest of the time the same things are repeated over and over, this is probably due to the very low i q rating of my outfit.

if i cant be at any services of the boys over there and cant go over my self because of my age is 37 years i  be out where i can do the most good for my country like ship yards or  or farming something to do any country as good as i can

long: after being used to working hard on farm there is so much time wasted in the army it seems in this time of war better advantage could be made. perhaps i'm old enough to see but after working for yourself for 18 yrs then listening to some one else its different but if men were kept busy to some advantage there would be less griping its so much doing things & simulating wasting time on inside when help is so scarce on outside & still calling for more men. guess i'm too old for a good soldier.

all i can say is i am only nineteen, but am doing my share to help win the war. i hope ever body else is doing the same. thank you.

all i want to say is this. i am in the inf. i don't know how the rest of the army is. but i hate the inf. they are trying to kill us before we get over there. we know & realize that when we get over there we will have to fight hard and be tough. there is not much room so i will not try to tell you what we sometimes go through. we know it is tough but why not ship us now, why wait until we half dead. the morale of the inf. especially my regiment is very poor. the army does not keep its word on a lot of things that count. little things like saying you can have sun. off. & then making you work

the reason i say the army isn't giving me a chance to show what i can do is i am an aircraft sheetmetal worker by trade. i can handle all types of aircraft sheetmetal and i was  in the infantry  and my knowledge isn't being used at all. i am sure i could do a better job for my country if i were in the air force ground crew.

long: i want to enlarge on my answer to #12. i have a wife and children. i have never been separated from them before for any length of time, i miss them terribly, a lot of the time i have them on my mind when my mind should be clear for studying etc. if i could be close to them i know it would ease this mental strain a great deal and i would get more out of my training. more on #35. my wives allotment has just recently started coming in regularly and i've been in the army over eight months. as to my friends who are working, i believe they are better off since the war started.  southern people seem to dislike northern and western soldiers and the merchants "jack-up." their prices to us, while in the north and west soldiers get cheaper rates on a lot of things than civilians do.

outfits_comment: i think they would make better soldiers being by themselves
long: i think this questionnaire is a very good idea, especially if it helps a soldier, also help him being in his own state i think he would make a better soldier. also being here the people in the south are very unkind to the northern soldiers. they also charge the soldiers for anything the buy about 3 juices too much i am a meckanic in the motor pool like it pretty well. only some of the officers that run the place do not know what a motor is or know what it's all about. i think they should let someone run the place that know about mechanic work and know how to get along with them, thank you.

the one comment is - why don't the war department, have officers in charge of motor shops, know some thing about motors.  i have seen bn motor officers that dont know a thing about motors. and yet try and tell mechanics and motor sgt's how to do things, when its like that it makes it very hard to run a motor pool. any way when a officer will not listen to any advise.

outfits_comment: they get along a lot better with their own people
long: we try out best to do our utmost it would be not more than fair if we would be given more time to see our loved ones at home & as long as we are still in this country the passes issued should be for lengthier time giving us a chance to go into a larger town and have some real fun. i think we are deserving of at least these few suggestion. it would put more spirit in to us and the monotony of our consistent training will be easened, making our work more interesting.

most of us soldiers just don't like niggers. thats all --
