long: i don't think it is fair for the solder to be able to go to the p.x. and buy things that people on the out side can't get. and if they can witch they do they should not get it at half price. they get pay and good pay at that then maybe the people would try to treat them more respectful in towns and cities.

outfits_comment: racial prejudice is still to strong to allow intermingling of races.
long: this test, while it is good as a general test, does not allow for the length of service that a man has had in the army. giving a test of this type does not allow the new recruit to answer truthfully or correctly. some of the multiple choice questions do not allow for a great enough variation in opinion, more possible answers should be provided for each question. a question or questions as to things or characteristics of their camp that they like or dislike would be appropriate. most soldiers would welcome a chance to try to improve transportation between camps and nearby major communities. many questions seem to be only a matter of guesswork such as how long will the war last and others. lack of news of current problems limits the answers of most persons in the army -

outfits_comment: to make a good outfit, any idea that one man is far better than an other will create a lack of interest by his fellow member.
long: in regard to question (18) i could not become a commissioned officer on the basis of the work i am doing now. i was postmaster in a 4th class office, and very interested in my work. i would like to enter a school for   postal men. that would answer question (41) in regards to getting a better job after leaving the army.

i believe that after we win this war the beaten peoples must be given a chance to live the same as we will. in spite of our feelings towards them, we must treat them as human beings or completely destroy them. to punish them to severely is only to start the beginning of a future war, fostered by hatred. as an example, take the german people, they were drawn to hitler by their suffering and starvation, brought on by an unfair versailles treaty.

outfits_comment: i do not believe the southern whites & many whites from the north would tolerate it, although they should, since a soldier is a soldier regardless of race, creed or color

long: give sgt's and cpl's ratings to men who are educated and who have the ability and initive to lead men. uneducated men make poor leader's of men.  post commander, should take an effort to see that soldier's will have and must have fairly decent transportation to town and cities away from camp. without transportation it's hell here at camp.  the army would do better if it had more "west point", officers.

outfits_comment: because in combat area's one has no time to choose but to fight together regardless of race in order to win this war.
long: i think it is a good idea, although it might take up more time to decide on some of the questions. i believe that if they are answered truthfully without malice or prejudice we would have a better understanding of the army, and the government can do more for the soldier's once they go over these questionares and answer each one with truth and honesty.

outfits_comment: for i believe that negro understand one another better
long: well i still believe that the white boy do not want to sleep with the colored
in general this questionnaire is for the benefit of all soldiers, and i think they should answer every question to their own belief.

outfits_comment: as much as possible there is too much dislike for the mixing of colors. this would have a tendency to lower morale. a white man with any love for himself will hold himself above a negro.
long: our  is non-combatant made up of mostly limited service men most of us have has no basic training and we have been here three months. we are all, or the greater part of us are former postal employees. i think we should have a chance to do  duty  in the a. p. o. s (after we have had basic training) and let the waac's  over our folio here. i don't think they should send any members of the women's auxiliary forces across as long as they have men that can go (p#) i think everyone should get basic training on entering the forces because it will be helpful in later life.  even if we never use it , it will help us physically and morally

the limit service boys should have a chance to get some kind of work they could do in defense plants so they could help win the war they want to do more that just do detail work al the time. most of the questions ar hard to decide upon. but they ar ok.
i wood rather be closer home on acount of my fathers mothers health but i no a solder ca't be where he wonts to now.

outfits_comment: this question gives me the creeps.

long: i believe that about sixty-five percent of the soldiers get the branch of service they want to get into.  negro, in most cases, as individuals have a lower character and have lower morale than do the whites. i think they should be kept in different divisions.

i think the training is to stiff for fellows just coming out of  life they should be tough gradually. one of my main agruments is why do we have so many old men in the army when there is younger men among this war is going to be one because of the young men because this war is a fast moving war to fast for a man over 35 years of age. the army as a hole i like it but some fellows that i have come in contact with dislike it very much they claim that one man in one outfit has more extra duty then other.

i would say that it is not a question of what people think as individuals but as a united body. we must all think and act alike to get action and results. it is the too many indifferences that hold and complicate matters. draft boards are placing men in the army who are physically unfit. why waste money and time? a closer examination should be given than that of today.

the army isn't so bad. it is a life that we have to get used to. the only trouble is the leaders are not on their toes. they can't make up their mind what they want you to do. they are too strict on certain things which do not require all the attention they devote on it. you are not given enough time to do all the things that are required of you.
i think this questionnaire is ment all right and i pray for complete victory for us and the ones fighting with us.

outfits_comment: there are too many men who dislike the negro to have unity
long: i haven't been in the army long enough to make very many intelligent comments, but i have one which i think is important for the morale of groups.   in our camp there are several messes some have good food, others poor. this is in the preparation of the food. when a soldier goes to one mess, finds it clean, various assortments of , jams, and the such; better prepared food; cleaner eating facilities; etc. it makes him  dissatisfied with the place he is eating  i believe there should be restrictionsand qualifications on messes so that there would be no prejudice between the messes.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: same
long: personally, i think our draft system is all wet! i can see no possible value in taking boys out of high school. at least 50% of them will never return & finish their education, and what this country is going to need after the war is men with as much education as it is possible to acquire. what chance then is a boy who has not even had four high school years of english or mathematics? true, he may hold down a "shop job" for a little while but these jobs will peter out in time, and then our boys will be walking the streets just like they were after the last war. we certainly have plenty of older men to pick+i989:j989 from; why in our station we have so many men that the officers have more than they can humanly do, and give each man the training he deserves for over seas service. this idea which you have put into folder form is a marvelous think. it helps formulate opinions that are given from all over the country. if you intend to bide by this information which you receive from the hundreds of thousands of men, i'm quite sure the majority of the men will be given all the opportunites for advancement and all the  privileges available. it must be true that a contented soldier is a good soldier for he has been given something to fight for. if there were more space available i would give you my views as i can see them as a private. most of the fellows feel for some reason or other that they can talk to me, and they certainly have some views that are not mentioned in the aforementioned questionnaire.

outfits_comment: there are no negro at our camp

long: i have no comment except that its a good idea if it helps out the common soldier.

if the war ends in a complete allied victory the united states and great britian should avoid becoming imperialistic. if permanent peace is to be realized for the future generations each measure of political and economical importance concerning all coutries should be carefully weighed and analyzed so as to assure each nation a fair and just amount whether it be distribution of possessions or foreign trade. summing it all up each nations problems should be taken into consideration and dealt with accordingly and fairly.

outfits_comment: because negro and whites live different
i do not have any
long: i think it has brought out about all points that is nessary.

outfits_comment: some negro & whites can't get along very well.
long: 1: being an air cadet i think that there should be some part of it for our views. nothing has been said about us. 2: some of the questions were too general. 3: too many questions about negro & white relations. i suppose that in the south this is important, but in the rest of the country it isn't; therefore less should be said about it. why so many questions on marriage? i think questions 36, 37, 38, & 39 could be incorporated into a single one, thus saving time and effort.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: if they have separate outfits they will feel inferior to us
they are just as human as anybody
long: what is the difference between colored people than white. why should they be treated any difference i dont see why they are just as human & fighting for the same cause as the white. they allow the yellow race to be put with the white so what difference is it with colored. i think if we were all put together & really be friends instead of being separated we might win this war a little quicker with cooperation together.

outfits_comment: better 4 army
they should be separate because they can never git along
long: march 11. 1943
what i think about this  mans army today is that they are too many officers in it and they spent to much time horseing around.
i have not been in the army long enough to give a fair answer to most of the questions.

outfits_comment: they are to date more accustomed to being separate

long: each post seems to have different regulations as to dress, passes etc. i think the war departemnt should unify such regulations. some c. offices whims are carried out in some pretty silly orders. this should be stopped - it hurts, the soldiers morale. the negro in america should e let known that he will benefit through this war. race problems, color lines down south, are a disgrace to our glorious cause. civilians in our country could help out by just a little bit more effort on their part to treat the soldier stationed near by like a person.

outfits_comment: many soldiers are funny about being with negro.
long: if the army needs men as bad as they say it seems that they wouldn't stay in a camp where they are not needed.

outfits_comment: then there would be no excuse for trouble between whites and negro.
long: if it is taken into serious consideration, i think some of the camps may have a chance to improve on their weak points.

outfits_comment: same as question 60.
long: there should be a question on whether our preferene as well as our qualifications are every really considered for an army position. my answer would be no.

outfits_comment: a man will work better with men of his own race
long: i think it's a very good idea!
if i would stay in the war i would like to have a chance at a truck.  and that is all.  thank you

outfits_comment: they would all get the same chance
because they get along better by themselves
i don't see any difference between a negro than a white man
long: in this camp there is know no negro but i don't see where a white man has any more privileges that a negro that a negro has no more privileges than a white man. even though i do think that they should eat in a separate room.

outfits_comment: i am not really so sure how that should be arranged.

long: there is one thing which i believe along with many of the other boys in the camp i am in now or anyother camp as far as that goes. and that is, i believe the president of the united states should pass a law providing that corporal's, sergeant's etc. will use no rough talk and  at his men. there are about half the men who are in charge who talk as if they have never had any education in english at anytime. i along with the rest of the boys feel that if we are talked to in a fairly nice way, we would be much more willing to cooperate and feel more satisfied and at home in the army. there may be a law on how men can be talked to, but it certainly isn't enforced, unless a private says something and then he gets  all over for it. i believe everyone should be treated the same. and if they are we will have a much better fighting force.
its good

there seems to be too many conflicting ideas in different camps what you learn at one camp is all wrong at the next camp. there is altogeater too much stress on details and not enough on accomplishments. when you are fighting you do things that bring the best results.

it seems to me that the army would save time, money and trouble by sending men to their nearest b.t.c. for their particular branch of the service. this would also add to the morale of the civillians as well as the soldiers. in my own and practically every other soldiers care that i have talked to there was a b.t.c. under 100 miles from his own homes and of the branch of service they were in.  most soldiers are sent from 400 miles on up to take b. training, even after that; cases of where a soldier gets stationed even close to his home are very rare.

i think that on this post us hard driling soldiers should have more rest. instead of listening to lectures until midnight and then when we do go to bed and to to sleep for about twenty minutes have a fire drill or air raid drill. and then get up avout 3.30 oclock and go on kp. i think that is all  bosh.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: they fight just as hard as the white man
long: i think this questionnaire is a good way to find out opinions of soldiers and if possible to correct some things to the betterment of the soldier.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: it is just the same as having a chinese and an american together
long: to me i believe that negro should be treated just like us. i would just as soon be in with some negro as some of the american soldiers i have seen.

i have only been in the army for 2 weeks. i have liked it, but i don't understand why it is necessary to create conditions which give 95% of the men colds and after catching a cold they can't get rid of it under these conditions. i am mostly referring to lack of sleep which was prevalent in my induction center as well as here at the hotel. i can't figure our why they get men out of their rooms in the middle of the night to answer all the silly little things they use as an excuse for what they do. it is in my opinion a waste of manpower, because very few of the men feel up to tow, consequently they can't do their best. you can hear disgust coming from all mouths, because of this unnecessary condition. it gives a poor impression and even the canned excuse this it the army isn't sufficient.

outfits_comment: the negro is a different race of person altogether and should be kept in his place.
long: i would like to see a little more regularity of schedule in this camp. i would like to know what i have to do for one day at least.
its a good idea

this war has affected us all very much, and no one satisfied and the sooner this war is over the sooner we can have peace and better morale at home. if it ends quickly we may  a war among our allies but god help the politician and so-called government rulers if things don't change soon because they can't count on the soldier to side against their loved ones if they are under oath. i have been plain and frank as asked to be same as every other sane man in the services thanks for the chance to speak my piece. a soldier
i think the questionnaire is ok. what i wrote is my honest opinion of army and after war life

outfits_comment: they should be with their fellow men, i think
long: i think this is a very good idea because maybe somebody might suggest something useful. in this way you can get a general opinion of the army.

outfits_comment: they would be happier together and in their own separate outfit.

long: we are going to blast the enemy off the map. i figure we should get some more men the foreign country. we should only keep enough men over here to guard this country so we can get this thing over

outfits_comment: they fight better together. mix them with whites and we fight among ourselves
long: the questionnaire is a good idea it gives a soldier a chance to say what he thinks about the army in general i myself would not mind the army, (it's training i enjoy) if at all possible a fellow could be placed with-in reach of his home. i honestly think if that were done, the fighting morale of a soldier would be increased. i'm sure mine would, and others i have spoken too. to speak to my wife at this moment would make me march twice as hard tomorrow. if i saw her i could lick any "nazi" or "jap" what chance has a fellow 980 miles from home for something like that. if this was done, i could say i think army life is swell.

outfits_comment: when they are all together they are more forceful.
long: i like the army fine except i can't have my wife here. if the gov. would make arangements for that i think the army as a whole would be satified. i know that is and that impossible but i still think its a good idea. i get kind of worried sometimes but that is to be expected.

outfits_comment: sometimes they hold back white soldiers and vice versa.
long: i do not believe it fair as to the way the leaders are picked at this station. if a man is in good with the non-coms he is made a drill master. a drill master has the power to tell any other man to do any job he wishes them to do. the drill master is only a buck private and i don't believe has any athority over any other buck or first class private. most of the time the dm's are calling the men dirty names and if anything is said by the men to them. the men  get's a week k.p. or the guard house just for sticking up for his own rights.

outfits_comment: same answer as question no. 60
i think they would make better soldiers in their own outfits.

long: this army is only what we make it. we can make it good an we can make it bad.

i think this questionnaire is a great idea. it brings out the feelings of an adverge american soldier. i think it should be done more often. say about every six months then the big shots in washington will have the feelings of american soldiers on file. i think the man or woman responsible for this idea be awarded something for his & her & find out more thing, about american soldiers i really go for this idea to make a short story shorter it to good to even describe in words the great work its doing i really was surprised to see so many american soldiers interested in the questionnaire. i thank you all who is responsible for my rights to say what i feel. "thank you"

outfits_comment: because a lot of soldiers wouldn't want a negro for a buddy.

long: on question 33. there will not be a war in the next 25 yrs. if we completely crush our advesaries in this war. by doing this and maintaining a large army and navy, i can't see and reason why there should be another war

outfits_comment: the negro people i have met i would not want them replace me as a white man - they would get killed anyway - (so-)

long: 1. i think the morale of the enlisted man is superior to the officers.  2. i think the officers should be picked with greater care.  3. more men should be allowed to apply for aviation cadets and the other cadets.  4. cadet   should be lowered so as to gain more men for this important branch of the u.s.a.c.  5. the promises given by the army should to  out so as to give men the things they deserve for spending time in technical schools and specialized training.

outfits_comment: it gives the individual pride and in his own outfit
long: the army should be the same as the navy. in the army a man isn't given a chance to show his ability because of politics.
why don't us mechanics get a chance to see what we can do with wrench instead of marching and drilling as soon as we have school

outfits_comment: i think the questions are very interesting but can't see how they can better conditions or make any changes in the army, unless you have certain ways to do it.

outfits_comment: they would work together better.
when it comes to fighting a negro is tops and should be given crited
long: they want us to give any comments we have. well here is one. why is it that all the jews have same  of one thing or another when it is time for them to ship? i will give you my opinion since this is a free county they are a bunch of yellow back's and would slit your throat for a penny. since i have been in the army i have seen enough of the overtures to turn my insides and they are always in some safe place. there is one good thing  army is doing and that is killing all these money guys. i thank you for giving me a chance to express myself.

outfits_comment: some negro and white don't work well together.
the living standards are different and this difference may create trouble
long: more cooperation is needed between c.o. and his staff. more cooperation is needed between 1st sgt and his staff. this will bolster the morale of the unit. s-3  on this post should be reorganized in order to have a more efficient and workable dept. eliminate the gestapo activities of all post administrative inspectors for a better working unit. eliminate and prohibit the sale of liquors and beer to soldiers in this camp. this would make better men.

outfits_comment: it will help prevent friction between whites and negro

long: i don't really know, how you expect to gather any sort of information from this. i think it's just a waste of my valuable time, and i doubt very much whether conditions will be corrected. this country is called a democracy - equal rights for all, both rich and poor - but i doubt it. tell me, will we soldiers be able to make a decent living after this mess, or will it be the same as after the last? you answer that - whoever you are!
this is a good post and fine branch of the service. my only gripe is about meals being cold sometimes and special service men not being classified as  or according to what the specialty may be.
i dont think that there is enough patriotism in the army, from offices down

outfits_comment: negro had rather be segregated in that respect.

my thought of the army's that the officers  are to rough talking to you. they don't give you enough time to do any thing you want to do. they don't divid the detail up enough so you can get more rest.

long: i think giving this questionnaire is a good idea because it gives the soldiers his chance to express his own ideas about army life.

outfits_comment: for the negro think they will be as good as the whits
long: well i am very un happy for i have wife and children at home and stock of all kinds i like to be there where i can make them a good living and make them happy for the army life is a very good lif for a single boy that has not got any thing back home to worry about but a man that has a family he is not a good soldier for he is thinking of his family at home and he cant do the army work like a single boy

outfits_comment: it might create trouble in the outfits.
long: i feel that the negro has not been given a fair chance especially in the south. the northern part of this country is much better in most things which concerns a negro but they cannot be given too many rights because when you give them an inch they take a mile.

outfits_comment: personally i have no use for them,
because there would be many objections.
long: my only objection is asking question about the negro + white people. i say put them all in one group because the negro has just as much right as a white. i think it would be nice to have a conversation with them. in wartime i agree. there are some points in civilian life though. the major league for instance in baseball. too many riots. the same church, dance or shows. there will always be trouble when both races are together.

re. #28 - my spirits are good but i'm not always satisfied here. we are supposed to have some time to ourselves every day but with fire drills, air raid drill etc. we seldom have any. there seem to be too many men always bossing me and each men has a different idea as to what should be done and when it should be done. re #36 to #63 i am very much against negro although a good number of them are better than many whites, therefore my answers may not be fair. re #9 i believe some training every year would be a very good thing and should be required up to about 30 years of age.

outfits_comment: it seems to me that in army life that there is a great deal of hurrying and then waiting. as some has said, ""rushing to wait."" also there is much contradiction of orders among the non commissioned officers. one will tell you to do one thing and another will give an order at direct variance with the first.
long: it seems to me that in army life that there is a great deal of hurrying and then waiting. as some has said, "rushing to wait". also there is much contradiction of orders among the non-coms. one will tell you to do one thing and another will give an order at direct variance with the first.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
long: if negro are kept separately i believe there will be a race dissension later on. our forefathers brought them here, now it is up to us to see that they are on the same level with us. the bible states, and i quote, "all things are created equal." therefore i reason they should have the same privileges as we.
we don't get enough sleep around here!!

outfits_comment: separate outfits get along better and less trouble
to prevent friction.
long: i hope and intend to fight and mayby give my life for my country, but if i am to loose my life and win freedom for my country i will expect the politions to cut trying to bleed our people at everything they have. it's about time somebody did something for the good of the country besides the soldier and the common people, namely the people who are living off the common people's soft hearts. graft has got to stop here at home before the soldiers can truthfully say "we have won a total victory."

outfits_comment: because black & white dont mix.
long: first of all they get you up to early in the morning 4:30, thats in the middle of the night. second the chow line is to long waiting 1 hour for a meal i think thats a little to long. and often 4:30 at night were suppose to be free, but theres always something to do, either k.p. or detail. etc. i know this is part of the army, but i don't like it. and they should send some jews overseas instead of having them stay back & work in the camps.

the questionnaire as a whole is not bad. the things i don't like about this camp is that there are too many restrictions or bars. for instance no garrison hats can be worn and no patches or pins are allowed to be worn. i have been here for three 1/2 months and  changes have taken place since then. then we find it tough to get any passes even though i'm only 100 - 150 miles from home. i'm a squadron guard, and i am sick of it. i'd like to get shipped to some school, but they are holding me back for some reason i don't know i'm wasting too much valuable time in this place. thats all.

outfits_comment: it is for the best
long: atlantic city is not good army camp for the boy no pass for

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']

long: that way thing is good and what i really would like to do for 1 a job in america is to drive an aeroplane to just go and work hard with an other group of planes and bomb the tokoyo, japan and germany.  every question was easy and some of them i did not know ho to answer them so i just put undecided.

outfits_comment: because some fellows would not like to work & associate with negro
long: i disaprove of the way a large group of men are treated for what just a few do. the officers should pick out the offenders & give them the punishment. just a few men can keep a whole company in trouble most of the time.

discipline suffers due to fact of too much leniency to repeated case of awol - and in some cases disrespect to superiors, in brief an noncom has too much responsibility without sufficient power to gash it up.

they get us up to early and i think if we  could get about 8 hour sleep we wood be better soldier.  the food could be cook  and well fixed.  and they  could let us out at night. and them army live wood be better.
i hope this war end fast, o. how i love the army but how i love to sleep in a comfortable bed.

outfits_comment: or they might start fights which cause riots and kicking occur.
long: to give the negro soldier the same privileges as the white soldier because they are fighting for freedom. have them in the same camp but different barracks. to give them a chance equal to the white soldier to get ahead. after the war in the job i am to get will get me ahead in time to come.

two much time is wasted in man power, by having three or four men to inspect the buildings each day. more men that have their commission should be useing their knowledge on things that are more difficult than inspecting rooms each day. a person not so will trained can do such jobs.
there is only one comment that i would like to make and that is that the k.p. hours are to long in this camp.

one of the things i dislike most about the army is that we're always "in a hurry to wait." even with training programs speeded up the way they are, there is a deplorable amount of time wasted under conditions which could be eliminated. hence we have to rise too early in the morning. when men like us work hard all day, we need a reasonable amount of rest, at least while we're still in the u.s. & while so much time is being wasted anyhow.

outfits_comment: negro & whites will never get along together.

long: 1. as far as ability is concerned in the army why don't they give you a chance to show it.  2. why dont the sergents do something to the goldbrikers?  3 why aren't trainees who know their stuff graduated rather than stay with the dope who dont even try to learn

outfits_comment: i think they will be as good one place another

outfits_comment: they may work better when together and in separate units.
long: our camps seem to have very good facilities for its soldiers, but they could have better and warmer food as it is usually cold until you eat it. as we live in with the civilians our rules are very strict and are highly enforced. on a whole army life seems to be pretty good.

when i enlisted i passed the physical for an aviation cadet. when i got to this post i had a recheck and failed because i was color blind. why couldn't i join some other branch of service? i would rather be in the navy then the air corp ground crew.
will this win the war?

outfits_comment: the first part of training should be done with more experienced trainees. because it is most important as a time saver.
long: the first part of training should be done with more experienced trainees. because it is most important as a time saver.

they don't give you time to get dressed before roll call.  don't like to have to hurry and then have to wait around for an officer to tell us what we are to do for the day. always hurrying so you can wait.

i do not like the army because they never send a soldier near his home and do not give him a chance to go home. i'm just married and i believe it will be 5 to 8 months before i see my wife  or family. so i am told by my rotten superiors. i would be willing to fight and readily die for my country  but there are a few things the country could do for  me more furloughs
usually enlisted men are shipped far away from home. it seems to me if they were stationed near their homes, there cooperation would be 100% better.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']

long: i believe wholehartley that this questionnaire is a very good thing. something should be done about the  negro problem, more so in the southern part of the united states. if men must die for the same cause, therefore, they should have the opportunity of shareing regardless of race.

i think an no that the boy that go on sick call get use pettery damn bad i no some boys. i not sick an they do it to get out of work. if you tell them your sick they dont believe you an make you work. when your god damn sick. it happen in my comm once. an i no other boys that use use the same. an that is no lied.
like army life fine when get any basic training, and station where i'll stay a while.
non-coms should be selected by intelligence and, less important, education (formal or otherwise) even if their job requires little of either.

outfits_comment: same as question #60
long: a good deal of valuable time is wasted by giving men basic training when they really don't need it. i think that the past history of individuals should be considered, if possible, before assigning men to any general prescribed course of routine or study.

outfits_comment: i, for one, wouldn't trust a negro in my tent or barricks.
long: all in all, i think the army is pretty all right. i don't mind serving in it, in fact, i think it's an honor to be able to serve my country. not only for myself, but mostly for the ones i love, who i would give my life gladly if it would mean peace and security for them.

outfits_comment: because they are trouble makers
long: about the negro why do you ask so much question about them.
i don't think the classifications are fair to give a person a skilled trade for which he has been trained

outfits_comment: because white southerners would be courtmartialed every day for assault and battery.
long: this camp is so strict that i haven't had a chance to see the town in the last 9 weeks. we are restricted for one cause or another every night. the drill masters are hardly old as the men they teach and you can't learn much from them. furloughs should be given to men whose wives are becoming mothers a pal of mine asked for a furlough and was turned down. his wife died 2 days later as a result of child berth. he did not't get the chance to see her alive that he should have gotten. outside of an hours wait in the chow line this camp will pass in the dark.

outfits_comment: its alright to be friends with them but when it comes to living i think it should be separated
long: there isn't much i can say except that this is a very good questionnaire and i hope that it will help to come out for the best.

question 33 -- if the present system of government isn't completely and definitely taken away from the people of the axis countries, and if the influence of the government which is inbred into its youth isn't completely erased there will surely be another war, just in time for my children to be in it. i don't want that. we will have to give them something to occupy their minds and make them happy and contented or some painter will start something.

i do believe that this questionnaire is a rather good idea. it does give some information to a certain extent on what a soldier likes and dislikes about army life. in my opinion it is a rather general but not too intensive sumry of a soldiers army career. i really do believe that their should be more questionnaires which go further that is in to greater details.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: because you might have to fight with them in battle
long: i think that instead of giving one soldier a week end pass just about every week because he is close to home that he should give other boys a 5 or 6 day furlough and cut down on these people who get week end passes just about every week. i think that they should have a better system of bus transportation in this camp where i am at.  p.s. i know and hope we keep up till the axis powers are crushed beyond human life.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
long: this questionnaire is undoubtedly a very good one, as it is easy to see that it has been carefully prepared. however, i think it fails to take into account the fact that many of the men who will answer this questionnaire are very recent arrivals in the army. i, for example, have been in the army for only 2 months. i haven't been assigned to any job yet, & i haven't been assigned to any permanent outfit as yet. so  i find it very difficult to answer questions 20-32 honestly. i really haven't had time to make up my mind.

outfits_comment: some whites think they are superior to negro and trouble would arise otherwise
long: personally i believe a negro should be treated as equal to white that is not the case in u.s.a. at present- on the whole i believe the army is very well fed and equipped

outfits_comment: see previous statements.
long: i personally do not feel that very much will be accomplished by this questionnaire. - the questions themselves were all right - but i feel that nothing will be done. -
why does the e.m. from the east continuously be stationed in the east to the extend that it creates a opportunity to absent themselves without leave.
keep em flying buy more war stamps signed a private

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
long: i only hope that the soldier will have a better chance after the war. to get a job. with all the men working at defense plants and men being taught trades it will be a tough job. i only hope & pray that congress will set up something that will be positive not half & half to assume a  of a job when he gets home after the war.  i haven't been down south yet but the negro that i've seen in new york are not and should not be together with white men. they should be in the same outfit but sleep in their own separate quarters. there is something about them that doesn't outfit for them to be associated in the same . they are getting now the best chance of their lives. maybe they will have some common sense when they come back.
the army feeds you well, clothes you well, give you good medical and dental care but not enough sleep.
the soldiers should have better food.

outfits_comment: they would be fighting and causing trouble with each other continuously.

they don't ask you what kind of a job you want. or if you want to go to school for a special job or nothing.

outfits_comment: they get along better when they have to work in a team
same at 60
long: i think politics are begining to  in the army. it seems to be getting the same as civilian life. "it isn't whats you know it's who you know

no group of negro stay as clean as they should.
i don't mind being around them but i be damn if i'll sleep around them

long: the medical attention at basic training camps should be better. more attention at the dispensaries. hospitals are perfect. i have a preference in service but i go & fight or work where ever i'm needed. it is natural to complain & squawk bu as it is said 'a general can worry when the boys don't squawk. then something is wrong."" sirs: i like this questionnaire idea very much. a fellow can get a load off his chest. keeping two races together would cause too much together. the medical attention at basic training camps should be better. there should be more attention at the dispensaries as well. hospitals on the other hand are perfect. i have a but i go and fight a war where  i'm decided. it is natural to complain and squawk but as it is said ""a general can wrong when the boys don't squawk. then something is wrong"". sirs: i like the  idea very much. a fellow can get a load off his chest.
why are the k.p. hours so long - can it be lowered from 18 hours a day to at least 10 hours?

outfits_comment: i don't think white people would mix & be content.
long: i think this questionnaire is a very good idea because it gives a soldier the opportunity to express himself.

outfits_comment: negro have a bad odor when they perspire that white people don't like

long: 48. we should talk to them even if we don't quit fighting.

outfits_comment: same as #60; i am certain that many "whites" would complain.
long: i was rather disgusted with your iq test which i took several days ago. to get more accurate measurements, it seems to me, a more varied and more detailed test, taking more time is necessary.  i have as yet to see a good army psychological test, but perhaps they are all that you need. if we are training to live and not die - as the germans are doing, - they tell us here, then exacting measures of a mans ability is needed. the average person, although probably deficient in training, possesses good intelligence and certain abilities: the way the win the war is to utilize them.

outfits_comment: we lived apart before the war a couldn't make the adjustments.
don't like to live with them
long: they stay put

about questions 15 and 18. those noncoms, especially here, certainly do take much to much advantage of their authority. i respect an noncom who has been in the service for quite awhile  and that is how a soldier should be rated before he can have authority. the reason i said i would be prouder to be a private than an officer is; i have nothing against officers, but the man who does the actual fighting is the private i respect and honor him and once again i am proud and also consider myself the happiest and one of the proudest soldiers in the u.s. army. no matter how many ratings will be offered to me, i will refuse. p.s. i hope the army does not disappoint me of being a paratrooper

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']

long: this is a good idea to let spec up our own opinion

i am an airplane mechanic. have attended army airplane mechanics school and have had 6 months experience at minter field, calif. as a mechanic + crew-chief on basic training airplanes. now i am here, being kicked around, instead of being sent to some air base for further experience on either pursuit ships or on bombers. i was more than satisfied with my army life, until i came here, but now i'm thoroughly dissatisfied + disgusted. i want to be where i believe i can do some good + that would be to any air base as an airplane mechanic.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: the people must learn that discrimination causes disunity, and disunity can lose the war.
long: i am very glad to be one of the soldiers taking this test for such tests show  democracy at work, but what i would really like to see in this country is more education and less discrimination.

outfits_comment: if they were together it would constantly cause friction.
long: gentlemen, after reading my answers to this questionnaire, you may conclude that i am a radical. you are right, i believe extreme changes are in order. i haven't much yen, to fight for democracy, knowing that everything is being worked our for and by certain classes. i believe that the catialistic form of government is tottering.  i am a great admirer of scientists, and their discoveries that benefit humanity. i hold no admiration for a government who witholds these benifits from the poorer part of the population. thanks to science, t.b. could be wiped out completely in 20 yr. thanks to captalism the poor can't afford it. i am not poor. read. delaware krumfs "why let them live" lack of time permits me to say no more.

outfits_comment: to avoid riots or disorders
long: i think it will be very helpful in helping army statistics but the colored question is purely a sectionable argument and will not prove anything.

in reference to questions 26 and 28, i give the following  as a reason to justify my answers. i came to this post with a shipment of approx 250 men. we became acquainted readily and helped form the best squadron of the post. this group was shipped out to various schools, with the exception of myself and four other men who were scratched. i have been unable to obtain any information to clear the situation up. i have been put in with another group. this is one reason why i sometimes feel worried and upset and dissatisfied and in low spirits.

outfits_comment: same as #60
long: too much emphasis on whites & negro. eleven questions are devoted about them. as far as i know the whites & negro are segregated - they are here to fight the same as we are - i can't see why they  should get more rights & privileges for just doing their job as suggested by question #57.

outfits_comment: they want the chance to prove their ability; they want to show that they don't have to be "carried"
long: the air corp must have more discipline among the enlisted men. i believe the nor - commissioned (air corp) officers are not as  at anddemocratic as they should be and therefore do not get the proper respect and obedience from their men necessary for "getting the job done." not enough "cheerful and willing obedience to the commands of your superiors" the physical training schedule should be more strictly adhered to.

i think the civil service operating in sub-depots could be + should be improved a large amount, they not only are inferior, they sometimes stand in an organization way from carying out operation that the organization's are more capable of doing than the sub-depots them selves.
i don't think a soldier should be told when he has to leave town on his days off. i don't believe in curfews.

in regards to questions 53 to 63. negro do a lot of work around a camp and a known to be very good soldier's i think they should be attached or even part of any outfit but quartered separately
cut out the politics of our government and army today and this war will end more quickly and some millions of lives and suffering

outfits_comment: there is liable to be trouble between the two races.
long: i believe the negro problem is a great question. they should be treated as they are in the south, because they are happy. if we start to give them all the privledges the white man has (and as they do in the north) we will have a lot of trouble with them after the war. i am not in favor of the present negro policy. by all means - keep the negro troops separate from the white boys. the negro will be better fighters by themselves, and i know the white boys will be.

outfits_comment: many white people have a tendency to be overbearing with the negro
long: town police usually welcomes the soldier as long as he does right mp also try to be fair until some soldier runs over them then all soldiers have to suffer for one soldiers doings. most people are doing fine in war work but we still have several who don't realize we are at war today.

outfits_comment: most groups which differ much spend their time arguing instead of working or cooperating.

long: (52) about two years ago i was acused by a colonel of being involved in unamerican activities in puerto rico  i had to return to the states as a put, to keep my family from starving while the colonel was promoted to brididier general. i would ask the president if this was fair

someday -- somewhere i should like to know just how o.c.s. applicants are chosen to attend o.c.s. i have seen one fuck-up after another go -- the worst possible men for those appointments on the whole field. it has come to the point where one looks at a shavetail and automatically wonders what kind of fuck-up he was. also why kelly field has been busted up. here we had 400 airplanes averaging 300 hours each per month and everything running smoothly. just figure up your flying time at some of these new fields and see how many of them you will have to add to-gather to get 120,000 hours a month, regardless of the number of planes -- now we are to be kicked around some more -- and again i say that _any_ man who can stomach the inefficiency and goldbricking which seems to be an integral part of the army has not what it takes to get along on the outside -- please let me out as soon as possible.

outfits_comment: because wouldn't get a - long so well.

outfits_comment: because it is better then to have them mixed up.

seems as tho some of these 90 day wonders as the boys call them should have 90 days or so more schooling. the little gold bar seem to give them the no all attitude. even tho some men are not commissioned they are more educated in there job direct than there officer. something should be done about this.

if the men in the air corps were put in the kind of work they did before entering the army. the outfit as a whole would raise its standards 500%.  in my barracks alone there is 50 men that i know who are not doing the work that they should be doing.  we have highly skilled men in our outfit which are doing non skilled work.

outfits_comment: let the negro stay in his place.

in my answer to question 48 my answer yes depends solely on the form of government these country's would adopt.

i believe that soldiers that have a trade or profession should be allowed to follow it, instead of having civilians do it if not let the soldier, that have be released and follow his trade as a civilian, thereby being of any help to the country than wasting his time doing, very little of anything

long: i personally  think if you can call the first sgt by his first name you are all right and  will come your way. in other words kiss his ass.

outfits_comment: i still say lets not over do the thing.
long: my suggestion would be to spend more time getting men to the fight & less time on surveys to see how the feel about going. they have enjoyed the privileges of this country and anything that is worth having is worth fighting for. lets do more fighting & less talking. so far this war we have talked a very good fight but actually produced very little in comparison. lets stop the hero worship when a man kills a jap. or german. he is dong a job and in all the jobs i've had they pay off in results and not the kind of a job i can talk. yours truly a g. i.

outfits_comment: as negro are proud of their accomplishments, a total negro outfit would be more effective.

why not use some common horse sense and put all pepal to work and not teach them to play.. dont be so easy with pepal from farugn countrys- clean up politics.. stop red tape first be americans
i think the men that came in for a special job should get to do the job he was trained in. other wise the air corps is a good branch of service.

outfits_comment: no comments.

outfits_comment: to prevent unnecessary arguments and fights.
long: i believe if a negro is wearing the same uniform i am wearing, and fighting for the same cause he should get the same rights and privileges i am getting. most people feel different. they say negro are bad. they are not any worse than white people are. there are just as many white men in jails or even more then colored men.
still ask why married men even with one child is in the army much less more.

these hit and miss questions are not specific and can not be answered correctly

the army should by all means when a soldier comes into the army is to give him his opinion as to where he wants to go, and what job he can do the best. then give him a fair chance to prove himself cabable. if he don't succeed he may get a transfer. i am in the engrs. but my training in civilian life gives me good chance to be in ordinance or air corps. this is a 'grit"" that i am sure the average soldier is of the same opionion. frankly! i think the ""classification test is all the ""bunk"". a. soldier:

there should be one more question in the pamphlet and that is.  "why don't you like the army"?  my answer is: "we never have much time to  in the evenings, always some equipment to clean on the barracks to scrub, whic allows us very little time to write letters, which is the only thing that keeps what little morale we have left. up"  in short the army is a hell of a place to be.

about negro - in certain parts of u.s.a. a negro person is treated good & in other parts, especially the south they are treated pretty bad. if you keep them in a class by themselves you will get better results. most white people do like to associate with them in any way

all i wish and everyone i talked with that is in novmber 52

in the first place i am a man with only one eye and have a very good trade that they need a lot of men for right now as it takes four years to learn, not that i am kicking about being in the army as i would just as soon go over right now as not and believe i could keep up my end of it at any time as that is the only thing wrong with me but i could also do a hell of a lot of good working in a defense plant as i am all ready trained for that work and know i could do a lot more good in my line than having to train other men for it. i am a molder in a foundry and they need lots of them right now.

if an enlisted man is physically qualified to be in a military police organization, he should be physically qualified to be an officer in such an organization. this is not true of our battalion. recently three men otherwise qualified have been rejected for officer candidate school on physical reasons.

outfits_comment: because white and negro soldiers don't mix very good.
i say separate them because the white people won't try to get along.

i think if the war workers would do more work and not so much striking we could win this war a lot faster.  i think the govner should take our some of the wor plants where poepl does so much striking

long: 1. i think that lots of civilians are not doing their share. should be watched more closely. 2. i also think the farm problem, the food problem should have more consideration.

outfits_comment: same as no. 60
long: concerning questions 5 & 6 i enlisted for ground corp air mechanics and was placed in an infantry division. i still don't think i was classified by a qualified men at the classification center. i know of many other cases of men poorly classified and consider this one of the army's worst evils. they have often admitted that this is a war of specialization and still they allow men to be wrongly classified by incompetent men. i think this is quite general.

i have always heard that the army will help one to get a better job after he is out. after two years, i can truly say that is false. there are a few men who are picked or it would be better to say lucky enough to be able to get a chance to go to special schools where they can learn different trades. the main reason most of the men do not want to be officers is that if one will look at some of these 90 day wonders you will find out soon enough. it use to be a great honor to be an army officer. but now with every tom dick and harry it is quite different

outfits_comment: by and large units will work soother - the function of the army now is to win the war.
there are always enough southerners in any outfit to cause trouble.
long: i think this is supposed to be an army of men that were to be classified and put in the service where they would be of some use, but to my way of thinking it is not that way.

outfits_comment: same as #60
long: no. 7 - for the amount of buses available.

i think a good part of the civilians are not doing their part to help win the war. i would say most all of them are making a lot more money than they ever made before in their lives and yet some of them try to strike. all the people who want to strike should be put in the army and paid $50 a month instead of the $400 they are getting now.  i wish the service of supply would see to it that fort lewis would follow cir. 405 and not have so much red tape in trying to get something. supply hasn't been made much easier since the start of the war.

the army training on the whole is rotten. partly to blame are the officers, officers idea of  of training should be given out. also a lot of useless and irrelevant things are given as training.  many of the officers are unqualified and haven't been in the ranks long enough or haven't been in the  at all. have no idea on how to get along with men. or have superiority complexs which create as dislike  of the men. and also too much of the book type of teaching to make soldiers instead of practical experience and numerous other things which i lack space to express myself.

outfits_comment: for good of both races.
as a general rule one race will cooperate better than more than one race.
because the majority of the people dont like to associate with them.
long: there are to many square pegs in round holes in this army the only reason for it is the inefficiency of the office  and a few hard headed officers in command of something they don't know any thing about. for instance try and find out something by going to your immediate superior. he don't know and don't know who do know. it doesn't make any differnece what it is you want to know nobody know where to find out.

their seems to be a lot of things unnecessary in military life. seems like a modern army should be more stream lined in their dutys  in other words when anything is to be done it should be really necessary.  close order drill isn't necessary for a fighting force, although it's all right for training for a parade  officers now days seem to demand more curtisy than the old timers. in other words they are more like babys  the idea of having to kill somebodys rear end to get a pass to go to town. they should be able to trust us without permition after all we're all regular americans and believe in being free.

outfits_comment: it is my belief that they would train harder together.
there would be too many fights if negro & whites were in the same outfit. we have enough fits as it is now.
long: the idea of this questionnaire is good. i hope it is more than just a scrap of paper. all soldiers thrive on good meals. a good meal smooths over a lot of rough spots & stops soldiers from complaining so much. our meals are not so hot. breakfast is pretty good but dinner & supper sometimes smell. you never get two good meals in a row. i have been in 3 camps & in all of them the bus service has been lousy. some outfits do not give enough week end passes & if they do they are so short that you meet yourselve going & coming. between a very short pass & lousy bus service a  soldier gets disgusted. induction centers herd you around like cattle.  new soldiers are badly treated. little is thought of their needs or comforts. as a soldier i got very little practice with a rifle. i fired a 22 but never a 30-30 & i am in the army 4 months.

outfits_comment: i would not want to sleep alongside of a negro.
long: no comments.

outfits_comment: it might be a good idea to have them together, something new.
long: it would be a good idea to outfit men in jobs in the army they can do - too many square pegs in round holes, so to speak;

outfits_comment: most write do not get along with the negro.
long: the soldiers do not have priviage out of camp most places are close when they get to town. such as taverans and night clubs. soldiers like a little excitement and pleasure when they leave camp.  at the camps the non coms do not treat the private right. they show too much of their authoraties. they think the privates are just a bunch of kids which they can use for decoys.

outfits_comment: there is better cooperation when not mixed
long: negro have a right to the same privilege in government and business as me. combining our social life would be degrading to our standard of living.  history has shown that wars run in cycles of about every one and a half to two generations. people don't change in nature so wars will still be. if aggressive nations are quelled before they get too great such wars may be avoided.  our jobs after the war will be controlled by how the government controlls prices so that our consuming power is held up.
question 3 i don't know if they changed volunteered to the draft question 14 i worked about 3 miles or so from grand rapids on a few farms season, and out of the city for 6 to 10 yrs

outfits_comment: the negro acts, thinks, & are different habits & all respects
white people don't like to have negro mixed in, but to me there is a war to be won.
long: as far as having separate service clubs for the negro soldiers and white soldiers is concerned, i think it is a fairly good idea. a p.x. to me is a place where a person will go in and buy what he wants and get out. so therefore i see no reason why separate px should be erected of had. whereas a service club is a place to go and associate with one another. therefore negro would be less likely to be welcomed.

outfits_comment: they would feel better about it and so would the white soldiers

long: this questionnaire is a very good idea, and it makes a man think.  i think there should be training schools for non-coms. for our outfit we have some corporals, that are corporals because of seniority only. all men wishing to do so, should be allowed to take the o.c.s. exam on entrance in the army.  there is much equipment at this camp that is not being used, and it could be put to much better use overseas.  a personal gripe is, that we have been in this camp for 4 days, supposedly for  additional  training, and i've been on one detail or another every day, thru no fault of my own. i  like  to learn, and i don't get my chance.  we are 18 men, but i think we would put up a good fight, if given a chance.
i think this questionnaire is a good thing just see what most soldier's different ideal of different things in life

why does the army cry for specialists in radio and precision work and stick them any damn place they want to when they get them. i could qualify in both and was stuck in an m.p. outfit. would have been much better in either one because i'm . my eyes are pretty bad. 20/400 there is a little waste of time in the army but such a thing can't be helped in such an enormous organization. otherwise i like being a soldier. only wish i can help my country win the war. thank you for letting me express myself.

outfits_comment: the negro & whites are not sufficiently adjusted to one another to enable them to cooperate.
at sometimes the negro think that they are bitter then the white soldiers
long: well there isn't very much that i have to comment about, because i am itn an better good outfit at the time being.

outfits_comment: because they would not get along
long: this is what i can't see why this don't give us boys with only d good against a chance to be more than we are a home leave push back will of my time in the army and i thing i could do part as good as the antoher camp

outfits_comment: they function differently at work or soldiering
long: i think that commissoned officers in the army should be men who have came up threw the ranks.

outfits_comment: give him a big black car and a stripe suit and hes
long: why is it when a soldier goes in to town they charge him sky high for anything he buys. why not improve the bus lines and service clubs. why is it that our co. out of a whole division can only get a pass for a day and a half  when our company supposed to be one of the very best in the division. instead of praising a man for doing or trying to do his best, kick him in the face. why?

outfits_comment: the white soldiers dont have to take orders from them

long: speaking of my experience the army lets you only educate yourself in one line of work and that's all. i would suggest if a person is capable of being able to handle a few jobs give him the opportunity. i do not favor the vices(drinking, swearing, & gambling) of the men in our army. no man will make anything of himself in bad company. church should be much stronger with the men in our army. by prayer all of us together will only bring this war to an end. my suggestion is that the officers set an example by prayer, and it is sure to come down to the men. i quote from scripture: ""without me you can do nothing.""

outfits_comment: because the negro think they are better than the white man.
long: why don't the army do something about transportation for the service man on pass? the civilians seem to take up most of the week end seats. let the civilians travel during the week. why do some camp have better pass or furlough privileges then others??

i am in this army now from oct 1 1941 and i think i worked as hard as any man in my outfit but it seems like i never will get a promotion. i took care of the weapons in this company for about 9 months and they always have the excuse that an armorer does not deserve a rating in the engineers. i think as long as we are combat engineers my work should call for a t iv rating.
too many uniform restrictions
my pet peeve about army life is that the non-coms & officers always hurry you up so that you'll have plenty of time to wait.

outfits_comment: they should be in separate outfits because they are different from white people.
a negro can work much better with his own race.
because some would have hard feelings about the races.
to get along better because some people still have that old feeling about them
there would be better harmony as there is now.
same as 61
long: it is fairly good but does not cover the subject. there are a lot of points that could be brought up.

outfits_comment: no white man wants to take orders or share a latrine with colored troops

long: i would rather be at a camp nearer to home so that when off duty on week-ends i could visit home. some officer's do not consider enlisted men at all. patience in training new men should be stressed more

i wonder why i did not't get in the kind of work i was told i'd do, that was told to me at classification center. i was told i'd be welding & mechanic. i also do other types of work which  is used in army of which i believe would be of more use to army. i'd like to get in something i'd be more use to army than what i'm doing now.
the men ought to have a chance to transfer to another orginasation.

outfits_comment: the feeling is still to great to mix them up.
long: what does an electrician do in the engineers.
i am satified here in the army because i have a lot to fight for & if we all fight togeater the war will end quicker & we can go home & have peace again.

outfits_comment: the negro has special traits as a soldier and should be used under these conditions.
long: it seems a better understanding should be reached between civilians and soldiers in army areas. one or two  of both elements, shouldn't't cloud one's views on the other.
the none comission officer are not fair with every one

outfits_comment: they would like it better also
long: most officers are all right, but we are all in this war together, and i don't understand why they are treated as priledged characters. i am an enlisted man and cannot go into the nicer night clubs because i am. civilians may goto these clubs. an officer buys elaborate clothes, yet i cannot buy anything that i think would improve my uniform in my opinion the army tries to keep the enlisted man from looking as well dressed in his uniform as the officer in his. an enlisted man should not be treated as a lower class indivdual than an officer. they should have the same rights.

outfits_comment: they tried to mix us in fort crook and it did not't work two weeks. they took advantage of their privilege.
there is still a good deal of race prejudice + hatred
long: 1. i think roosevelt is doing a mighty fine job- 2. this war will no doubt bring out better conditions-a more advanced age in which to live 3. better conditions for the poor in all countries and possibly a socialistio trend 4. re: to non comm leaders- what about selecting men for leadership- and if they do not work out well-work out a system of transfer & demotion - poor leadership in battle has caused a lot the deaths of many a good soldier select leaders for experience (past) as well as good behavior- this is very important especially in the engineers- & other skilled units
on question 40.  the men who care to work con get a job alright if they'll just try,
the questionnaire is very good & brings out some good points but what it has to do with the indivial is be on me, so you, queston the person with question that point indivialy?

outfits_comment: haven't got anything against them but doesn't care to mix with them
there should be a distinction between white people + negro anywhere.
long: it seems to me a good many officers show partiality toward men they knew in civilian life especially in the national guard outfits. some young officers seem to be under the impression that enlisted men are to be dogged rather than that we are all in here to do a job & not enjoying the setup anymore than they are. some outfits stationed permanently in a garrison are given better rations than field troops training in the same camp.

outfits_comment: difference in living habits + race
long: (#52) why aren't huge wages cut to lower cost of war so the debt can be paid some day? many young men are still working at high wages & getting bragged on for it. why let healthy dodgers make a fortune when older men who can not do combat duty can do this work. the army is full of these men now & they have the war at heart. pay they army pay & reduce the casual co.

i don't think it's fair to give the men a sweet story when they enter the service as to being classified according to they exams. i find the men that entered with me were not classes accordingly. i am a mechanic with eleven years experience & find myself a . i know i could serve my country better in a mechanical branch of service. i don't believe i would stay in the army for i have a place of business i locked when i came into service. i would like to open my business again after the war.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: it all right
long: no place for a married man with 3 children in the army as man married should be home with his wife a children. not in the army. there is lot of men is not married and in the army & no
