outfits_comment: because white people can't work with negro
long: the army food is pretty some of the times some of the time it is not. you don't enough food half of the time eather. some of the time they say your on your own time after 5:00 when you have to clean up everything no time for your self. after you get through with that always on the go.

outfits_comment: i'm sure a white soldier wouldn't like the idea of taking orders from a negro officer or non-comm.
because they be better with their same  people.

long: the px are to crouded 1 to a regement is not enough the service is very poor and the p.x. personal are too indpendent i think the liquor restrictions should be lifted in army camps we should be able to buy it on the on the post.

no man can come into the service and in three months kow enough to be an officer. it has proved itself time and time again. why not take soldiers who know most of the service and make them officers. even if there i.q. isn't above 110, that should make no difference as long as he is a good solder and knows his stuff. there are too any men being thought wrong because the officers don't know their self. that is what costs a lot of men to lose there lifes and get that don't give a damn feeling. i know i have been in for 5 and 1/2 years and training ?[} since the 5th of

outfits_comment: same answers as 60 & 62
long: i think a year compulsory training after this war would be a good thing & keep us prepared for any eventuality.  as i am married i would like to be stationed closer to home so that i could see my wife every so often.  i think it will be pretty hard for the soldier to get back the same job he held before the war. as he can be replaced & sometimes by someone better than himself.

outfits_comment: they work better that way
long: be more careful of who they make non-commission officers. give us enough deacent food and we will always be happy. give us some cooks that can cook. get rid of some of these 30 day wonders who think they are officers.

i feel many soldier could do lots more if the were giving a chance to show their skill. there are many in the infantry that can not stand long hikes. where if they were given in another branch of service they could help their country more. frankly speaking i feel many are just an expince on the government as it now is.  question no. 47. i feel that in some branches of the service that soldiers have a fair chance for promotion but not in the outfit to which i belong.

outfits_comment: we have too many bigoted persons in the army
long: not until the white population will become  more just and understand the morale point of view that a negro has a soul and is entittle to human rights. till then we must keep them separated or run the risk of disunity in our army.

outfits_comment: white soldiers would not work together with them and would make a poor fighting outfit
they should be separated as far as living together.
long: from the time i could walk i pictured the army with high ideals and standards. it twas always my ambition to be in the service. but after a year it has been a great disappointment. all my romantic and adventerous illusions have been shattered and i have nothing but contempt for the army. maybe i am in the wrong branch or part of the service to full-fill my dreams, but i can well imagine all branches are the same. i believe if the army had proved to be what i'd pictured it i could make it my life career. i like the association of fellows from all walk of life, and if every type.

outfits_comment: because their our some good white men and bad and their our some good negro men and bad and if they got together their would just be trouble
long: in my opinon these questions are kind of hard especially these about the negro and the white. the negro are all right as long as you leave them along.
i think that most of the men in the army are satisfied, and that they will fight hard to get it over with, sooner the better, so they can all go back home to their families.

outfits_comment: they will work together better if each race is in a separate outfit.
long: if i may have the privilege to do so i would like to comment on this war in general. my first part is with the service.  myself and all the rest of the fellows are not particularly satisfied. although i wouldn't change places for anyone now, the fact that the army life keeps you from doing the things i would like to is what is so bad. i  planning on getting married before i entered the service and now i haven't even seen my girl in 10 months. i'm sure everyone could understand that would make anyone a little distrustful,  though they do not have to fight for freedom and the right to live the "american way of life." personally, i'll never be satisfied anywhere until i can be with the girl i intend to marry.

outfits_comment: i mean in different regiments, and don't mix them, so that they live in the same barracks, it's bad enough with max
long: i don't think the army should have such a problem with the negro as much as with the mexicans at least negro speak english, they should put the mex. by themselves if they have to continue to talk their own language, or have them speak english all the time. details on week-ends should be cut down. a week-end on detail brakes a soldiers morale more than anything else could, and transportation should be improved, as soldiers won't mind the service as much if he could get away from it a least a week-end little things like week-end passes might help win this ware quicker than firing on ranges or any other training when, they do less important things during the week.

this war is nothing but a political war, fighting for the rich people while they sit at home. it is not the police or mps. that are unfair with the soldiers it is mostly the civilians, they dred the soldiers. it seems that in civilian life the people treat a fello better. they rob a soldier when he wants to buy anything in town and i wish that the army food was better, as it, its pretty crumie. to many ristrictions, as a soldier no time for himself all for the army. it is really unfair
49. if they give him the chance to make good.

i like to live where there are not any negro alloud and the negro to stay in his place and the white man stay in his place. i do not like negro with white people. i don't like to go to the north and my wife set beside a big black negro. the negro in north should be like negro in the south.

outfits_comment: i think they get along a lot better in separate outfits
long: as a whole the u.s. army is a good army but i can't see how some of the officers ever got where they are but i realize there is bound to be some mistakes made where so many men are together.  if possible there should be a place near or in every camp for the men families. it would help a lot if the men could have there wives + children with them. i think it would help the morale very much.

i don't know whether i have answered the foregoing questions correctly, as i am just a private and have not had much opportunity to observe, on account of my short period of service and rigid training.

outfits_comment: there would be a lot id dissension among the men if they had to take orders for a negro non-comm.
long: 1. i do not think you are given a fair interview when reporting to your induction camp. because if you are trained in one type of field i think you would be more valuable in it than a man who has had little or no training in it and should be placed where you are best fitted. 2.  i do not think the handling of furloughs to the men are handled correctly. one division gives its men two & three furloughs a year and another gives only one if any.

outfits_comment: every one in an outfit must get along with his fellow soldiers & negro & white don't get along anywhere.
because they couldnt get along
long: well i like the army good but dont like some ways in it. i think i can get along fine in the army. it is a god place for a single boy. i am not single but i like it purty good.

i think that the draft boards are inefficient because there are too many old men and cripples getting in the service thereby causing a lot of unnecessary work and hospitalization.  i also believe that altogether too many men are not getting into the lines they are bet fitted for. also it seems that quite a number of doctors & nurses don't understand a lot of cases.

outfits_comment: i don't think the white and negro could get along together.
for reasons stated in 60 & 62
long: i think the questionnaire was very fair & straight forward. it would have been a good idea to ask the enlisted man what he thinks about the class distination between officers & enlisted men. why should an enlisted man fear his connander instead of having a friendly feeling of respect for him that comes about willingly & justifiably.

outfits_comment: the part i would like to discuss is the conditions of this camp for basic training. i came in this camp at the start of the rainy season (october) it rained all through my basic. when we were firing on the range for record, it rained and it was also very cold. it is my idea that under these conditions a soldier does not benefit as much from his training as he would in a more suitable climate. when he is wet and cold most of the time he can't concentrate on the problem at hand, therefore he doesn't gain much from his basic. due to the weather there is entirely too much sickness.
long: the part i would like to discuss is the condition of this camp for basic training. i came in this camp at the start of the rainy season. (oct) it rained all through my basic. when we were firing on the range for record, it rained and it was also very cold. it is my idea that under these conditions a soldier does not benefit as much from his training as he would in a more suitable climate. when he is wet and cold most of the time he can't concentrate on the problem at hand, therefore he doesn't gain much from his basic. due to the weather there is entirely to much sickness
the questionnaire is really something & everybody should have a chance taking it because it just about covers everything a man would probably ask about army life in general.

outfits_comment: negro and whites never did or never will mix well enough to have coordination.
long: i am not sure of making good in the army as i would like to have a job in a supply room as i had it in the c.c.c. and liked it. if a man is interested in his job he will do it much better than just being mildly interested.
i have none to make.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']

long: i think that there is too many questions on the relationship between the white and negro soldiers. the red race is let to intermigle with the white, why not the black, as long as they are americans? that is why they call this the united states

outfits_comment: could not get along together at all.
long: opinions of men (in the service or not in the service) are too varied. no two peoples opinion run the same on all subjects. i cant see that it did much good. nothing in the questionnaire will bring any changes that will help me in the least or any of my buddies or comrades on country. i would like to know why so many questions concerned the negro race. they are equal to us in ever detail except for color.

outfits_comment: races should never be mixed.

long: the one thing that makes it bad in the army as far as getting ahead is concern is, a person or pvt.must have a good straw in his company to get ahead, it isn't based much on what he knows so much its how good his straw is and my opinion thats not the right way to run a outfit.

outfits_comment: don't no
long: we fight for this freedom. we must work and work hard. built more airplanes, tanks, ships and all the other thing we fight together and work together. all the other boys over sea are gave their lives to safe the country

the general idea in civilian life is that the army places men where they will do the most good. by that i mean in the trades they have studied and are interested in. i have not found this to be true. i know i would be of more value and happier if i were in my trade. it doesn't seem as if they will even give you a chance. i believe that the soldiers morale would be higher if they were in their proper place.

outfits_comment: the white and negro will never get along as complete equals
long: in regard to #27 i feel that i have not been given an opportunity to show my qualifications for a non-comm

every soldier who is willing to go across to fight should be heard at once, and if qualified to be sent and not kept over here for a year two or more, i have noticed on the old timers there morale is getting low, they are forgetting a lot they have been taught in classes, due to the fact that they don't get a chance to use most of the stuff they have learned. if i had to spend a year or more in this country and receive the little reviews that we have now, i will be eligible to join the bums and daunks we have around majority of our camps.

outfits_comment: i think they can work better and have a better chance.
long: i don't see why this country can't spend a little more money on a few men to go around checking different camps & outfits istead of wasting money on clothes like they do. give you one outfit then in about six months change them. to much money is being wasted on the change of clothing. i don't mean keep the boys short in cloths but don't wast clothing and time by taking in clothing then a few months turn around and give it back to them.
it's a good idea, should have them about every 6 months.

outfits_comment: refer to 60 & 63
long: i don't feel as though talents and abilities of solidiers are considered strongly enough upon entrance to the service. i don't fee that men assigned to classify a man into the respective branches are capable of determining what should happen to solidier regarding the start he gets in the army. i feel as though there should be more done to dicover soldiers various abilities and talents.

you dident ask about the officers in the army, most of them are not wourth of their jobs. they judge a man not by what he knows but if he will play ball with him and not stick up for the men. most motor officers are completely ignorant of what a truck is made of. most officers think they are christ themselves. to get by in the army you have to have a good line of bull shit. i have been in two years now and never enjoyed a day of it. how these officers can screw things up oh boy!!! ill be glad to get out, when it all over.
it will, indeed, be a surprise to me if any action will be taken on the comments made on these questionnaires.

i think i should be home on the farm because i lived there all my life and am capable of doing any thing that has to done on a farm. in fact i could do more at home then in the army my folks at home have to much work to do now already
i could do more for my country being on my farm. was not given a chance for a deferment as i was needed at home very bad. hope this war ends soon.

it is my opinion that after this war that the selective service be retained and all physically outfit young men on attaining the age of 18 be given a years military training. if this is done never again will be caught unprepared. true it would be a cost to the taxpayers but in later years in event of another conflict the cost would be less.

long: too many men have qualifications which the army can not use but which other branches of service can use. for example i received a complete training course as a light plane flight instructor, and i have c.a.a. licenses. the army check pilots agree that i would make a good light plane instructor. they recommend it. yet, no one does anything about it because there are no buck private instructors of light planes in the army. this doesn't make sense in the view of the shortage of instructors in caa programs. meanwhile i rot in an army camp + watch 2 years of flying experience + thousands of dollars go to waiste.

my opinion may not be very bias as i have obtained a transfer and will be leaving the outfit soon for an entirely different type of work.
well i haven't got much to say a bout it only i will be glad when the war is over. so i can go back home & be with my baby

i believe every married man with children should be exempt from armed service until all single men and married men without children are drafted. also if there are several in from one family at least one boy should be permitted to remain home if the parents are aged or unable to support themselves. if the government stepped in to prevent strikes and absenteeism amongst the workers i'm sure the morale of the armed forces would be much better. there is no reason, only during war, why labor can't be managed similar to the army. i believe every married man with children should be exempt from armed service until all single men and married men without children are drafted. also if there are several in from one family at least one boy should be permitted to remain home if the parents are aged or unable to support themselves.

long: military courts are to severe on service man, in civilian court men are inosence until proven guilty in the army it is entirily different.  let's all fight for a complete victory. "v"

i feel that the majority of men in the u.s., if had a choice of occupation in the army would make far better men and soldiers, their advancement would be faster and the morale higher if they were to do the work they were qualified to do. most just live from day to day, ambitionless and hoping for a break that seemingly never comes. i think most of the drafted men are misplaced in induction centers and should have a choice in their work. course this is impossible because there is so many men.

outfits_comment: same as reason #60
long: although the questionnaire is a good one i don't see its value because of the fact that i sincerely believe that no action will be taken on its results - to me it looks like just some more wasted time + money

the army ought to put the fellow in the line of work he is used to and not where the noncom want to put him. this outfit stinks. all the work that i learned in civilian life i forgot. now after the war is over i will have to start off from the beginning again.

the eats are very poor. why is it they make noncom out of men that is not very sharp and can't downwhat they should and are drunk every night. why is it your clothing is not all the same color. when you are unable to do field work they keep you in a combat outfit and since you can't  do field work and are on limited service you have not got a chance to become a noncom. why not send you to some outfit where limited service men can be noncoms. why not give the boys there 15 day furelough at the end of the six month like they are supposed to. why do they send a soldier as far from home as they can when he goes in the army. why can't you get out of the army in some other thing like the navy, coast guards. i fact the soldier is just pushed around by everyone they have  no rights at all.

outfits_comment: they have no good thoughts for a white man although there exceptions cant trust them.
i think negro get along better with negro and the same goes for the whites.
long: there is a lot i would like to say about the strike & labor disputes going on in our war and armament factories.  if people could realize that if this war isn't won by the allied nations, their life of money & pleasure is over & a new life of horror & hardship will come.  they are the ones who are making it harder for us to finish this war with victory.  if they think they are having a tough life now, let them lay in a fox-hole on a fighting front for a while & possibly they wouldn't kick about the $1.50 to $1.75 an hour they are making now. or let them "sieg heil" for the rest of their lives.  from a private

i think this questionnaire will be of great value after they all are compared and averages taken.

the above is my honest opinion about the war. as for negro i believe they make good soldiers and will fight ok. but to mingle them with white soldiers is against our ideals and to do so will cause considerable trouble. however i think the war effort is going along good and we will win in the end.

outfits_comment: they should be in with there own race because they would never get along.
long: i can't see why a wife should get more money than a mother. a wife can always work and the mother is usually to old to work so why don't they give the mother more.

i accept army life for what it is, and the cause at present; but would not surrender to it from civilian life.

outfits_comment: they just don't like to be separated from their friends.

long: i believe we all should pitch in and win the war. but when boys grow 18 or 8th grade they should each receive 6 mo training a measure to insure peace for always. a country wanting peace can preserve it with well trained men and plenty of equipment to back it up. men at a younger age would get more out of the army. i believe officers try to who their athority to much in the army. the better men are treated, the harder they will work when the time comes.

for my part of the outfit i'm in is that it is a pretty  good politician outfit. but for estimation and seeing how things are ran i would like to see a soldier made is what he knows about the things and details not because he is brought up by some sergeant because he is good pal of his or trusts him good because from my idea and thinking if their was to be an interviewing test from commissioned officers before we got across they would only be about 4 ncos. that would pass it.
i believe that men who were experienced mechanics & mechanists before they entered the army should be given the same kind of work in the army.

outfits_comment: whites like myself would become very violent
long: i joined the army 3 1/2 years ago, used 3 of it training as a radio operator on a combat ship. and now they've put me to work as a grease monkey. why not put me where i can apply my knowledge. i know nothing of mechanics - am not a leader of men - but i know radio.-

question 24- do you usualy feel that what you are doing in te army is worthwhile or not? concerning this question- no- personally i believe i would make a better soldier if i were put into a combat outfit. after being in the army for 15 months learning all the things which are essential and being trained in a technical school- i believe i am better suited for a combat outfit.

pertaining to question 30, i would rather be in an outfit that stayed in the u.s. because my job is to train personnel. i have been trained in that job by the army at quite an expense. it would be foolish to spend more money on me for additional training. before i aquired this training i wanted to be in a combat outfit.

there aren't many questions regarding the proper placement of men in the armed forces. i feel as everyone else feels that engine mechanics etc should be allowed to do all that they are capable of doing which doesn't mean gassing and oiling planes. if the army is going to draft good mechanics and highly technical men they should be allowed to make use of their skills in the army if not they should be left as civilians. i see no reason why being in the army should stop a man from doing what he is best fitted for when there is a great need for his ability.

i passed tests to take electricity in the army. i was promised than i would get it. how would you feel if you would then end up pushing a rag over a plane day after day. then hear your president say time is so important, so vital. in short the army cut my throat.

the reason i feel as i do about the white and the negro race is solely because i was born in texas and have been raised up, to not mix with the negro. however, my feelings are changing since i am in the army and i feel this has greatly helped me to realize the importance of friendliness toward them.

outfits_comment: we cannot change the beliefs and traditions of some people without fully educating them, and showing them what really causes war.
long: as i have spoken to many soldiers, i know that many are anxious to fight now, but they seldom are confronted with problems of the future, if they can have a good time now. i am anxious to do mightty deeds in this war, but am always confronted with the future.

why doesn't the president do something about the guys who are working in factories, producing vital war necessities, going on strike and wanting more money. seems to me if he would take a bunch of the strikers and put them in the army for foreign duty it would stop all those strikes. all the workers are making more money now than they ever made in their lives. suppose they had to do the same work for $50.00 a month like several million soldiers do?

long: a great deal of this questionnaire is concerned apparently with racial distinctions and associations. perhaps this is a very important problem at this time, but others seem more paramount to me. certainly this is no time for racial difficulties within the u.s. when other problems are to be dealt with at once. i do not believe in oppressing negro to any extent, but i am sure difficulties can be avoided at this time by segregation in both social & military activities. give them the same opportunity the whites have for training, recreation, etc.

it is a very good procedure to obtain the true frank opinion of the men in the armed forces. this opinion has much to do with our fighting strength. it may help put the round pegs in the round holes and square pegs in the square holes. a machine works much better with the proper parts in the proper place and if they are of the best quality for that part. men can do most in their own climate and trend.

i have been in the air corps three months and so far it has been nothing but a game of politics. to make a rating, a fellow must do practically everything for his non-coms one of which is to keep him furnished with licqor and this is a little difficult to do when a guy doesn't drink himself.  soldiers are not too aware of the fact that we are fighting a war - our men should be more serious minded and i believe things would get along much better in the days to come.

outfits_comment: i don't think they would function as unit properly.

long: i think that the farmer is more needed at home then in the army. many civil - service jobs can be taken by more compident help that is in the army that can qualify. the food situation at the present is in such a muddle that it is causing more of a scare to people then i think it should. many experienced help if only properly placed in qualified jobs can make it releive the strain for the service men as well as the civilion in work & off time.

outfits_comment: because i'm from texas & texans don't like negro very much but let them have an outfit for themselves.

long: no complaints about the questionnaire, but about the curfew, why should officers be exempted their job should be more important - they get paid more. another thing an officer is no better than i or any other enlisted man. if he has more horse sense then men will respect him but he certainly isn't a god just because he has bars. there is too much social difference between enlisted men & officers. the army tries to divide us like people have negro & whites. i'd like to see more respect to enlisted men or less to officers. saluting gets to be a boresome job in town. on the post or addressing an officer down town - salute otherwise let us save wear & tear on our arms.

outfits_comment: because of discrimination & racial prejudice still existent

long: my only cause for discomfort is that negro are on my post and the majority of them are overbearing.

they would all get along better by being separate.
long: i think that the officers of the army should have more consideration of their men than some of them do. i also think the government should have it so that the bus lines running to and from camp would not hold a man up on his fare. besides these i have no complaints except i would like to do the job that i am fitted for and the one that will help win the war the quickest.

the questionnaire ask about the men working together and cooperating, well i think if politics were left out of the army and the army was run on a purely cooperative bases for each man to do his part, i think the war would be ended much quicker. i feel that we all have a job to do and each man should be made do an equal part of work to obtain the goal for which we are fighting.  i believe in doing the job which has to be done then having timeoff for pleasure, but all work and no play drops the morral in the arny as well as for every phase of life.

outfits_comment: because the whites feel the negro inferior and cooperation would be null.
long: one question asked about a man with ability getting ahead. it is my opinion that he should, but they figure service to be the deciding factor, and i feel that lessens the incentive to work hard to get ahead.  there is too much politics and apple polishing in the army.  the army is a great institution, but i am afraid any civilian business if run the same way would fold.

outfits_comment: same comment as in #62
the whites and negro very seldom get along together when they are in the same camp.
i do not know whether it would be acceptable to the majority yet.
long: i am well satisfied with conditions in the air corps, but i believe conditions would be even better if the discipline were a bit more rigid. the conditions under which we live are satisfactory but individual relationships could be bettered if the purpose for doing things were better understood.

why dose civilian personal in aircraft maintance do work at such a high rate of pay? why can't we do it? in the the theater of operations we will have to do the same work. we might as well learn now. whe we get in the war game it will be to late to learn. i believe that some of them are more inerested in getting in their forty hours and time & a half. we find all kinds of write ups an our planes when they come back from a.r. i think some of them are better farmers than aircraft workers.

long: i would like to make a suggestion (my opinion) wouldn't it be much better for the country +men soldiers of this country if  across to know how and when to operate machinery instead of civilians. they would be much better trained in different lines. the civilians are being paid good money to perform these jobs; whereas a soldier could do this particular job or jobs for maybe half as much money + at the same time help himself in trades that would help him after the war. now there maybe some branches that  couldn't do this, but the one i'm in could.  i maybe wrong- but i'm hopeing for it.

some times i thik; "it isn't what you know or how hard you try - but who you know, an how long you have known them - betters your chances for promotions -

it's a good way to find out how many men in the service are satisfied with their present life. the viewpoints of the majority may lead to the correction many faults now present in army life. gives the men a chance to blow off steam which in turn makes them feel better.

1. i don't think this questionnaire will give a true cross section of the soldiers thoughts. 2. many of the important things a soldier complains about have been omitted. 3. why should the negro problem enter into this questionnaire at all? i'm liberal minded--& believe in equal rights for all--but can't quite understand why a racial problem should enter into a questionnaire seeking information about the g.i.'s attitude toward the army. personally --i think our army is ok.
most of the things a soldier does his complaining about has been omitted. therefore i don't believe you can get a very good cross - section of what the average soldier think about the army

i haven't been in the army very long but i do know that this is the only place for me or any other young kid. wife or no wife - there is enough older men to do the jobs in the plants - and don't forget that the women are doing a very god job too.
negro should have a separate p. x & clubs of their own because they are then in their  own. they  ought to have the same privileges & entertainment as white soldiers but apart, in their own category.
i heartily believe that a years army training for men as soon as they reach 21 yrs will benifet them morally and physically. and it would cut down the crime in all sections of the country.

outfits_comment: they work better with their own group
long: i think the questionnaire is very good to get the general idea of how the soldier lives & feels about the war and its possibilities. for my part i think we will always have wars some where in the world.

some soldiers own home and place, for instance farms, that they could be moved close to, to help take care of, and still remain in the army, especially in a non combat unit, and if their farms and businesses are producing to the good and long life of the united states, and then if necessary for them to go over seas they might have it in condition that someone who is not a soldier, or can not be a soldier due to some physical defect, but can still supervise a farm, can take over while he is gone. i am ready to go where i am most needed regardless whiether i like it or not.

outfits_comment: i just don't like negro and most of the southern people don't either
long: i think that all men serving in the armed forces should be forced to speak the english language, that is if he can, not muttering some lingo all the time.  i think the men in the army should be given ratings for what they can do rather than to get them from what we soldiers call hand - shaking, let them all earn them.  i don't think the privates show the proper respect for the noncoms.

long: i feel the questionnaire is a very good idea and touches the important subjects that should be discussed.

there is a lot of partially showed in our outfit. if you play basketball, football, or baseball you get a rating very quick. if you buy some t/sgt. or s/sgt a drink or whiskey & run around after him all time he will get you a rating. i don't believe in this. i worked just as hard as i could & tried to accomplish all i could but still no ratings. worked this way for about four months & now i take off from work every chance i get, why not, it doesn't do you any good to work, you get nothing in return for it. i now have my application in to go to officers candidate school & i certainly hope i get to go & i sincerely feel i can fulfill that position if no parcially is shown in. i will not say i am extra smart but i feel i am average. made 126 on my a.g.c. test. this thing of "the guys who carries the biggest line of bull doesn't outfit in here" & neither does relation.

outfits_comment: same as answer to #60
long: i think it is a very good idea and believe it helps morale in that we enlisted men feel we are able to get our ideas out of our system whether it does any real good or not.
no. 9 my answer is yes if it could be arranged if business or something did not't become interfered with by it.

10 - if i had a better chance to better myself at some other camp i would rather be there. however as to this being a good camp - in my estimation it is a perfect example - in fact i don't believe there is a better one. 47 - in a roundabout way - yes. however i think we are losing it here in the u.s. it is my estimation that after this war we will have only a small percentage of the freedom we now enjoy.

on question 52: i would like to know why there is such a marked distinction between officers and enlisted men. that idea should be abolished and all military personal, would understand each other better. also the morale of the enlisted men would advance. negro and whites should never be kept together. as each one feels his part in the service is greater. in many camps it has lead to riots and bloodshed, just because someone did not't realize that white men and negro don't agree in army life as well as they do in civilian life.

long: as a whole the army is bad. of course there are some things that could be better probably such as-pay and alowences as the civilians are now making such nice incomes in defense plants. that things a soldier has to buy off the post most places around an army camp are much higher that they should be. in this rathionings a soldier who is on separate rathions should be given a little more consideration as they usually work longer hours and etc. than the civilians.

why do we have to have a curfew here if a man is a man enough to be in the army he should know when to come home . why punish all of us for just some few that don't know when to quit they don't have it in the north and they get along swell.
