outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: they both shed the same blood on the battlefront, and share the same thoughts and experiences
long: no comments, except that it waz a fair questionnaire in every respect and i'm glad i was given the opportunity to express my opinion.

i for one like the negro soldiers and think they should be treated as one - after all, we are fighting for the same thing - question #52 - i would not talk about the war. i think the president of the u.s. is fair as can be expected in a time like this - am well satisfied with his plans in running this war.

i have no comments about this questionnaire, but tell me, why in grading men for promotions, does time in the army mean so much more than ability and pluck. i have seen men who serving 6 and 8 years in the army become promoted  overnight from cpl's to master sgts.and the fellow who only with a years service, even though he has tried and merrited stripes fails to receive them. in this camp date of warrant means nothing - date of alligence is the important thing. it makes a man feel, ""why should i work all i have to do is wait until i have some service and i'll get promoted any way. you know there are some men who are never intelligent enough to lead men. no matter how long they are in the service.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
long: promotions in the army should be given out by being able to fill the jobs & not by personal feelings, as is done, most all thru army pasts. non-coms are not better than pvts & should have a closer relationship. hatred retards their work. all are working toward an end, so cooperation is very necessary, this is not attained by feeling superior. ratings should be abandoned entirely & have a leader in their respective departments-more work will be done & a better job.

the negro question is, and probably always will be, a rather touchy subject. the southern boys will never have much use for them in our generation. possibly 200 years from now this question will not even be asked, as the racial difference may fade completely, but i doubt it.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
long: it seems to  me that with all the yelling that is heard about needing volunteers to go to here and there to this school or the other they should send some of the men that really want to go.  a bunch of experienced men put in for a certain school do they get to go? no they send a bunch of men who have been in the army less than 5 months.

there could be some changes made in officers who are in charge of certain depts. who dont know what the score is, dont know how to address men, but manage to do say and do things that keep the men up , in bad spirits and do their jobs have right. i still can't see why the u.s. army let the officers have so many more privileges than the enlisted men. the enlisted men are the back bone of the army as i mentioned up above something should be done about this right away. there are some who are always telling the n.c.o. that they are not worth the stripes they wear. i think that is a very poor policy. why don't they look at it the other way around.

outfits_comment: or together, it ought to lead to more equality, but don't think it would.
long: what sort of opportunities, etc., will a married man have by remaining in the army after the war? will he be able to support a wife and family?

outfits_comment: being different races (very different) they would not like to drill together eat or sleep together. there would be very much friction
long: the negro and the white man have one victory one peace and one nation in common but to keep this a great nation they should not be allowed to mix their blood for so doing they are neither white nor black and are not a member of any race or a true race. i want the negro to enjoy freedom and peace but not to mix socially.

outfits_comment: being in the same outfit means living, eating and all other essentials performed in the army life of men. it would be a bad practice to bring negro to a white outfit.
my comments on this are about the same again question 62

long: i state my disgust about the army because when i go in the  room to ask a question about anything the 1st sgt acts like the owner the hole army and will not give you a civil answer on anything. they treat a buck pvt like he does not have a bit of since. i think that is no way for anyone to act, after all we are all in the army for one porpous fight to be free
there will always be a difference in colored and white people, which is right but the colored should be given a few more privileges.

outfits_comment: (there is a check mark)
long: would like to know why i cant go to casper wyo an help there.

outfits_comment: i think they both would cooperate better by themselves.
until the whites & negro have learned to mix it is best to keep separated.
long: most negro are in the lower bracket and until they are giving better opportunities for an education they will always feel inferior to the whites, also the whites are not used to mixing socially with negro, and they too should be taught to mix with them. until this is done there will always be friction between these two. in other words both races are responsible and should take steps to remedy this

outfits_comment: in my own mind the two just wouldn't work out together.
long: i think this is a very important work and looks like the us is trying to do every thing possible for the armed forces.

outfits_comment: were they together. too much disturbance would  ceus.
long: the army life is great. it teaches a man very many good things. it would be a good idea even in peace time for every man when he reaches his 21st birthday to obtain a years training.  the army is some times slow. but it  gets things done better and in an orderly manner. i wouldn't take any thing in the world for the training i have received i feel i will leave the army a better man than the one that entered.

outfits_comment: better cooperation if an outfit is made up with one race.

long: i thank the negro are all right in their places but the are not classed with the white people.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: should be in the same outfits but not in the same barracks. they should work together.
long: there will always be differences between the colored and white people. if they worked together more it would be able to create a better understanding between the two.

outfits_comment: still believe in keeping the white race & negro race separated.

long: nothing was mentioned here about our army clothes, but since the u.s. is supposed to have the "best-dressed" soldier in the world" more attention should be given in the fitting of us more correctly.

i think if they find out what everybody got to say about this mess were in, they will see what they public like and hopes to get now and after the war. i think this questionnaire is the best way to find out what a soldier thinks about everything.
no comments.

i joined the army to see actual combat so far, (i have been in now four months) it seems that i am not getting any closer to combat, than the first day i came in. six weeks since passed for aerial gunner and now they tell me that they are not shipping any men from brooks field to gunnery school. so the out look for me isn't so go at the present.
to much politics in army, & not enough soldiering. failure to recognize ability of a man just because some non comm doesn't like him & the non comm permitted to degrade him & such not checked into. -

there is too much partiality shown to certain soldiers by non-coms and especially by officers. ratings go more for ones that are liked, rather than for good deeds and efficient work. character isn't worth much in army life. it's not what you are or do, but how well you can "suck" that gets you by.

outfits_comment: as soldiers or as a people it avoid trouble
long: i like this branch of service as so far our major has personal given me a good job where i can do the most good for our country, as i have had experience in a aircraft factory and sombody with experience is needed here as well as anywhere else to keep these trainner planes flying, an when the pilots leave here they'll be able to handel bombers  a man with no experience can not go ahead with a job on planes as he could in some other types of jobs.

in a great number of cases, the one that makes the most noise or "knows" someone gets the promotion, while better trained men work under him. some have no qualities for leading men whatsoever. in other cases those who have longer service, (many couldn't hold a job in civilian life) go right on up ahead of men better trained educationally, morally, socially, and with better qualities of leadership.

outfits_comment: same as 62
long: to ask whether a soldier with ability has a good chance for promotion, it depends on the amount of politics and not on the amount of soldiering or ability.
there is too much politics in the armed forces. any man who is a friend of an officer can get ahead quicker than the man who tries to work for his promotion

i think there should be a better system pertaining to furloughs.  i only me get home on 3 day passes others cannot they are too far from home. these men who cannot should get longer furloughs before six months is served. say at the end of four months, or some other plan on this order.
a married man would be a better soldier if he could see his family more often.
what  does this help
i would rather be home i could do more good on relief work.

outfits_comment: one would have to tie up the southern soldier in a mixed outfit.
long: should ask what we think of the  medical corps on the post.

outfits_comment: the negro and white soldiers should be separated, as for the same p.x. it doesn't make any difference. back in civilian life the negro should live in a section of the town of their own and not mix with the white people. as to having a war job or being in the army, this is war and the american person should be a 100% in the job he is doing.
long: the negro and white soldiers should be separated, as for the same p.x, it doesn't make any difference. back .... (?) the negro should live in all sectors of their town of their orange(?) and not mix with the white people. as to having a war job or being in the army, this is work and the american negro should be a 100% in the job he is doing.

drillmasters are trying to act up to be lieutenants and take good pleasure in ordering men around. this occures even when we are off-duty.  some sergeant don't take into consideration that we entered the army only last month or so and they expect us to know everything about soldiering.

there should be more of an individual check of men in the army before being sent in schools and appointments as non-coms etc. home or most of the men who are non-coms, instructors aren't properly fitted to the job. a whole squadron should not be punished for one man's mistakes or ignorance.

outfits_comment: see the answers to questions 60 and 62.
long: i volunteered my services to my country. i have given men above me complete control of my life. they have a heavy trust on their hands - both our armed leaders and the politicians in washington. in the army leaders i have full confidence, but not so about washington. i'm afraid they are going to "bungle" things again. our political and congressional leaders have not opened their eyes - they are blind to the real situation in the world. president roosevelt has condemned agression on the part of germany but what about russia? i'm afraid the peace will be unjust. but this questionnaire is just the thing - we must have more of the same. the army is doing the fighting for victory - let's not have us fight for a just peace.

outfits_comment: it seems to me they would rather have it so
long: only a healthy soldier is a good soldier and more effort should be taken to take care of the soldier's health.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: we should make the thing one mass. irregardless of color, race, or creed be binded together as brother to brother, for the common cause.
long: it appears that many young men are not given the chance to go overseas because of their essentiality. the army authorities should use a little more discretion and leave this decision up to the men themselves, those who are deprived of this privilege. i have in mind the drill instructors. i presume that there are other examples. if the case may be, the army authorities might assume that no one is indispensable, and proper allowances should be made for those desiring to go.

outfits_comment: they in most parts would start a fight or some sort of disagreement
long: i think that when we are drafted we should have right to work for what branch of service we want. dont think that a volunteer should have most of the right of choice.

outfits_comment: it is owing to the situation of things. in a combat zone they should if necessary be together.
long: when my number for oversea duty comes up i am ready to go anywhere.

outfits_comment: it would be the democratic thing to leave them in the same outfits, but practically, this wouldn't work out. the same old factors would result.
long: this is intended to be one big gripe!  this army's main characteristic is inefficieny, which is probably due to its decentralized control and large size. still something should be done so as to present to the soldier a concrete policy or attitude of the government in regard to the soldier. high ranking officials should attain unanimity in their statements, promises, and actions that  affect the future of the soldier.   half of my time in the army is spent waiting around, doing nothing, for someone or something. this, i guess, appears trivial. but sorry - i have to go. i've had such little sleep lately that i have a terrific cold. i'm afraid to see the medical officer about it for fear of caching hell. it's started to bleed. see you later! keep em flying!!

the greatest complaint i have is that i feel i'm not serving to the best of my ability. that i feel is the fault of the army's system of classification. if a man is intelligent enough to finish 3 1/2 yrs. of college and then drafted he sertainly is more outfit to be a k.p. or guard. secondly i have been sent to a technical command branch of the service wherein my experience has all been in social fields & personnel work and being in a limited service capacity why, if i can't have active combat status, can't i relieve a man who wants to fight and is physically able? this is the sole basis of my dissatisfaction in the army and most assurredly is killing any ambitions i have of being a better soldier and one willing to assume more responsibility, even as for as becoming an officer. i am certainly losing faith in the ability we have of doing more than "muddlle through" this war if we can't set our own army house in order first. how then can we aid setting a world in order. yet i realize i am one man in millions but i feel there are many, many, others in the same position i am. it's certainly a blow to as soldier's morale.

outfits_comment: you can't mix oil with water.
long: i'm satisfied with the army, but i was drafted with a perforated eardrum and others with the same were not. it's either the captain and civilian doctor that examined me did not know their business or they just don't examine the men properly.  i would like to see the limited service men be stationed in the u.s. and have the 1a men fight. every day the 1a men are here, the war lasts a month longer.

outfits_comment: because negro are susceptible to desease more than whites
while we may all be americans i would rather have a white buddy beside me while i'm fighting
long: i believe this questionnaire is really worthwhile, and sincerely hope that the war department will heed some of suggestions that sound firm after the complete results of this have been tabulated.  sections concerning meals and sleeping hours might be added however. i don't believe the average soldier gets his rightful amount of sleep during any chosen week.

soldiers in atlantic city are give cold and inefficient medical service with no decent effort being made to discover what is worn with a man. -  - some of the hotels here are firetraps-  - army food seems quite good -

outfits_comment: many southerners of my acquaintance would, i'm sure, refuse to bunk with negro.
long: perhaps in the future a check on the soldiers attitude toward the industrial front would be interesting. a soldier, putting in a hard eighteen hour day, becomes disgusted upon reading reports of sit-downs and strikes for higher wages. it is not harmonious with his sense of fairness.

i believe this gives the gov. something of what is in the minds of the men in the service & a few of there view points. but i feel most certain all of the criticism which does come from the mouths of the soldier is not written or printed at this time. conditions don't warant one to express his thoughts to freely.
52 find out if he is treated right or the job is suited for him

outfits_comment: as separate outfits, the negro would be good because of their racial pride.
long: the negro situation should not be as delicate as it is sometimes made. this is especially true in the army. if the negro is a soldier, and a good one at that, we should show him the respect we give to a good white soldier. if we do not use special handling with the negro he will become a better american through being accepted by us. it will probably be proven that the negro battalion now in existence is excellent. they are used to menial jobs and will be good soldiers and tough ones. therefore, we should use the chance to get them to work together. at the same time we can fight side by side with them and still have both races become good fighting soldiers.

outfits_comment: not sufficiently informed on the subject. i would say they should be separated
long: i believe this questionnaire is a very good idea and it shows to me that the army is quite democratic but i still believe that many commissioned officers are incompetent and some take advantage of their rank to  abuse their men - there is, in my opinion, too much red tape in this army. -

outfits_comment: i don't think it makes any difference as the negro is no more a slave

long: i think it is a good idea to let the soldier add his own particular opinions, but i can not see how anything definite can be gathered from them in such a tremendous survey. i think that the only way you can gather a definite collective opinion is to have a completely objective test, so that subjective questions, which 90% of the time are intangible as far as gaining a clear cut ideas are concerned, should be eliminated. for example, i don't think you can get any information of value from the questions concerning a soldier's talk with the president. i also can think of no good reason why i wrote all this in answer to 64, because its affect on the test matter will not even be infinitesimal.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: i don't know of any reason why they can't be together in the army because they all know they are fighting for the same reason and i think they should be together.
both races enjoy it more that way.
long: it's hard for a soldier to maintain a decent period of sleep because of required attendance of affairs such as fights which last sort of late and during this rigid training period sleep (i feel) is essential.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: negro soldiers certainly could learn much from white concerning conduct and whites could become accustomed to colored association.
long: 1. i believe that the army is not making the best use of the men they place in non-combatant classification. certainly men of executive caliber or men with college education should not be shoved aboard a sanitation outfit or into a menial physical job. 2. the army realizes the need of good food -- but does it recognize theneed of adequate sleep for trainees? certainly good health is essential while in training and sleep is a prerequisite. 3. when do we get time to relax? - certainly we should be entitled to one or two hours to ourselves to read the latest news reports or to listen to  a good orchestra or band. with the high cost of laundry most of my spare time is filled with laundry, shoe polishing and changing uniforms and just waiting  in formation for orders, for this & that or just waiting to wait!
in some cases i am not in a definite position to really make a definite opinion because i have just entered the service. you will note my remarks below some of the cases to which i refer.

outfits_comment: why antagonize those who have, have had, and will always continue to have a sort of inborn aversion to negro.
long: i think that this questionnaire offers an excellent opportunity for obtaining necessary and useful data. that is if it used correctly and not disregarded entirely as i feel sure so many questionnaires are treated today.

outfits_comment: not because the whites are better soldier but because they would be able to work better in separate outfits.
long: there is one particular thing that stands out in my mind and that is -- the army tells you absolutely nothing. we don't even know our schedule for the day. we find out what we have to do when we are about to do it. another thing -- they tell us to keep clean, but don't give us time enough to bathe. it's either fall in or fall out -- change to class b's, class a's, or class c's, two, three and sometimes four times in one day. the variation in how to execute a command when given by different non-coms, is another thing i don't like. one non-comm explains a movement then another non-comm takes over, gives the same command and then gives us h--l for not executing it right.

i haven't been in the army long but i've found that it does not ask the impossible. i'm not at home, of course but there is no other place except home that i would rather be. i'm here to get the most out of it and do the most good. it has been hard on my family, as i did support them. my mother has to work, but we will not quit. after the war my responsibility will be lightined and i may do as i wish. if i succeed as i know i will the army will have a good job for me. i hope. i have two yrs. in a factory and that is too much, i want to be out side and keep outfit and trim.  i think that a single man with dependents (2 or 3) deserves as high or higher consideration than a married man

outfits_comment: a negro knows he is looked down upon and will work better when his mind if free from this.
long: i think this idea of the questionnaire is a good one because it gives the soldier a chance to express himself on certain subjects.  here is a question you might ask? 1. do you think that it is important to do each thing you do well?  2. do you think your personal health is neglected by you? is it important in winning the war?  3. do you ask many questions or do you use good judgment and answer many yourself?  4. is initiative in thinking helpful to you, or do you think that you can be a better soldier by depending fully upon the commands of others?  5.

outfits_comment: they have a different ways of socializing, and living.
long: the transportation of this camp is very poor, the drivers of the buses are to independent, and also to much liquor is being sold to these soldiers,
i should sagest that a soldier like me in army be discharge en send in a war factory were he could do more for is country

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
long: 1 the president of the united states did not't treat the young boys 18-19 fair because we are old enough to fight for our country same as a man then why shouldn't we had a right to vote maybe there wouldn't be a war. 2 after every war they elect a republican president then the depresson comes then the democrats gets and sticks their nose out where it don't belong and trade with foreign countries then theres a boom then war starts in europe the u. s. sticks her nose out where it doesn't belong the democrats dig up the old draft bill again then we are at war again read this carefully and watch in 15 or 30 years from now it will be the same thing and the people is getting mighty sick of it to. this war is nothing but a money scheme to get the people killed off. but theres a day when you rich men a politics will pay dear for this. where is the money going to come from to pay for englands material and russias. i say keep our men and material on this side of the waters where they belong. because every one of the european countries are treacherous and can't be trusted.  put yourself out in a soldiers place in combat zone and see how you would like it. if we wouldn't have aided england and all of those filthy countries we wouldn't be in war today.  may i express myself again keep our material and men on this side.  as president rossevelt said before his last election vote for me and i will not send your boys across his word is no good. its just the money that talks.
i think it is a very good idea to issue a question blank now and then to get the idea on any important subject, in regard to improvements or otherwise.

outfits_comment: because some whites and some negro just cant get along.
long: i think a lot of the boys in some outfits could do more good if they could be transferred to some other outfits.
my organization is to my unsettled at the present time for me to know how well i like it

question 21 my job is truck driver but would be better as a mechanic.  question 27. i could do better in the army if i were given half a chance to. there is too much partiality shown in my company.  question 12. being nearer home would give a soldier more ambition and less worries. of course when the time comes to go across he would at least been near and seen his folks during his training period. i even find partiality shown as far as furloughs go.

comenting on question 11. well i think and found that out with 90% of the soldiers that while stationed near there homes would give them less worries and more ambition and to whom this may concern will find this out before the war is over

outfits_comment: quite a few men in my outfit are southern born and are prejudiced against negro
long: it leaves room for doubt in several cases but as a whole it is fairly worded. it really should go a little deeper into army life.

outfits_comment: it would prevent less arguments if they are separated.
long: i think the bus service should be improved. i mean more of them. i don't think a person drafted has a very good chance of getting into the branch of service he would like to be in.  men with a good education are often overlooked & do not get a very good chance sometimes i think the men with a good education should have a little choice & it ought to help out better in promotions.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: it's  should not make any difference, any good soldier could easily overlook that
long: june 22 - i put down "no" for the simple reason. mostly everyone is looking out for himself, trying to get another ; there trying to the  feeling to make us

outfits_comment: yes i do think so
long: what is this for i think they will win for long i like it in the army very much do you think we'll will go over cross on  they are fighten

outfits_comment: i have no comments.
long: in genaral i think these questionnaire is a good think.

outfits_comment: white soldiers from the south wouldn't get along with negro
long: 42. united states was asleep at pearl harbor. an it is her won fault. so why much us younger generation, who are just starting out in life have to fight. england wanted us in this war so that we can help her. we give her manpower, equip. and all that she does is laugh up her sleeve. she screwed us the last war and will this war.
it nice to learn what the soldier like in the army an what they dont like.

to begin with, laws were not passed right in congress. any man 35 yrs. or older should be working in a defense plant of some kind. best ages for a soldier who can stand drilling, hicking, etc are from 18 to 28 yrs. men in my outfit are all complaining about the same thing. it seems very odd why men here of that age with varicose veins, hernias etc. have to drill & hike from 10 to 25 miles while men back home who are much younger are deferred on account of working in a defense plant.
the more men in europe the quicker this will be over. this questionnaire is sure a swell idea.
i am willing to make great sacrifices and help others all i can while in the army to further the war effort and return to civilian life once again

my biggest thought is, wondering if there's going to be jobs for each, and every solder after this war is won. if a solder could have more time off to go home he would enjoy army life a lot more. 30 days a year isn't enough when your two thousand miles from home.
q.11. i would rather be in the east when my sort of unpay and be had as for here, almost every thing is different and any coys would do as i

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: because all will be to the same purpose
long: i like this war be over pretty soon so we could go back home.  i like to do my post here in the united states to win the war.

outfits_comment: it is better on both. white on negro
long: i think this is a good thing to fill out. it lets you give your idea about how the army is run. how you are getting along. and have a few privileges.

outfits_comment: they will work together a lot better in separate outfits
long: the part that asks about condition after the war and also now: i think that the men a home in the factory's should be drafted to then work and paid in accordance to the men fighting in the army plus ration money. by working their they have a chance to get way ahead and when they soldiers come home their will be an abrasion or difference between men at home and the men in the army.  that men and women at home should be made to work in defense plants and not be allowed so much time off as what good is a soldiers with a gun in his hand with out shells to fire.

outfits_comment: i think they will fight better if they are with their own color
long: no. 9 i would want to come back if i could get in the ordinance department. no. 20 i would be interested if i could get the job i want. no. 24 i think i would be worth more to the army if i can get the job i want. anyone can fire the boilers i am firing. no. 26 because of mothers health. 30 i would rather be in a combat outfit if my vision were better 31 i would rather have a fighting job if my eyes were fixed. 41 it will help me if i get the job i want. 43. there is no complete victory in war, that is my belief. 53 some people don't like negro and in some cases they can do the job better than a white.

outfits_comment: efficiency is lowered where there is prejudice between groups that are working together.
long: concerning certain inefficient officers treating enlisted men like dirt, my pet peeve is the officer or noncom officer who restricts an entire group of enlisted men following the wrongdoing of a few. it is a common army practice -- but is very unfair, un-american, and contrary to the things i think the army is fighting for, it does away with incentive to the soldier who believes he will get along if he does the right things. if you kill a man, and i happen to be walking on the sidewalk in the same block as you, there is no fair reason for my being punished with you. but the army has followed this principle for years -- and still does. frankly, i think this principle stinks. as an enlisted man, i cannot do anything about it, but i'll never forget it -- and no other factor is as strong as this in making me want to get out of the army as quickly as possible.

as far as another war in 25 years: as long as the peace, that follows war, still tends to subjugate one nation in trade & commerce, which is the backbone of a nation's foreign policy, their will be wars. if it is possible to get this war over with, their must be a way for the enemy to continue to live. you can't exterminate a whole nation. some way must be found to give them a peace in which they will not feel subjugated and looking for revenge. that feeling of hatred between the u. s. and japan and germany must be done away with before we can say we have won a complete victory. and that is what the ruling powers say they are striving for.

why have such a large army - have one less size and train more efficient. also send men home who are in limited service who could do more for country at home in defense plants. most of camps men have been given jobs of no importance just to be kept busy. they weren't outfit for active duty and had us put in army - much more important work to be done on homefront. example: 20 men to one mop and one mop pail -

outfits_comment: southern boys resent taking orders from negro
long: skilled men in demt. should be placed where they can do something useful. "1b" with no job of their skilled trade should be released and returned to their trade in civilian life.
i think the questionnaire is a good thing if the war dept. will use the results with out out side influence.
i think it is a good idea to gather this information. the findings can improve many things & also may promote some good new ideas for the betterment of the soldiers.

i think this survey is a good idea. it is the only way to find out what the enlisted man thinks. i like the army fairly well but wouldn't like to make a career of it. the food is good most of the time. i don't especially care to get out until the war is over, but hope it doesn't last too long. i am in limited service and at times feel that i not contributing much to the war effort. on that i was doing more good in the airplane parts plant where i was employed before coming into the army. as a whole i don't mind the army. but wish i could do more to help win the war.

the main reason, that if germany and japan would stop fighting. and give back all of the land that they took. it would be hard not to go on and fight. but it would bring back most of the boys. and that is the main thing.

outfits_comment: by being in separate outfits, there less chance of race riots
long: this questionnaire is very good, for it gives the soldier a chance to express his view point. i think the best age of a fighting is from 18 to 24 years of age, and that men, physically handicapped and are a burden to the army, should be sent home to work in defense plants and on farms, where they would do most good for such men are a financial burden to our country and the army. if 1-b men were out in the world working they could be paying taxes and buying defense bonds, and thus be a better help to out country and army
i think the questions were fair and easy and it gives everybody and idea what the solider about everything right now.

outfits_comment: why not view the poor devils as human beings and not as "problems" for a while
long: the writer is 52 years old and in on special waiver so is hardly typical of average soldier. this questionnaire is an excellent thing and from the comments of  men i think it is an excellent thing for morale in general apart from the value of any data you may get. i am afraid that these last questions will not give you exactly  picture but i would not know how to suggest improvements. in last war we anticipated more trouble when negro wee billited along side of our southereners but they played together. in france we had  killing. however it is your headache. good luck in solving it!

outfits_comment: neither would like to be in another outfit.
long: the army seems to forget about a soldier if he is in limited services. there are many of us who have excellent qualifications for other work but are put in a class of misfits, which are equal to labor gangs. usually soldiers with glasses and in limited services are just cast aside & no place is found for their real work. this of course causes much dissatisfaction. we could be of more service & better satisfied.
i think the m.p.'s that ride the r.r. trains is a good thing for the men. it wasn't done in the last world war.

outfits_comment: the negro soldier seems to be slower at picking things up such as military counting.
long: i think that all men who are outfit and know how to do farm work should be released during the planting, growing, & harvesting season to help get more food supply for the needs of the united states and all her allies. i do not mean men who are in ia but those in non-combatant outfits. this would ease the pressure on the farmers who are short handed.

11 a limited service man does not have much choice in where he's stationed he is at present kind of a miss-outfit,  that the waac's are coming in i think thousands of these limited service men would be of more help toward runing this war at home in defense jobs or on farm's this summer. as it is they are shipped back & forth around the country some of them highly trained men but not in what the army needs & they become poor soldiers mostly because the army can not find a permant  call for them & they are discudid with army life.
this questionnaire is good, but it touchs nothing of importance, if it were added to somewhat it would reveal a great many things unknown to anyone now.

outfits_comment: to much prejudice
long: very good idea
in question 52  i mean why are soldiers such as japanese italians jews chinese or relations are made non commissioned officers

outfits_comment: negro understand themselves better
long: this is a fairly good questionnaire except that i believe some of the questions have too blunt answers.
if any thing is done about the poll to correct the wants of the men in service it will be well worth the effort.

i'll make good in the army if the superior offices will give me or other like me a chance to do so, because all promotion and comotion are given on whom you, not what you know and its the reasing for our comotin offices some are not so good because they do not know what its all about their work.

here in camp atterberry in our station hospital at times it gets so crowded that the negro are in the same wards as the whites and it seems they get along fine. the state i come from the negro are treated the same as us, but you take in the south things are just the opposite so if the negro would get a better chance from these southerners, things would go more smoothly. if outfit of whites and negro go to battle against the axis how the hell they going to accomplish anything if they can't get along among themselves.
don't get enough passes and when i do they are to damned short.  food is terrible some times espectilly on friday at noon fish and also don't get enough milk in the morning.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: because if their fighting for the same cause should have the same privilege is white
long: the army should have the best type of classification board as it would make the men like the army and work much harder at their own free will than have to be driven to do some job they hate. also should remove some of the induction board doctors as they don't make any effort to find out if man is sick or in poor heath lot of them just rush you through they take better care of animals than do of men. because animals ar hard to get and men can be gotten so easily.  also some of the doctors in army should have to take an examination. like given at final close of medical studies before entering the army and should have a grade of 87 - 100 not any lower. also men should be given the right size clothing and right size of shoe. as i have seen many men wearing shoes too large or small and getting feet they could not walk on after few week in army

why we cant get a furlough in the 83 div. more than 6 days our eats are very poor have been for the last 3 mo. and they aren't giving it to the folks back home where is it all going two  i think some of the fellows in the army should get out to help on the farms this summer so we could get better eats.

i can't see why our officers keep putting us off when we ask them something. why do we have to go out in the field and sleep in tents set up in the snow. i have been in the army since july and can't get a 3 day pass. the only way we can get a furlough is to have someone die at home. and then it takes 3 days to get one. our food is rotten. half of the time we don't get any of it. other divisions give furloughs why cant the 83 division?

outfits_comment: the food rationing in the army has become too strict. we have just returned from a night in the field & there wasn't enough breakfast for every man to have all he wanted. this doesn't happen occasionally -- it happens often. i think the old saying ""the army lives on its stomach"" should be changed to ""the army lives on its guts and feet.""
long: the food rationing in the army has become too strict. we have just returned from a night in the field & there wasn't enough breakfast for every man to have all he wanted. this doesn't happen occasionly - it happens often i think the old saying "the army lives on its stomach" should be changed to "the army lives on its guts and feet."

25. the reason i don't feel proud of my battery is because i was transfer from a better battery. 48. we could never trust germany or japan again. we should wipe them off the map. 58. the negro before the war when working & making many got to high and mighty for their own good.

why doesn't this division have furlough's like any other division? why can't the laundry service be improved?  why does the s.s. man have a better chance for promotion than an enlisted man? most s.s. men are favoured regardless of service. this to me seems rather unfair. i thought all men in the army were treated equal. that, i think has been disregarded as far as i can see. the officers seem far superior to the men than i think is right, although an officer is to be respected, he should not consider himself better than the men who are working under him.
sometimes i wonder how some of the officers were every made officers -

outfits_comment: same as q. 62. (comments)
long: that any soldier over 30 years old that has a skilled trade or is mechanically enclined should be placed in some defense plant and replaced with younger unskilled men. and if not a less rugged training schedule for men with minor ailments. ect.

outfits_comment: for sanitary reasons.
long: about question 25, i am proud of the company, but to a certain extent part of the personnel in charge make it very hard for me to be a good soldier, and prove my efficiency as one, one account of continuous disagreements and arguments, which cause me to lose my temper, and in turn my liking to be a soldier in the army. as far as getting experience in different branches, a soldier has a good chance, but it seems my trouble has always been with the noncom men in my company

i don't see why a man from the south when he gets in the army he is send north or very far away from home or why men from one part of the country is send far away from home when there are army camps near his home.

outfits_comment: white troops are from north and south, the south never will admit a negro.
long: this type test would be better with interviewers. for a large no. of men can talk things better than write them.

outfits_comment: i wanted want to  in the same
long: sorry sir but i dont have any comments about the questionnaire

i myself think that the army spends to much time holding inspection when it could be put to better use  one thing i think the soldiers should have the rights on buses. as they only have certain times to go and come but i have been in bus depot where they would let civ  on first and after waiting out a great long line you dont feel so good afout about that
the negro has more privileges than the white man
i don't know any

outfits_comment: for the dislike between some white people and negro
long: why should some soldiers receive less training before they are sent overseas, then others do.

outfits_comment: i don't want to be that close to them.
long: the army is all wright when there is a job to do but i dont want any part of it in peace time.

outfits_comment: they would never agree
long: i was just wondering if there is any camp in the u. s. that if you don't get on your hands and knees you wouldn't get a 3 day pass. so help me it smells.

outfits_comment: better for all concerned because there is no possible chance for any frictions.
long: in regards to the question about the bus service here. a soldier should be allowed bus privledge before civilians because of the short time they have free from duty.  one question in my mind is why the army encourages men to apply for o.c. school and then after they are accepted are never called for months. the army is always in a hurry for some thing but is slow in getting any things done.

outfits_comment: for same reason as given in question 62.
long: i think this a good method of getting the general run of the enlisted men idea of the army but there are many things cropping up in various outfits that could be improved upon by more careful consideration and weighing of these things by officers and commanding officers especially.

outfits_comment: they work better together by themselves as a team and so do we.
long: why? where a unit has completed basic training, the unit passes it's tests the highest in a division, aren't we allowed our 15 day furloughs according to army regulations, when we are still in the u.s. and competent men have been trained. - one reason for so many a.w.o.l's.  most of our equiptment is to bulky and combersome to be effective in actual combat the soldiers will throw 3/4 of it away except actual necessities any how.  i honestly think men 35 years of age or over are not physically outfit for a sustained pace day after day which this type of war requires if we are to win.

outfits_comment: i don't trust them, i fought them in the ring & most of them are yellow
long: negro fighters are ok when winning but yellow & scared when there getting licked.  our officers are very good they treat you right & square our general is a ok guy. our n.c.o. are swell. & they give you a break if you deserve one. i like the army very much but i don't like the branch of service i'm in. i'm not interested in being a good medical soldier, id rather be in the infantry where a mans a man, & can really be proud of himself. we don't get enough to eat and it don't taste so hot. the army is ok, a good place for a young if hes in a branch of service he like & can take interest in.

outfits_comment: do you think a boy from the south like to lot with the negro. no
long: well they is one thing i would like to say that when the men in  a outfit dont get a long with with their non coms the out outfit out right and that where the captain does wrong he dont know how the men feel about it.

outfits_comment: none.
long: i don't have any thing to write.

outfits_comment: a negro would work in close harmony and little discord with other negro.
long: i believe if a soldier knew for sure he would get a furlough in his last 1 or 2 weeks of basic training it would not make any difference where he was stationed and there would be less a.w.o.l.'s

outfits_comment: the negro should be keep to their self in all ways
long: i was working at chester pa in the sun ship yard as a reckin class electric wielder & was call to the army. i think i was doing lots more for my country by working in the ship yard the in the army as a privit.  i don't  have enough scholling to make much in the army. although i willing to do more them my sheir to win the war.  i feel that most of  us feel the same way.

outfits_comment: the should have their own outfits but should mingle with the whites.
long: i know we'll win this war but, whether i'll see it is another question. when we win, will we again compel our allies to pay their financial debts to us by bleeding the conquered nations. if we do, we can expect another war. as for the racial problem, you can't break it down at once. we should allow the negro equal rights but, i'm afraid these southern boys won't allow them to an equal social standing. however, their human being like us, give them a fairly decent education & you'll see that at a mixed affair negro will not ask the wife of a white man to dance of course, you'll get that in the non-educated classes but, all they need is an equal, a fair chance to allow them to put the common sense they have, - to use.
in rereading my questionnaire it seems that i have given the "right" answer to many of the questions - i've made a sincere effort to give a truthful answer to all questions.

outfits_comment: health reasons, only. if negro soldiers are physically o.k., + mentally equal, then they should be together.
long: i feel that, as, this camp is only a train. center certain "gripes" cannot be avoided; when i am assigned to permanent division, i think that all personnel will find that a more mutual + fraternal attitude exists, + that everyone will cooperate to their fullest.

outfits_comment: there is no need to place the negro in a position to cause trouble
long: i am willing and ready to do my part in the winning of the war wherever stationed but feel that i can be of greater service and utilize my capabilities and experience in a branch of service  surely connected to the west  which i was engaged in civilian live- i think the questioner {questionnaire} can generally be answered with a great degree of certainty and is fair.

outfits_comment: i doubt it they want to be mixed any more than we do.
long: the only comment that i have to make is about the placement of soldiers.  i happen to be a civil engineer, and when i was drafted, i was sent to this outfit as a commander, when i know i would have been of much more value to the engineers. now they want me to go to ocs & i am not interested in the least. and they still refuse to transfer me to the engineers, so it looks very much like i will spend my time as a commander which anyone can do, when i could be doing a much better job. i ask you is this the way the army does business?

outfits_comment: because most of the boys don't won't to mix with the negro
long: 65. i think a soldier should be able to stay close to his home. to he is ready to go overseas. 66. and he should have real good training before he is shipped + with the gun he is going to use over seas.

outfits_comment: i don't think there would be much cooperation if they were mixed.
long: indirectly in connection with the questionnaire, i see no logic in sending men from the north to southern camps and just the opposite. another thing is not giving furloughs to men who have been in the service for some length of time. i believe it lowers the morale of the men, by making them hate the army, and there by hate what we are all fighting for.

outfits_comment: they should not be with white soldiers.
long: i tried to get into ground crew in the air corps, i was elimated because of my age. the next best outfit i like is what i'm doing now and that is truck-driving. i would love to get transferred any place east or north. i hope to get married there. my girlfriend is now waiting 5 years for me. i don't ever go to town here, because you cannot enjoy yourself here. if i get transferred up north or east, i'll put my heart and soul into this army life and a dog-gone good soldier too.

outfits_comment: it is better for all concerned. i think they have a better time in their own way, in ours. we have our own likes and peculiarities, they have theirs.
long: i think a good many war workers are far overpaid. most of them earn 2 or 3 times what they did before. this is all at the expense of the taxpayer now and after the war. they call themselves patriotic. however most of them are working for the money involved. this is shown by the number of strikes in demand for increased wages also their short week of 48 hours at regular pay. we in the army work far more hours willingly for a fraction of their salary. war workers should work in a spirit of patriotism. i'm sure if the men now overseas were sent to war jobs they would almost double production. more  should be established in camps that are distant from good sized cities as the small towns cannot begin to accomodate all the servicemen.

as a whole army life has surpassed my expectations. however, i would imagine it would be extremely dull for anyone who did not have a goal - such as a commission - to work toward.  i think the army might well devote more time to showing the soldier where his work and duties outfit in as a part of the whole military setup. otherwise you will have a lot of men doing routine jobs half-heartedly & carelessly with no conception of their importance to the whole plan of operations.

outfits_comment: same as proceeding statement.
long: i believe that this questionnaire is a wonderful thing if it only influences the higher ups and that they do something about it. i hope that this is not just a blind to make the soldier feel that his say so has some weight.

outfits_comment: like i said before it would be better not to mix them. because there is always trouble when you mix them.
long: i think this questionnaire is good thing it gives a soldier a chance to say what he thinks about the army and other things. i think it would be better if they let us sign our names. because they can find out anyway, and it would save them a lot of trouble in looking it up.

outfits_comment: there would be too much trouble if they weren't. i don't excuse myself either.
long: i believe it has been a very good idea, the questionnaire etc. thanks for the opportunity for a frank expression of my opinions.

outfits_comment: the negro are good soldiers, as are the whites, but might not be if mixed with whites in the south, where there is a great deal of
long: q. 52-pt.2- some men stay in the army on this side for 2 or 3 years, while some others get 6 or 8 months training and go on across. with the average man, the longer he trains the better soldier he is, and if there is any place good soldiers are needed it is over there where the fight is. q. 63. the army adheres to uniformity, and an outfit with the races mixed wouldn't look as uniform as one with the negro segregated from the whites. q 5. i feel that i could do more in the q.m.c. because i am very well experienced in transportation - something the army depends on to move its soldiers and guns.

being over 35 years of age and in the same vocation for 16 years i find it rather difficult to began something new and very different. this is also noticable among the other men over 35. although the men i am referring to are all v.o.c and have more than average ability and intelligence. if we could be assigned to some thing more in line with our civilian training regardless of whether we obtaining a commission i believe the large majority would be much more content and could produce a great deal more the there army and country.

outfits_comment: i don't like negro
long: the negro separate outfits for them and the white and gave the negro a k.p. for them

outfits_comment: they will work better together with the ones they like, naturally their fellow negro
long: about the furloughs, i realize the fact that everyone can't be satisfied by having all the furloughs he wants, cause if that was the case the service boys would be home on furloughs all the time. but it doesn't seem quite fair that some boys get a great many, and others never get any. it seems as though it's just a case of which camp that you get into so. if there could be some regulation made to cover all the camps and give each an equal right and see that it was carried out in this respect. i believe the soldiers would be  more satisfied which would also improve their work in the army because they were satisfied.

i am not prejudiced in the negro problem. i have not been around where that problem arizes, but the fact that it is in the south many people have the racial supperiority & inferiority feeling. we are worrying about the war now so i think it best to eliminate the problem at present by separating the negro from whites. for their own good to because i think they feel more at ease among their own race.
i believe that after the war the work will be more equalized and every willing person will make a fair living.

outfits_comment: less cause for friction at this time. a great many of both colors would object
long: i am glad the negro question is in mind. i do not think to much emphases should be made on it bu tit should be brought about gradually that every negro will have the same opportunity as a white but mixing socially should not be forced but a matter of choice. i doubt if soldiers are studied closely enough to see what army job they might be suited for best. i think a solider should be located as close to his home as possible because he won't feel too great a change in things right at first
my personal thought about these from of questions is that they are a lot of foolishness.

outfits_comment: personally, i would not care to have negro in my barracks
long: i think it a very good idea to take a survey of the enlisted man's opinion. i sincerely believe that some good ideas will be obtained as to how the enlisted man feels in regard to the war and the war

outfits_comment: trouble is the only answer, we got to work together and win.
long: i myself think this one of the best things ever put up before the soldier only they should have their name and serial no. on it, because i myself am not ashamed of any answers i put down.

outfits_comment: i think that, qualified by practical necessity they should be in same.
long: survey idea is excellent. little pictures encourage informality. as to negro the survey would be of more value if the individuals background to the problem were indicated for classification. question 52 is not clear enough for accurate tabulation of answers or as to meaning. 43 is ambiguous. questions 5, 10, & 11 should be correlated. question 15 (depending on purpose of question) should be broken down.. also a question as to individual's non-comm would, i think, be very valuable. no doubt other surveys touch on matters which obviously should be covered.

outfits_comment: some white people have an old grudge against negro
long: i think this questionnaire covers the camp's pretty well but there are some things that would be in question, as to where the camp's are located. the south & north have different ideas about the colored people.

outfits_comment: it will work better that way. they want to be together.
long: i am just a newcomer and some of the questions are hard for me to answer, i know that many things should be changed, but i think that these will change when we get into battle.  i don't like war. i guess no one dose. i hope its over soon.
why don't all camps handle furloughs and 3 day passes alike?

outfits_comment: i think a line should be drawn.
long: i think it's a good idea in order to find out how the soldiers of the u.s. army feel about the army. the army is a large organization and difficult to run.
i think this  questionnaire is all right but shouldn't't be used for  changes. there are to many fellows with different ideas.  fellows should be given a furlough before  going overseas

outfits_comment: white men and negro cant get along with out trouble
long: personally i think that the training center here in fort sill is a great training center, the only comment that i have to make is that it is to soft, we dont really get the phyfiscial training that we should. after the first 8 weeks we just kill time for an additional 8 weeks, then when we are transferred to a line outfit where we have strenous manavers then we arent in shape to take it.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
long: the incompetence of many n.c.o.'s many who inspire fear rather than respect. the paradox of constantly cleaning your mess kit, that you seldom use, and at the same time not being able to change bed linens at times for three weeks. every thing considered, for an organization as huge as the armed forces a pretty good job is being done.

the war has given good wages and put a lot of people to work but it also has  raised the commodities to such a scale that we were better off with the lower wages we received before the war. the war has also taken away the pleasures we were used to such as driving, golf, etc. it has also rationed food. the army gets meat but the people back home have to hunt around awhile before they can even buy any. the war has also raised the taxes to such an extreme that i don't think half of the people will be able to pay their taxes.
i think this  questionnaire is a very good idea. for it's given each individual soldier a chance to express himself about the army and the war.

why the  furloughs were taken from the trainees at the completion of their basic. the general feeling of the men seems to be a slight lowering of their morale. a short leave would do wonders to a man who would like to see his family for a few days.

more furlough - more stress on ability - the acceptance of new good ideas - less - much less red tape - more adaptability to related civilian jobs in order to gain the most from the manpower (wherein there is the opportunity) the questions are good but are vague in general - and the answers to these questions; because of broadness in scope of the answers checked - will be very hard to decide (even after arriving at a mean) any definite opinion -

outfits_comment: if a white man had a colored . it might not work out so well!!
long: no. 34 this being just my opinion but there has been growing a great war between russia & england for many years, and my honest opinion is after germany is defeat that russia will start (where she left off> there will be only one side for us and that will be with england again. it may be five years or it maybe twenty five but i do believe it will come eventually.

outfits_comment: mixed races usually doesn't work out.
long: i think there are entirely too many furloughs turned down. that does a lot in lowering a solderis morale. after it is turned down, after he has built up a few hopes, he usually gets that don't care attitude.

i think it would be a very good idea to station the soldiers with children, and in some cases other relations close to home so they may be able to seem them once in a while. something like when they get a three day pass etc. this would not have to be real close to home but so they could have a little time with the folks. i sure think it would make the boys better soldiers. i know it would help me as my child is only a few mos. old. that's it and thank all of you.

this has nothing to do with questionnaire but . a clasification of this life insurance we have would be a good idea. no one seems to know how it is paid off in installments in cash or just how is it paid off -

outfits_comment: white soldiers don't like to work with negro, especially negro officers.
long: it may seem that my ans, sometime contradict one another. well, i want to do my part but i also want to be able to come back to my family after the war is over. if i could stay in the u.s. and be stationed near my home as a commissioned officer, i wouldn't mind staying in the army for the duration.  with so many trainees, new inexperienced men, it's necessary to have many instructors in the u.s. men with ability, that have families should have these positions.

i feel that every soldier, whose behavior merits it, should have a furlough every so often. i find that if anything lowers a soldier's morale, it is that there is no chance to visit home unless under emergency conditions.  it is too difficult for soldiers to get liberated from details if there finances comes to the army camp to visit them.

outfits_comment: except in actual combat.
long: a very good move on the part of the government.

outfits_comment: difficulties of race prejudice
long: too much quibbling about whether shoelaces are straight or crooked, whether knife and fork are arranged properly for display. whether tent poles are painted in the right direction for display. we should be winning the war instead of spending all week getting ready for saturday inspection. we have too much gold-bricking carried over from a peacetime army which gave most of its time to appearances. we give too much attention to appearances and uniformity. skill in passing the buck seems more valuable than solving the problem. officers and non-coms not seriously interested in making good soldiers, but in making a good report to superior officer.

outfits_comment: it shouldn't't make any difference but it does
long: i think a soldier should have a furlough now + then. it would keep their morale much higher. in my outfit we were promised furloughs and did not't get them now the fellows morale is very low. they do not care whether they do anything or not. i don't blame them.  another thing is the food. i know feeding all these men is a problem but when a fellow has to go away from the table meal after meal hungry it isn't long before he gets disgusted with the army.

my experience as a truck driver tells me that a centralized lubrication and repair service at training centers would be far superior to letting unskilled drivers try to do the job themselves.  another of my pet peeves is that most army mess halls are not very clean. what they need most of all is some standardized dish washing equipment. the system we use is unsatisfactory. army food is usually pretty good. 100,000 conscientiouscooks would be a boon to army morale!  and i could take a dirty crack at most 1st sergeants, but why be a griper.
i think the average soldier is given a fair chance in the army now. it depends on what he puts in it himself.

outfits_comment: understanding one another they would make a better team.
long: this questionnaire is a little too general to help benefit the individual soldier. it may help a large group of soldiers though. the questions are ....(?) thorough enough on the ...(?) situation. you ask nothing ...(?) my opinion the jews and ...(?) profiting by war. nothing ...(?) about the feelings between ...(?) population.

outfits_comment: i would rather have it that way anyhow.
long: one thing that i did not't think was fair - they took away our furloughs in my battery - until we reach a line outfit - the rest of the soldiers in this battery before us had them - and now they stopped it. that lowered the morale of soldiers here very much - i know i am living with them - furloughs are very important to keep up a soldiers morale

outfits_comment: better team work could be obtained
long: i think this survey a worthwhile step taken by the war department, and hope research obtain will show in all truthfulness what the ideal approach should be.

outfits_comment: so the negro will have an equal chance
long: i think that it is a good questionnaire except that you have an inclination to answer the questions the way war dept. wants them answered. i don't believe that the average soldier is worried about the war because we (americans) feel that we will win. i hardly ever read a paper and i use to all the time. i have more the attitude of a sick patient who should go to the doctor but doesn't. i wish that the questionnaire would deal more with war and not social questions. we can carry our own cross. i would like to know if my family will have enough to eat. why the army, navy and air force does not act together. mcarthur in borneo and the navy in guadal canal. two campaigns in the same sector not acted together. give us more?

outfits_comment: i think that we should all work together in this country like civilized people
long: i think all those army camps should give the soldiers a chance to have fl at less once a year some of the camp. don't approve of it and that is not fair to the soldiers of diffent camp in the u.s.a.

outfits_comment: at present yes as the time has not come for the safe intermingling of these men in ranks.
long: if men were placed where they are trained a better and more economical and efficient army could be attained.  for example have civilian truck driver as cooks or bakers and visa versus.  men trained to handle foods for instance could give men more and better meals with the same or less rations as the food problem seems to be the one most complained about. from my own observation for better meals could be had as the army has good and well proportioned rations but in most cases are not properly prepared.

this is a good idea, to get an opinion of the soldiers and if acted on rightly there should be a lot of good changes to the benefit of the soldier. i will say that i hope this war does not act as an instrument in bringing restrictions and hardships on an extreme after the war is ended.

i think the health and morale would be increased if there were a  greater care taken to see that radios in the barracks do not run competition with each other and do not try to "entertain" those who may want to write letters or rest. also that radios be turned off after taps. there are a few men who have chosen to not smoke. one would feel that to be his right & privilege. they do not smoke because they find tobacco smoke (for one thing) offensive to them. yet there is no place (under cover) where a soldier may go (except in a chapel and sometimes in the mess hall) where one may escape the billowy fumes.

outfits_comment: i don't like their smell when they sweat.
long: no 5 i would sooner be in the air corps if i was younger. no 9 i think it is a good idea for men that are below 30 years old to have 2 weeks each year for army training

outfits_comment: it would be easier to maintain discipline
long: the army will have a leveling effect upon society after the war, because of the close association of men from the various strata of society. this may work to bring about better understandings between the different sections and economic groups of the nation. there will always be wars until the spirit of intense nationalism is broken all over the world, and in its place a cosmopolitanism which will encompass the entire earth is substituted. economic barriers must go. however, the essence of peace is not contained in the four freedoms alone. it must be that plus development and education. (refer to question #23) there aren't any good clean places to  eat a good meal. dances are so crowded that i never even try to dance anymore and i surely like to dance. everytime i have gone i have only had about 5 or 6 steps and some other soldier has to cut it. the girls are respectable girls though and people in general are very good to us. it is just because there are too many soldiers for the town to consume.

long: it is my firm belief the negro should have separate every thing in this army - including hospital words. px ect.

the army is not making full use of the classification system. there is quite a few  skilled men wasting time on menial work. another thing there is strong healthy men to doing very light work while others with physical defects could qualify for the job. would suggest that the commanding office personally  each man for i his organization to find out if he is in the right job.
i think this is a good idea.

outfits_comment: whites & negro will never mix very good.
long: i think they are holding some soldiers in the same camp to long. training most soldiers shouldn't't take more than one year. some in this camp over two years.

long: think the hardest thing on the morale of the soldier is the lack of system and organization he constantly is exposed to. waste of time, of food and other materials. the constant "preaching" of discipline and order and the complete lack of it in superior officers-

outfits_comment: they would work best among their own, as the whites work best among their own.
long: i believe that in the army, friendship receives more recognition in promotions than merit. this is probably due to the fact that younger men are favored for leadership on account of their physical ability, and the older, wiser men are ignored. also there is no punishment for partial incompetence as long as the man "keeps his nose clean" with his superiors.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']

outfits_comment: because the negro have their own definite ways of doing things, moving along, and living.
long: in the first place, i'm from the north and i know very little about negro, except, they do have a lower standard of living. when we can't live together here, i don't see how europe and asia can over there. i can now see why there is a war.  secondly, i don't see why because a person is elligible for officer material, the army puts him in some branch he is entirely unfamiliar with. all this has done to me, is made me hate the army and i have no interest at all in my work. the want to make good i had when i was drafted, is fast fading from within me. when a person is classified, upon entrance into service, why doesn't he stay in that classification? i know i could do more and like it, in my type of work and still make o.c.s.

i believe that the army should take more time to place men where there training and experience can best serve the army. perhaps i am bitter about my own case. my four and one-half years of electrical engineering in college supplemented by practical experience in the industrial world has given me an excellent scientific background. i could do valuable research work in electronics - a field in which few men are mathematically qualified - yet my job in the army does not even require the ability to read and write. i have a good chance to become an officer in the field artillery, but even if i do that job requires very, very little math of scientific knowledge.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: in the same outfit they would get accustomed to each other more, making for a better postwar understanding
long: 1  i like california best because of climate, proximity to the ocean, and scenery.  2

outfits_comment: i think more teamwork and harmony will be developed if they are separated.
long: personally i think the army and its personnel is doing a swell job and they have every ounce of my support. those that cripe are the ones that haven't learned to be unselfish and not think of themselves all the time. i am single and it makes my case simple but i find among my fellow soldiers the majority have the spirit that will lead us to victory. our biggest job now and after the war is education and the right type of education in my belief. if our people become more educated in our democratic way our trouble will be reduced. let this country be a shining, honest, clean example of a life that we hope the rest of the world will follow.

outfits_comment: separate outfits make for efficiency if the outfits are close together. each would try to out do the other.
long: so far, i have been in basic training. i haven't formed a complete opinion on many of the questions, as i haven't been in the army long enough. the main trouble i have is worry about my family. if i were close enough to keep in touch with them, i could do a better job while i am in the army. my financial standing will not permit bringing my wife and child to the camp, because of the high cost of living near army posts. if i were stationed within two or three hundred miles of home, my mind would be relieved, and i could get more out of my training. however, i realize that this might not prove feasible, and that the army cannot stop to consider each enlisted man's preference. i had no preference of branch of service, and since i was classified for the field artillery, i'll do the best i can. my opinion is that if each man does his best, the war will be over quicker, so that we may return to our families.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: they should be together-perhaps it is too early for that.

outfits_comment: for the above reason.
long: sure we're fighting, and doing a darn good job of it. but do we realize that is the , when we are finally victorious, that if this country is again allowed to lapse into another morale  war again will follow? you know and i know that there is a master switch and when the boss decides to pull it one way or the other, its a simple task for .

long: i don't think i would want to come back to my outfit after the war.  i believe i will be worth more to my country in the army than i would be out. i feel that the army sure is worth while.

very good as a whole but should have included two questions something like this with multiple choice answers:  d would you favor the u.s. taking a greater part in international affairs after the war than in the period 1919-39? 2) do you think the future welfare of the u.s. and its standard of living is dependent upon the economic and political welfare of the peoples in other parts of the world?

long: the negro problem is one we must solve ourselves. we must raise them all to our standard of living and  accept them as equals or separate them in localities of their own. this is going to be a big problem in the near future and we must face it squarely. i am white but believe a democracy stands for an equal opportunity for all regardless of color. the negro are growing in population and i believe unless we educate them properly they will revolt against us at a later date.

outfits_comment: this gives them a sort of independent feeling.
long: in regards to the colored soldiers & the white soldier i think that the war has done a great deal of good in bringing the two classes together and that after the war and during it a lot of hatreds will be forgotten and the colored race will become more and more educated and friendly with their fellow-men. i personally hold that they are entitled to the same privileges as their white countrymen and should all be treated equally for that is in my opinion what we are fighting to preserve in part.

did not't mention the w.a.a.c's ascertain they will take considerable jobs away from limited service men. conseq uently limited service men will not get opportunity to serve in their camp units, as they are doing now, should think thy be kept in civilian life to help in war essential jobs, or let limited service men do some.  limited service men are now doing a variety of work different to their copany, there forth in my opinion demorlizing to army than  should be given betterchance. the iq test is given at wrong time, & upon chance for the majority, also classification is a joke. to much polotics in different organzations for  stripes  don't think civialians be allowed to work on post. should be all soldiers. thy draw  pay of soldir & do less work.
