long: the questionnaire was very informative matter. many of the questions we could not really answer, because we have not encountered same. given to many camps it should really give a good general idea of armed forces. are these given to men overseas? they may be of aid to some of them.

in regards to the food i think we should get better food such as steaks chafer and it would make a better soldier out of the men when we come into the mess hall we have no desire to eat what they put out.

in my opinion the negro is getting too much privilege and power. i think of them as still part savage, which they at times show. i worked in bermuda where i was in charge of negro labor and they have to be kept in place. i've met good negro but the majority are always looking for trouble.

negro and white soldiers could never mix. there would be serious trouble between them and perhaps many unpleasant scenes & riots. many southern soldiers, who particularly despise colored men, wouldn't stand being in the same hotel or room with a colored man. while i respect a colored soldier, it is my honest opinion that they should be kept on their side of the tracks and whites on the other.

outfits_comment: there is little or no chance of friction if they re kept separated.
long: this questionnaire is a good idea, because it may, if its ever used, uncover some of the stupid, or at least seemingly stupid mistakes made in just such things as this questionnaire brought out.

too many soldiers aren't doing what their classifications calls for too much talent and skill is being waisted because the men arent doing what they have been trained to do. many soldiers were taken out of very essential positions to be put in service and as a result that skill is lost as the individual is not doing as much for the war effort as he did before he entered the service

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits', "It doesn't make any difference"]
long: profanity has its place in the army - after all, an army is made up of men. but, up to date, i have heard an excessive amount of it - especially from non-coms. it seems many of them depend on profanity to  insure the enforcement of their commands. non-coms who have the respect of their men need not use profanity - and don't. something ought to be done to lessen it.

i think that questionnaire will be worth the paper its printed provided we are shown that some these things we have answered are really read, over a radio or published with answers and what is being done with information gather thru these means

outfits_comment: i sure don't want to sleep next to a negro and i don't think anyone else does.
long: dear sirs: i think that after anyone have completed his training (basic) that he should be giving a pass and after he has went to school and finish he should be giving a pass. this would make the soldier work harder and finish so that he can get home. also i believe he will know what he has learn. the way it is now the boys go out in the morning and they have nothing to work for; that is what most of them think. i also think so to. you officers in washington should see to it that the boys get their passes when they have finish. if you don't the officers in charge will slip unlest it is and order and you fellows there should see that it is carried out. thanks.

outfits_comment: because i am from the south.
long: i think that we will lose the war if the war and navy department tries to shift everything around to suit everybody. in war no democratic country can fight a war with success. the people should and do rule in peacetime but doing war the constitution of the us should be put in storage and the president with the aid of the war and navy departments should say what to do, how to do it and where to do it. in this way congress will not prolong the war and it will help us to bring the constitution out of its storage place more quickly.
i am willing to do my share as far as my health will permit. i would be better in a dry climate.

i think that week end passes should be granted to soldiers - not passes saturdays  soldiers would work harder -pay attention on command given and not fool like now. soldiers have nothing to look forward too and they just don't care. when passes are given for week ends, i think personally that better results will be shown on the different drill fields. soldiers living in hotels near more g.i. parties than anything else on the post. we all like clean living quarters and most of us do our utmost to keep our living quarters clean, but our officers are never satisfied regardless of how much you work.

outfits_comment: there is too much racial prejudice
long: regards question 24 - i have been accepted for special meteorology training yet i have been here doing nothing in connection with it. i have already been classified why is it necessary to go through the entire procedure and waste much valuable time? in general the army seems to waste a great deal of time just standing around and waiting. question no. 11 - i should like to be stationed at one of the colleges in the pre-meteorology b program immediately since i have been accepted for it.

outfits_comment: they could cooperate better if the were in separate outfits.
long: when you  and you tell them what you do to have much training you have , and if it is a special kind of work, why they don't put you in the branch your best suited for, and not what they want you in, and then you can succeede in it very good, because your not interested.

outfits_comment: i personally would rather be in an all white outfit
long: i think the army is too strict on some points too lax on others. things that seem important to me for  health and such are overlooked while we catch the devil for things of no consequence,  i think we  ought to be able to go home some weekend while getting our basic training here at atlantic city.  for over two weeks we are not allowed out. we have no chance to get things we need. we are new in the army we did not anticipate many of our needs.

outfits_comment: no idea.
"east is east, west is west and never the twain shall meet"
long: to tell the truth, i think the whole affair is silly and don't see how anything superior to the present state of affairs can be accomplished through the use of this questionnaire. possibly, there is some advantage to it, but as the old saying goes, "i'm from missouri."

outfits_comment: it still will cause trouble again here and there

long: there are to many boss in the army. we don't have enough time to ourselv's. only been in the army 2 weeks been on the go every minute.

outfits_comment: i think each element would work better without the other

long: questions #34 & 35 are answered in the belief that the allied nations will win the war and germany will be broken in small states as she originally was.

i have always done my best in the army but have noticed that men around me who are only half trying receive promotions the same as myself. i feel i have worked harder and should receive more. also the pressure the non-coms in my outfit have to work  is almost unbearable at times and seems to be unfair. we must keep the morale of the men high and yet our superior officers think nothing of ours. which is very important because we are directly in contact with the men. officers who are selected to be stationed in training camps should be picked from non-coms who know all the phases of training rather than a man from an administrative job who knows nothing at all about his job.

outfits_comment: negro feel inferior when with white people.
being from the south. i think the two groups would not get along
long: being from the south, i think the two groups shouldn't't get along.

outfits_comment: if kept separate no disasters factions will arise
long: (63) to sum up the negro question if negro are separated from whites no differences will arise here to  distribution of privileges, as is bound to happen. some whites are naturally prejudiced and are apt to favor the white soldier. that is an injustice because every man should have equal rights for advancement, education and entertainment. 34. a sense of security seems to come over people as soon as fighting stops. everyone seems to think of the financial aspect of things. first thing you know the army of occupation will be disbanded and the educators of democracy that should be in occupied countries be withdrawn and some  will have an opportunity to spread his ideas. as in this war any attempt to stop him will be crushed by huge  manufacturers who will mainly think of john hollar and by so doing will anger themselves by making the dictator stronger.

outfits_comment: they will be proud of their own outfit and try to gain a good reputation for it.
long: my answers pertaining to negro are based on only a fair knowledge of them and therefore should be regarded as not authoritative advice. they will be proud if in their own outfit and try to gain a good reputation for it. my answers pertaining to negro are based on only a fair knowledge of them and therefore should be regarded as not authoritative advice.

outfits_comment: they would fight better as a unit and wouldn't have any trouble mixing
long: i don't think that the negro have been given a chance to show what they are willing to do and can do for this country.  i know that now negro are given a chance to become officers, but they are not given enough of a chance. i believe that all negro troops should be in separate outfits and should be commanded by negro officers.
should be given to as many service men as possible, but including questions that would really help the average soldier in his every day army life.

i think the soldiers should be treated with a little more respect they will  do as they are told instead of being shouted at every minute. the  should be  a soldier doesn't get enough sleep to drill hard all day.

outfits_comment: better harmony is the result of this set-up.
long: i do believe that, especially a drafted man, looks forward to passes and opportunities to visit home. it should not be an issue of the whim of officers who are at the front office to decide yes or no on pass questions without learning legitimate explanations. this questionnaire is well put together & i wish it success in what it is endeavouring to accomplish

outfits_comment: because we are all fighting for the same thing and for the same country.

long: i think this is a swell post and would rather be here than any where else . although this is my first post i dont see where you could be treated any better there might be a lot of the boys gripe but they will find out they were on a good post

outfits_comment: some of them are very fine men. but i can't say much for some of the others.
long: in reference to question #7 i am in a post near to home. i have nothing to do for the entire weekend and would like to go home. but we can not unless we get weekend passes. m.p.'s watch the trains and buses and we can't leave the town even though we have the weekend off.

outfits_comment: i would not care to bunk with a negro.
long: i think reception centers could be more careful in fitting recruits. it would save a lot of time after the soldier reaches his permanent station or training center and would save some blisters & chafing.

outfits_comment: resentment among the many antinegro organizations would retard the war effort and lower morale.
long: gives soldiers a fair chance to express opinions which are too often mistaken for anti-u.s. propaganda. i express unfairness to negro and some religious sects, chiefly on the part of rich people, whose riches have more or less been obtained by suppressing minorities and exploiting them, sometimes for generations in a single family. i hope that this war will make us all think about all this, precisely what built nazi germany, and be cautious of our own heritage of freedom to live as we want----and heed the dangers of acquiring self-power to a point where others must suffer. my suggestion is a world legislation which shall guide us, not necessarily governing our daily lives.

outfits_comment: no comments were made
long: in answer to questions 53 to 63. i have no common knowledge as to the questions involving the negro soldier now in the army.  in answer to questions pertaining to civilian negro after the war i cannot form an opinion until this matter is disclosed to me. the actual conditions relative to the negro after the war is a matter to be see and my opinion can be formed then

my answer to #63. coming from the north it would not make any difference to me. but serving that a company it confused with men from all parts of the country. i think it would be better to have them separate. ^although we are both fighting to save and protect freedom.

i think there is to much favoritism shown in the army. the boys who have the friends get the staples & the ones who work hard get nothing. i think everyone should get what he deserves in spite of who he knows. the passes to get home for a few days are far apart. everyone likes to get home once in a while. certain guys get enough passes & others get hardly any.
take the profit out of war and there would be no more wars.

this questionnaire doesn't ask how the enlistmen feel about, commissioned officers. some officers i've met would be well to serve under on the other side, but other's i wouldn't care to serve under them.

outfits_comment: i don't they would mingle very well as a whole.
long: as for the negro, my thoughts may be biased as i am in the south and my home is in the north. the negro i have met seem a pretty decent sort.

outfits_comment: i'ts my impression this outfits segregated this way have less internal strain
long: i imagine this questionnaire was to be about the army. the discussion of "rights & privileges" is a little silly, 'cause i haven't had much time to think about those nice, empty academic questions. the army - i like it. i have a great deal of respect & admiration for the average officer & non-comm - the food is very good, & the clothes are very fashionable this year. i have a good bed, pleasant (tho slap-happy) roommate, so what more could i ask? except to go home more often - but i've been getting passes as often as anyone, so i can't object there & no real "gripe," i suppose, but i don't think i'll want to be in the army more than two days after the war ends. i'm white, by the way. best army we ever had. but there's not enough money in it.

1. quest 26 is answered on the basis of an unfortunate condition at home. this fact notwithstanding i find army life clean and healthy. few complaints on that score. 2. however my classification was a nightmare. i believe htat men who work in classification have a serious an responsible job and should be chosen with that in mind. the pvt who interviewed me was guiding himself by a book of instruction. i positively did not have the qualification for the job for which he classified me. 3. too much red tape, and "mumbo jumbo" from some of the non-coms. i need 2 dentures but some a.r. forbids it. why can't they be put in with permission of officer in charge of dental clinic.

outfits_comment: negro and whites should be allowed together where they are free to go as they please but should not be allowed to live or train together where they are ordered to do so.
long: the non-comm should be better trained in his job and responsibilities as he directly represents the army to the men under him. care should be taken in making a non-comm and explaining his effect on his men. too many non-coms are made because tables of organization allow certain numbers. ability should be the first requisite. regarding officers the policy of changing men constantly in administrative parts disrupts the effecient conduct of a department. a new man is no sooner accustomed to the particular work of a dep't when he is transferred and the work of training a new man begins. this is all right for non-coms but administrative officers should be picked from among those qualified for this type work and detailed for permanent duty rather than transferred following a period of only a month or a few months. (permanent duty of course meaning a sufficient length of time to do a job and then to allow the complete training of a successor when necessary.)

it is my personal experience, that army core does not take the time to place the limited service men as carefully as they do ia men. there should be more opportunities open to limited service men who have the ability and the educational background to perform duties that are more  to the war effort, instead of placing them at an unimportant job just because his physical requirements are below the necessary standards. in most cases those limited service men were carrying out so such duties in civilian life quite satisfactorily and could do the same in the army. true these men are not qualified for combat duties, but most certainly they could perform many of the duties that are necessary in the army in this country. i think that a great resource of skilled limited service men are being wasted in jobs that could be filled by civilians or w.aa.c. in my instance i am a graduate civil engineer and on limited service but can not apply for any of the engineering schools in the air corp, yet in civilian life i performed engineering work for the navy quite satisfactorily. in the army i am engaged in work which requires no technical skill what so ever.

outfits_comment: the part that i think is wrong with this camp is that the officers do not cooperate very well together and that to many officers here do not cooperate with their noncom officers and in return the noncom. do not cooperate with the officers and men that are under them. the people seem nice heated thank to the soldiers being there are so many here.

long: i've been with the past band since it started, in aug. 1942. i had responsibilities regarding the drummers, teaching them to march and routine them. i had charge of a dance band, i also had charge of the  band. i was asked to go home for my own instruments and music at my own . the music was very helpful to the organization as we hardly had any at that time. most of the dance band work was done after duty hours. all the time on my music was done at my spare time. all experiences were paid by me - no payment from the band fund was ever offered to me. i was the first to volunteer my services in the mess hall, playing for enlisted men. also played at the officers club with both bands every saturday night or when the occasion called for music. this was also on off duty hours. no allotment was made until another unit joined us, the fund paid the em 3.00 - i was then given a chance one night a month to play the  for the 3.00, playing the drums. in other words when the fund money was handed out, i got the neck of the chicken - meanwhile, em who are hardly musicians were getting ratings - and also put with the band as assigned - i was still to be with the band as or assigned bandsmen. i was promised ratings that three times by my commanding officer. i have never asked for a rating or ever questioned my c.o. some of the fellows who were barely in the band at that time are now n.c.o.'s -- i'm still a pfc -- not that i'm so anxious to be a n.c.o. or anything, but a good soldier. but i do know that there was no fair play on my behalf. as far as my soldiering is concerned, i've only one bad mark against me and that is on call at the sick call list -- if that's a black mark, i've got it. i've never missed a formation, always done all that i was ordered to do and all that i was asked plus what i've offered to do to the best of my ability. i played drummer in civilian life for 19 years, also had my own orchestra -- and had a successful career, i've had tough deals with the good ones, but the one i got for the 7 months i've been a soldier is the worst. i always thought a good soldier got what he put into his army life. i'm still taking it, perhaps someday events such as these will no longer exist. i'm happy to be able to do my part in this army to the best of my ability, regardless of politics, etc.

outfits_comment: the acceptance of the negro socially must be a very gradual process--otherwise would be disastrous
long: i think there should be more standardization of training of organization commanders in the methods of supervising enlisted men

outfits_comment: because the characteristics of most negro and white  have been raised separately and are different from white people.
long: speaking of negro and the way white people feel toward them. as for myself as far as i am concerned any one who treats me fair and decent regardless of race or creed i'll treat him accordingly. then there are some white people who have no use for a negro at all. well they are wrong but to damn hard headed to admit it. the bible says "do unto others as you would have them do unto you," also man has equal rights regardless of race color or creed

outfits_comment: the civil war is still fresh in the minds of many soldiers. and to mix whites and negro is bad business for many reasons.
long: as to question 29, the war will be won sooner when it is decided who is who and the big shots quit playing power politics. convince us soldiers that politics is out for the duration, back us up, give us the stuff and we will end it. the boys that come back from this war expect better treatment than they had after the last one. as to no. 18. 90 day wonders don't rate very high. they make mistakes, same as the enlisted man but most of them will never admit it. usually they are pretty good at throwing their rank around. quit telling us how well paid we are where highly paid "so called defense workers" go on a sit down whenever they feel like it.

outfits_comment: they should be in different  and mess halls that could work together in their  of work
long: i think this is a very good way of finding out the way we feel. although i feel that our c.o. should personally interview each and every man once in awhile finding out how they are progressing and whether they feel satisfied in their work. for example, i am in  our outfit is a service  which when across, will be thing 1 & 2 each work. i have only been trained for 3 & 4 each and  marked on the  as 90& ready. yes  what i have had a change to study but not the complete thing. when i  across i really want to know my stuff. for i feel at this time that i am at a stand still. for question 63. he wrote comments talking about how he believes there should be segregation in the army and the white and blacks should wear different uniforms and eat in separate mess halls

outfits_comment: until we both (negro + white learn to quell prejudice we must be kept apart.
long: i welcome this opportunity to express my opinions and hope these forms will be presented again and again. after all, who has more right than the men in service to express opinions about there country, and after the war they will realize, that even though they were in service and opportunity was presented for them to aid in making their country a fine place to live in.

negro are good heated and will make better together but let them no we think that they should have a fair chance too live and let to chance up their end of the city and be more respectful even too each other i hope we can all do better

outfits_comment: they feel better if they are with their own race

long: some of the questions are too wide and varied in scope for one man's opinion - that is - opinion on one phase.

outfits_comment: i think there should be both separate + mixed outfits depending on the circumstances
long: you put restricted on the cover & then you deal with big  inflammatory stuff inside. why? how are you going to change the attitude of the soldier toward peace, or sacrifice, or the negro problem. are you going to have  make speeches to the men - or make gi movies - or present these findings to the president or to congress? hell, a congressman doesn't like the gallop poll - and that is all this is - done by the army which is grabbing too much unto itself any way!

it occurs to me that the negro problem is given far more space in this questionnaire than its real significance justifies. it is being agitated by professional reformers and seems to have someone in washington frightened. eventually that group is going to talk up a lots of trouble.

outfits_comment: keeps down friction.
long: since i was working for the repairs & utilities branch of the army engineers corps as a cost accountant for them, i think i should still be with them since they are a branch of the army. i think war workers and food producers should not be drafted or should not have to volunteer to keep from being drafted.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: i realize, however, that my answers to the last few questions are impractical because of the hostile attitude southern whites & some northern whites take toward living with negro. but if chinese or filipinos are accepted into the same ranks as the whites, why not the negro.
long: the only comment i have to make is that you should not draw any fixed conclusions as to my political or social beliefs - i am not a communist. my ideas are quite the same as many of the young men of my age who have had training in a large metropolitan college or university.

outfits_comment: they should be separate due to the friction between the two races.
long: i am of the opinion that some ratings are given on friendship instead of ability. i feel that a soldier with the ability is entitled to a rating even though he has but a few months service. the fact that a soldier has 20 or 25 yr service and is a m sgt does not necessarily mean he can do more to win the men. i have noncom officers with two or three yrs service that are as intelligent as men with but a few months service and not a buck private. i myself had just as soon be what i am rather than a non-comm but i think it only fair to give all what they are entitled to. leave personal feeling out of the and all pull togethau for victory

outfits_comment: the negro has a better chance to serve as he is. don't ever put him with some white folks.
long: it seems to me that the army medical system can stand a slap or two. they have given good treatment at all times but they seem reluctant to admit a new and proven good one. also they should recognize chiropractors and osteopaths as they do more damn good than pills. i know as i have had my back broken in the service and an m.d. is no good or little good for some thing that an osteopath or chiropractor can do a lot for--give them a commission also. by the way the morale here at kelley is the best i have ever seen in 17 months of service

outfits_comment: they work better together because each one tries to outshine the other.
long: colored soldiers & whites should never be thrown together in one unit. it would put the colored at too much of a disadvantage for they will always be of a different class. their intelligence is usually lower.

outfits_comment: i, for one, could not get along in a mixed outfit at all.
long: i think the army, working under the handicap of tremendous expansion, is doing a good job. i would like to see wider publicity given to the various schools open to enlisted men, and in particular, the subjects covered in these schools and some information about where the graduates are to be placed. in addition to having an officer rated by his superiors, how about giving the e/m a chance to rate their c.o's. sometime. they, too, have a very good idea as to his capabilities. in the matter of promotions, due account should be taken of some soldiers' inability to "shoot a line" & "bull" their superiors along, even tho they maybe very capable. also, let us have more promotions based on merit & fewer on personal friendship & "sucking".

outfits_comment: they usuly dont mix
who would want to take a shower with a negro or eat in the same mess hall or sleep in the same barracks
same as previous question.
long: my main gripe! is the seeming lack of organization in the army and congress of the control of war industries by a few capitalists of allowing men who are able bodied to attend college when good fighting men are so badly need, after all we lost them won't be any college. i think this should be a draft of women and men into war labor - we have to propel some might if we are to win. on other hand i think there should be a heck of a lot less talk and a hell of a lot more action. the president is a fine guy, but his congress aint like a bunch of old men. lets wake up america and go to war. hitler likes us the way we are.

outfits_comment: i don't think the negro would want white people in their outfits.
long: i like the entire questionnaire.

outfits_comment: negro have different ideas than white men about their jobs and other things
long: i want to be a commissioned officer because i think that i would be of more benefit to the service due to the fact that i have nearly three years service in administrative work.

outfits_comment: some white boys always feel they are better than the negro.
long: why is there so much back passing. especially the officers. it is quite understandable among the men but for our own officers to keep us guessing and not even answer civil questions or try to help us with our problems they seem more like wardens than good officers

i have mentioned this before but there is too much what i call "petty" politics in the army. this should be stopped but i realize it is hard to do. soldiers are bound by the articles of war and the men in my outfit are afraid to do anything because of this. we have a 20 yr 1st sergeant and he is as ignorant a man as i have ever known. while we are all war soldiers and sometimes it is unbearable.
i have always lived in the south and naturally i feel that way about the negro. i was brought up that way.

outfits_comment: can't ague if given equal rights
a negro is a lot happier when with one of his own color.
long: my main gripe with the army is that men on special duty service or detatched service have a very poor chance for a rating. the recommendations put into your squadron may be very good and by high authority but as you don't live with the squadron they just seem to forget about your recommemdations. i know in my case i have been recommended five times for corporal and in each case was forgotten about. my job requires me to use some authority and without a rating it sometimes becomes very hard. my officer whom i work for have tried everything for me but with no sucess. outside of this the army has done me a lot of good and has really made a man out of me. i am very glad for this chance to express my opinion.
the questionnaire is ok and i think it was put out for a good purpos.

outfits_comment: they get along better by themselves. more cooperative together

long: i don't see any sense at all to this. i think it is a waste of material, of time and of the army

outfits_comment: personally i do not believe that whites should fraternalize with negro to that extent.

long: during the 15 months i have spent in the army i have found that it is men on a ham store basis. for this reason - ""you do not get any credit for what you have done in the past"" army is interested in what you can do now and in the future. also - it is not what you know - its whom you know that gets one promotions or ahead in the army. there are altogether too many important officers and noncoms  for the above reason. result the well known army inefficiency that is so obvious in every army camp- office, etc.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: why not. we are all fighting together for the same cause. when a person is fighting, i don't think he will care whether the man next to him is black or white just so he fight.
long: this questionnaire is a fine way to let government officials know just what the "g.i." soldier thinks. some of the questions may have seemed unfair but when everyone states his honest opinion then something fine and outstanding will be achieved. one thing that worries me about this war is that the american people are taking victory too much for granted. may god help and make them realize that this is not a push over war. it will be won only after suffering and hardship. people should begin to realize this more every day!

you ask about the army in the states, well i served 3 years in foreign service, and when i came back to the states, i found to much inefficiency in the army. you should also cut down these clerking position for woman, all they do is sit around and drink coca-cola and smoke. it takes six months to have any thing done.

outfits_comment: would you call a negro your buddy?
long: in the outfit i'm in we have a very inefficient adjutant. an officer must, understand his men, help them, know them. he also must keep them disciplined but not by the methods he uses. i doubt if there is one man that would speak to him about any matter, personal or official, unless he had no alternative. we all have our hands tied for we can't report him to any one.

outfits_comment: i think they would be happier in their own outfits

long: why does the army put men at one job when the should be at something they can do better and why not treat them all alike. some places they don't. why should the army use things that are not needed so band and let things be wasted this is needed bat it happens every camp i have been why dont the big shots fiend out whats going, some fellows dont seem to care, i guess they dont like where they are + doing

outfits_comment: the two races wouldn't work together.
long: i think this is a good idea. it gives us a chance to express our opinion. to help us and the officials.

outfits_comment: depends what outfit they are in.
it should never be done
long: this questionnaire is a  thing. although a lot of my answers are wrong

outfits_comment: some are not as clean as others in their private respects
long: being a civilian before the war and making a good wage, having everything man desires and giving all up to enlist in the army and then on certain nights when a solider can have some fun he can't even buy anything after 11:00 pm, not even a bite to eat, is not fair. other places in the states are not like this, why should soldiers in other states be differently treated.

outfits_comment: because the negro is not outfit to be with white boys.
being in separate outfits prevents many arguments and friction
most whites don't like the negro.

long: well i think its a swell questionnaire, if every body did the same i did, are if it, was going to do any good by giving my opinion about it, thats all
id like to stay in the army but i'm already involved too deep in business at home that i can't afford to stay in.

outfits_comment: the white + colored boys should mix
long: some officers don't realize that their life depeneds upon the soldier. some officers think that they are so much better then the soldier.  everyone can not be a commissioned officer.

outfits_comment: as long as there are blacks + whites racial prejudice will exist, which  to many forms of trouble.
long: when i enlisted in the army i was given  promises  they painted a pretty colorful picture. i'm a college man and i do my  -  my ability, but am still a pvt, just because i don't go around and kiss every  -  or officer's ass. they told me the army wanted men with ability - bullshit. the dummer you are the faster you advance. cause there is always some-one who thinks you may take his job away from him. so far the army has been anything but fair. i wouldn't have one gripe in the world if i could do what i wanted to do. but our c.o. and first sgt are always working against the men  of with them. there is a soldier for every trade in the army, and free will. there are about 100 of my fellow soldier buddies that feel the same way. a man is happy if he enjoys his work.
i think that each man should get what he was for in his line of work.

outfits_comment: it would be impossible for harmony in any organization combining the 2 races.
long: the army in general isn't bad at all but seems to be in too much of a hurry to "wash out" the aviation cadets, who with a little more time can turn out to be expert pilots. i think this idea of washing out a cadet who is just a little slow in grasping the fundamentals of flying is a big loss to all concerned. then after they do washout, send them to be grease monkeys in some training squadron. i thought that cadets were to be supposed to be of higher intelligence class and of perfect physical condition. if so they should deserve a better break in the army. a deal like this tends to lower the morale of a soldier considerably!

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
long: have much trouble in getting proper treatment and to cause of my troubled eyes. i was given a pair of govt. issue glasses, they were incorrect, and had to buy the next pair of glasses issued to me, because of their mistake. gladly done that to get relief! as yet it's ok! the army is a great experience for any man, it was meant for man to suffer somewhat, to appreciate the peace, and a  healthful life. our government is a government. of the people and by the people, and for the people. it is the best form of government or ruling in the history of the world. free of speech, free of religion; it is wonderful!
no comment i am sadisfied with things the way they are.

outfits_comment: the white and negro wouldn't mix. one would pull against the other.
a lot of southerners would rather be court martialed than to eat and live with negro and maybe they're right
long: i don't believe it gives enough of an  opportunity to show the reasons for whatever dissatisfaction with the army a man might have.  practically every ex-cadet who has washed out of flying training for some reason or other thinks he got a rather bad deal. of course, men who couldn't possibly fly a plane should be washed out, but when 60% to 70% of a class is eliminated, it's an indication that there is some room for improvement in he flying training program.

outfits_comment: i would not eat in the same mess hall or sleep in the same barracks with a negro.
long: the most of us like the army for we are here to do a job and we intend to do it right. many of us do not want to be officers because we have seen so many who were only "fronts" for the enlisted men who really got the job done. for the most part we are proud of our officers; the most of them are here to get the job done, and are doing their work extremely well. there is a little uneasiness in our minds about the opportunity of another war. we know stalin is not the kind democracy loving man he is pictured. we would like to know just how he is going to be watched, like germany and japan. - and we would like a hand in writing the peace.
it would be a good idea if more men where taken from the enlisted men or mechnics and made enginering officers.
the war department has a good idea in trying to solve the problem of the american soldier.
why does not boys mother an sister dependents get as much allotment as wife alone gets for example mother an sister gets forty two dollars an month when a wife gets fifty by herself.

outfits_comment: it helps the morale of both races.
long: #6 as far as equipment at the field is concerned they are giving me a chance but it is not the type of work i am experienced at. #24 i think i was doing more for my country in civilian life as i was experienced with the work and worked harder. #40 personally i don't believe that people will hire ex-soldiers because they want to keep their experienced men. #49 quite often promotions are given for who you know and not what you know. #50 quite a number of m.p.'s go to extremes with their authority. #55 lots of them don't realize the serious condition.

i think he civilian population should realize that the soldiers are not fighting for their freedom but that they are fighting for everyones freedom. the civilian should realize this and put out a greater effort toward winning the war. lately an order came out that all civilians should get war jobs or get in the army. then the next day the employment places were crowded with people tyring to get war jobs to keep them out of the army. well it just hurts most of the soldiers feelings to know that they are fighting and many of them giving their lives for people like these who are slackers and will not help fight for the freedom that we all want. i'm for the civilian who has an essential war job. he can do more good there than he can in the army. but those who haven't essential war jobs should not seek out one just to keep out of the army armed forces, as it will take every citizen doing all that he can to win this war.

a person should go in the army with one thing in view to make good if you have that in mind all the time you will have no trouble with town police or mp either. the men or  muct make good in army life just as one would in public business for the army to do its best.

outfits_comment: i have no hatred for the colored
long: this questionnaire is one of the best ideas the army has put out. you can state as you please and there will be no harm to befall you. there are quite a few people that could cause you harm if they were to know what you say in this questionnaire.

i think that this filed is the best one in the states we do our work well and we have all the freedom we want when we are not on duty give a soldier the time he has off to him to do as he wishes and he will be a lot better soldier all that time

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
long: on the whole, the army is really doing a really fine job. the constant readiness to help enlisted men in many personal problems, and their desire to provide entertainment & pleasure - is truly a wonderful thing.

in some army camps passes are restricted to two or three a week to all soldiers under the first three grades of non-comm's. in my opinion a man that is married and can live with his wife will work better than being allowed only two or three nights a week with her.  i've watched soldiers at several camps where that was put into effect. they get so pissed off it affects the work they are doing. their opinion is that while they are where they can see them they should.  i agree with them.

outfits_comment: because it seems natural no person would want to sleep, bathe or eat, with anyone but his own race.
long: because it seems natural. no person would want to sleep, bathe or eat, with any one but his own race.

outfits_comment: because it will prevent trouble between races.
long: i think there is to much politics connected with the army and army ratings. there are to many boy given rating that don't deserve them and some that does deserve them don't get them.

outfits_comment: same as 61 & 62
long: some of the questions are difficult for me to answer. for instance the ones about my outfit. i've been unassigned ever since i came into the army and therefore have not had any close relationships with the officers and noncoms.

outfits_comment: i do not like to live in the same room with any colored race.
long: 1 - embrace what laws we have 2 - abolish communisim for it does not promote free speech an in 1000 %. constitution of the u.s.a. 3 - in suppressing comminusim and in up holding the constitution for the reds dont believe in free speech, and any one who does believe in free speech will suppress the reds in their country, but let them run there own red russia

outfits_comment: because there is to much hard feeling between most white men and colored men.
would not care to sleep next to one. or use same latrine as he.
long: in regards to our office. all these circulars sent out. most are useless only to one branch of service. if even to them. make up there mind and take out half the 1 lieutenant & ends who make them in nice language. still not even knowing what its about. take out the politics and have a little morale instead. for there will not be a great deal left or respect. ----- simplified forms instead of red tape. no need of it.

i believe that they are too many commissioned officers generally speaking that are not qualified or do not possess qualities of leadership that are necessary for  & success of any company or organization.

outfits_comment: if they were in the same outfit, the negro wouldn't have  the privileges nor the chance for advancement as they have now.
long: this questionnaire does not ask any information in comparing the camp i am in now with other camps! i have been in six different fields since entering the service and have found that the morale has been exceptionally high in some such as kelly field, and yet has been drastically low in others, such as sheppard field. this difference in morale, i have found to be due to conditions pertaining to privileges, food, quarters, hardships, private time etc. i can't see why some fields can make a soldier feel perfectly at home while others make it hell for him. a medium should be reached at  all  fields so that a soldier may not feel that he is getting a raw deal whereas a friend of his who happend to be sent elsewhere is living the life of rielly.

outfits_comment: i think it is a good thing because if not there would be trouble among the soldiers.
because the south doesn't like negro.
long: there is on thing i would like to express. and that is the unrest of the fellows here in the states. most of them want to get into the fighting and are afraid that they can't because of unbelievable numbers, which make every one feel as if they were doing every thing for nothing.

outfits_comment: no they should have a separate place in camp.

long: there is to much  in the army, mostly in the non home  officers are bull headed and treat there men like cattle or worse. i am in a outfit of m.p. we do  to a trick and have posts that don't seem important at all and if you work hard you don't get any strips if you make a mess of it you are just as far ahead so why should we try. i don't like this type of m.p. duty and can't get out of it. i wouldn't mind m.p. duty if it were regular m.p. work instead of walking posts like they do most place for extra duty. you would think we were doing extra duty all the time to watch up and that is the way we are treated.
i do not like to inforce law, neither do i care to break laws. i don't even like to decide what is law.

outfits_comment: to much ignorance in both races for them to gel when they are together
if they did not separate the negro from the whites there would be too many fights and killings.
long: how come the army does not take over the bus that run to the field. the buses on this field are very . sometimes we have to wait for two hours to get on a bus because there are not enough buses.  the food in the army is fine but it good be improved.

outfits_comment: if everyone is with their own color they feel they have a better chance for advancement otherwise there would be a feeling of favoritism for the other color.

long: sure this will help out country to some extent

outfits_comment: not up to par
long: i am only interested in my honorable discharge from the army. i am over 38 yrs and can't take it in the infantry. i want to get out!!
i believe some of the questions asked do not allow a man to express his whole opinion through the printed answers.

outfits_comment: i don't think they would mix very well.
i don't think it make any difference, because we all fighting together.
it gives the negro soldier a better chance for advancement and prevents ill feeling.
long: if the army would treat its men as real men and not as boy scouts it would make a man feel like a soldier. they waste too much time on silly and unnecessary inspections. that valuable time could be used for good training. we came here to fight and not to see whether our left shoe is where the right one should be. good inspections are all right but not the kind we have. there have been times in this camp when the morale of the men was so low it was pitiful.

outfits_comment: well i don't believe in living with a negro
long: (no statement)

i wonder why they dont station a fellow closer to home? i personally think they'd get more fighting spirit out of men. a soldier gets $50 a month and by the time he has his insurance , laundry, and a few enjoyments out he has to save the rest for his furlough because the distance is so large between he and his home. i know if i could get home i'd fight much better. why dont furloughs come about every 4 months? if they'd station a fellow closer to home they could completely forget about furloughs. week-end passes would or could be arranged some way to get a soldier home at least a couple days a month and with less cost for the soldier

this questionnaire deals more less about white people and negro and i think they are the same as white people are. this questionnaire deals more less about white people and negro and i think they are the same as white people are

the government should do more to find the correct spot for the men they bring into the army. they would have happier, more satisfied men if this were accomplished. the placing the many men i have come in contact with has been woefully poor. many, many men who could be of great use to the army in certain lines are placed in the branches where their abilities can not be fully utilized. something should be done to counteract that. i believe that this war would be finished a great deal more quickly with satisfied men. politics is another thing that must be done away with. we should be working towards the end of this war and that alone. politics are corrupting divisions and the morals of the men in them. the leaders are using their merits towards themselves. it's bad enough to have to be in this blasted army without being used to forward some 's ambition.

outfits_comment: its a well known fact that northern negro and southerners don't mix
long: my army job at present takes up too many subjects. it is bewildering to try  that is why i say i don't believe i've been given a fair chance to show that i can handle clerical work.

outfits_comment: they stink like when they warm up.
long: the army should be more flexible. cut the red tape. more faster. we have to fight or die.

outfits_comment: in separate outfits all will work harder
because i would not like to sleep by a negro.
long: because i would not like to sleep by a negro,

outfits_comment: negro do better with their own officers, and a white man would hate to have a negro  in his outfit.
long: the questionnaire covers very well all parts of what soldiers do and think, and i have nothing to say about it.

outfits_comment: they wouldn't work together
long: if you give a negro money he just lives in a shack an buys a new car an doesn't improve himself, i know that's the way in the north and they can be led to () easily don't think for themselves. most soldiers want to be discharged from the army as soon after the war is over you are going to have a hell of a time keeping them in

outfits_comment: they have different  and ways of doing things
they should be with their same race.
because we live differently.
long: i believe is has cover every phase of life in u.s. soldier

outfits_comment: they may be happier being with all negro but it shouldn't't make any difference.
long: they only thing that i find that i think should be remedied is that a promotion of a private should not be made because he is liked by an officer. it should be on ability and his way of handling men. some have ability and cannot express themselves enough to teach a private. they should also take ratings away from non-coms that get big heads when they wear chevrons. also a soldier while training in a camp should not be taken away too far from his home town. if he were able to go home on a weekend it would help his morale a lot. they shouldn't't confine anyone, but pick details in order.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: it would breed further understanding between the two & gradually elimante all trace of distinction.
long: i am a lad of 20 years, have been scholarly minded all my life. passed the army test with 124 & similar high marks yet i find myself in a rifle company designed for the simplest minds and strongest backs. i am not rugged, my eyes are deficient to make one unfit for active combat yet i must not ask for a transfer under penalty of extra duty, kp, & general antagonism from the officers above me. i feel sure i would be much more valuable in any technical branch & expect any day to develop into a nervous wreck from the strenous & hectic moments of late. i think there should be a personnel man to listen to each man's desires & to be able to help him should he consider it essential to the army & man's welfare. again i say i am a misfit in my present job when i'm sure i could be of far greater value to the air corps.

outfits_comment: they would consider their selves to good.
some times they start fights with the whites people and i dont like it.
long: i dont believed to be with the negro because i dont trust them some times they lose there heads

outfits_comment: they work together better
long: in 48. the whole country should be taken over and watched for a generation, until the children of today have lost the teachings they have heard from hitler.
well i having got any thing that i want to say about the questionnaire. i am satiffie with all of them.

i think it is a very excelent questioning and it gives a soldier a good opportunity to relieve him self of a lot of pent up trouble. but whether any thing will be done about any of these problems, which trouble most every soldier, will remain to be seen.

outfits_comment: if they are together they will strive to be a credit to their race.
long: don't gather that i dislike a negro or disrespect them. they're o.k. fine people (all i've known. but don't force them in the lodges of white soldiers. i have ability but the army can't use it. i can learn anything but the army puts me with men of less intelligence i must wait on them to learn before i can go on to the next thing. i disliked being last, & my nature thrives on some respect if only for sacrificing my self for this cause. but non-coms , do not treat privates with any degree of respect. it's bad for morale makes soldiers bitter. many privates held for better positions in civilian life than the non-comm's now giving them orders.

outfits_comment: well they probably couldnt agree with each other.
long: well the reason i am complaining so much is when i first got into the army, i was put in the field artillery i liked it very much, but what reason did they transfer me to the medics i just cant understand at all. why id rather be in the field artillery than in the medics. a fellow cant be interested in something he does not like, now can he, of course not my heart just is not in it. thats the reason i dont like the medics.

outfits_comment: due to the fact a negro needs a more severe discipline.
long: a war worker shouldn't't be idscouraged with his work, but should never encourage strikes. () concerning question eight: i wouldn't want to stay in, but will do all i can while here () the function of junior non-coms reflect on their 1st sgt. there is no exception there. () concerning question twenty one: i am a mess sgt. very few menus have proper components to make the menu complete, due to  people making up the components & not the menu.

outfits: ['They should be together in the same outfits']
outfits_comment: it helps bring relationship - better understanding.
long: what good is it, if its not enforced that way; all  the questions are open fro debate - it's easy for a lot of men who give comments that don't give a darn. i think in a way survey like this is good. but how can you satisfy every one, also this war is every ones business. we need more discpline in time of war, including civilians -- be more war conscious people to day don't give a darn - let the political men do their thinking
the only thing i have to say is when can i go home?

outfits_comment: they would cooperate better in separate outfits, in my opinion
long: concerning question 17: in my opinion there is a lack of "man to man" feeling between commissioned officers and non-coms. i don't believe i would enjoy or rather be able to do my best under those circumstances. this is a fairly intelligent army this time and should be treated as such by those in command.

outfits_comment: there are individuals among white soldiers who would be narrowed minded and that could cause dissension among everyone.
long: this questionnaire will undoubtedly help to understand how the average soldier things. the practice of sending men drafted from one locale so far away that a furlough is impossible because it takes so long to travel is very unwise. we here in wash. state have to figure half our furlough time just for traveling. on the whole i believe most everyone is satisfied ‚äì of course their is always gripping, but that is an americans privilege ‚äì everyone wants the war over with, and the more action that take place, the happier everyone will be.
i don't think the army places men in the branches they are best fitted for. that is my pet gripe.

outfits_comment: better for all concerned.
long: i feel that the elected officials and appointed ones are using their authority to further their interests and friends interests. also too much politics are being played on the conduct of the war. the negro question i can't answer, as i have observed nothing. germany always has pleaded for an armistis before being thoroughly whipped, will again. i think more effective use of civilian trades could be used, that round pegs are in square holes.

i suggest that all man should 1st be classified on physical basis first and then build from that point on.  also suggest that non comm's and officers should tell their men on all training for combat zone service the "why" of everything.

outfits_comment: most of either race are not used to living closely to each other.

long: one thing unfair about the army is the fact that some men come into it and learn an occupation or trade that will be useful to them after they get back into civilian life. whereas men in the infantry for example serve their time and after the war these years are more or less wasted as far as having picked up anything to aid them in their struggle for existence. take my own case. i am a physical education instructor and there was no attempt to try to put me into that branch. it would seem there are places for men with college degrees in other places besides the infantry.

outfits_comment: they might feel the white soldier would get a better break if they were mixed.

long: in regards to question #49 it seems to me there is too much favoritism shown to some, while those with ability are disregarded.

long: draft board are still holding back single men and sending married men with children- this should be stopped. - jobs should be checked before a man is given a deferement, some are and more can be filled by women - officers should be checked on to their knowledge of handling men, there are too many who don't, and will not see the human side of thing because they never worked men are  men in their life. - men with years of service should get first chance at the ocs vacation.

in the questionnaire it speaks about if the army is fair. it is fair sometimes, with some people, and unfair with others. in my individual case, i have very bad feet and am pretty heave. i just can not take these hikes and running that an infantry outfit must take. i try to do it and will keep on trying, but i am afraid i would not last long in combat. some men that are absolutely capable of being combatant are put in non-combatant jobs. the sooner, i think, the army gets men straightened out of who are combatant and non-combatant the quicker we will win the war and the easier it will be on some men who can't really take combat jobs.

outfits_comment: one comment i wish to make is of married men in the army with families and not getting furloughs when their outfits are still in the state. i think if they gave more furloughs it would help greatly in building up the morale of the army.
long: one comment i wish to make is of married men in the army with families and not getting furloughs when their outfits our still in the states., i think if they gave more furloughs it would help greatly in building of the morale of the army.

there isn't any questions on food & clothing. about no 28. why doesn't the co  the men belong to have more entertainment, so they don't have to find other sort of amusement
they should take negro`s into the navy.

i answered question 32 saying a war worker cause i have had some training in the mechanical field & could be more help as a war worker or even in the army at an air-base as a mechanic's helper. that is my ambition to work my way up to a commission in the army air corps ground force & finally to fly a plane of my own over berlin & tokoyo. i do hope that they give me a transfer soon as i keep wishing for it.

there is a lot of men in the army that have spent years at mechanical jobs and welding jobs and typing and bookkeeping jobs that are put in some other job in the army and they will take men that know nothing about those jobs and spend a lot of time training them for those jobs when they allready have men that know the jobs. and a lot of the men they pick for a certain job is not physically or mentally capable of handling them correctly

outfits_comment: so neighter one will say they done more than the other.
long: first of all i am a sharpshooter on the rifle, an expert on the bayonet, and also an expert on the machine gun and in my option i would rather be across do my share as well as the other fellow. this way it makes me feel like a misfit. two of my best friends have fallen already, so i think its only right for me to go across and even the score. i am positive i can do it. all i ask is the chance. yes i want to be a noncom because it will make me feel that i am getting ahead. i have not failed at a job yet.
i would like to go over seas in combat service and if i could not go i think i would be more valuable back home in a factory.

outfits_comment: the army might force me to obey a black officer but by god they couldn't make me like it. i wouldn't do it willingly.
long: none they answer themselves.

outfits_comment: because it will look much better if they where separate
long: you should talk nice to old people and if you see a girl walking home you should escort her home and don't give any military information and don't get drunk in public. i like it very much but you should have more of them. they should do that every month. they should have a trade school and give it to them  not outfit for the service like who can't shoot or hike and get their brains working some of them don't work right

outfits_comment: because some white don't like the negro.
i believe there would be to much trouble in handling the two races if mixed in a army camp.
long: we should have more older men for officers who knows what can be expected of a man also who knows just what and how much a man cant stand it seems to me that a to young of an officer cant got the work from the men because  knnow be    in life himself for just doing things of the good book does not always work it takes more older men with a little more experiences in life to take over the  of an officer
a comment to question 47. i do believe we are fighting to maintain free speech in the u.s.a. -

outfits_comment: there would be no dissension between them.
long: the main part that i don't like about this army, is why they don't put a fellow in a branch of the service that he likes most. they could get a lot more cooperation from him, and he would be happy and well satisfied.

outfits_comment: as for me i don't care but others would object.
long: more of a chance should be given those who missplaced or disatisfied. a greater effort on the part of the interviewer or acclassifier would make a more disciplined and contented army. the more we are sure of a position after the war the harder and more wisely we will fight. a rifleman is of little value in civilian life. we should continue to fight hitler and tojo lest they again arise to combat.

outfits_comment: the southerners do not feel the same toward the negro as the northerners do.
long: i think the army might have a little less of this leaving up just to weight a while, the efficiency could be a lot better in a great many ways. if we are given a job to do let do without all of this argument of just how to do it. let one individual decide how it should be done and do that way.

outfits_comment: it isn't fair to either to put them in the same outfit.
long: in regards to treatment received from town police i have never had any trouble myself but have seen various cases where they could have acted a great deal better. the civilian population as a whole in many areas do not treat soldiers fairly. i have noticed this to be the case particularly in the south. this makes the soldier wonder if it is worth while fighting for some of these people. taken as a whole i think the m.p.'s are doing a very good job. too many people still dont realize that this war is their affair as well as their neighbors.

i think that a man in service shoudl have a enough gas to run his car; i don't have enough to get to town over twice a week. a man in service with a car can carry boy to town. when the buses are full, that is making some of us happy.

i think that regardless what rank a man holds and is stationed in the united states  and is married and it is possible that he can live with his wife he should be allowed to and also draw quarters. it would help him along in his work and he would also be more interested in what he is doing have less worry .

outfits_comment: they should be together in one outfit but whites should not impose on them because of their color.

long: in asking about promotion i think  it's very slow especially in an outfit that was in the national guards and  kept most of their non comm's since they have entered the fidual service. there are lots of good men who deserve a chance to get ahead and for several reasons can't because of no openings in the non comm ranks. i think in that case more cadres should be sent out from time to time i for one have now served from october 1941 to april 1942 and was  because of dependents and was called back in  october 1942. my record is good have showed ability in doing things and have over a year service to my credit and yet am only a back private with no chance of promotion unless older men are moved out. that for one reason discourages a man who intends to make the army his career if he can be promoted to the first three grades

some of these questions for example, the fifty seventh question where it says to choose between more or less. i cannot answer the question like that to my estimation correctly, because in my estimation, that particular question cannot be answered by saying more or less. i think the answer is "about the same."

i personal feel that beacuse of my age i would be of more value to the army any thing other than a fighting unit. if i were ten or 12 years younger war would be quite a thrill and adventure , but when you are 30 years of age or older you have lost the lust for adventure. anytime my country calls on me i will do my part in combat but i am not as good a soldier physically as if i were in teen age group.

outfits_comment: no country in the world is so blesses as the united states. we lead our individual lives to our liking. yes - that is worth fighting for. the mark we attain is quided largely by how we do our job - if you are a bum it is your own fault; if you are an ambitious man you profit. i have been married nearly 2 yrs & have a fine child - naturally under these conditions i long to be with my wife. i do believe if i were a single man i would put my heart in my fighting and would want to see action. but, even so, i realize there is a hard job to do and want to do my bit rather than be a slacker.

long: there are in my opinion, still many men serving the army, who could be better classified. for example why should a good welder be assigned to clerical or recreation duties at a base pay of $50.00, and let a civilian with a lesser degree of efficiency in welding hold down a "defense job" in the pasts' - and some civilian phys. outfit for "army" duty - yet draft exempted. i am not "beefing" but am trying to bring forth the point that we "gis" do have a feeling of animosity toward these people who would make much better agricultural workers or infantry men.  why pay a civ. women worker $120.00 per mo. as a "messenger" while a limited serv. em could get the job done?  thanx

the only thing that seams unjust to me & that gives me much to worry about is the 11:30 cerfie. why should i stand in danger of loosing my rank & having my military record mared just because a buss wasn't running or i had car trouble or my wife got sick in the night & i had to take her to the hospital. i know that other parts of the u.s. don't know of such a restriction. i know that the above violations are punishable because they got me once & they told me what would happen next time.

49.-ratings are not fairly given on service or ability, but on how much influence you may have with superiors. this is one big disappointment and morale breaker in our army today. 52.-one of the worse morale breaker existing today in the army is the toleration of strikes in essential war industry. why isen't something done about this? we men who have given up so much, already, and will give our life if necessary to gain freedom for our cause are beginning to wonder, "for what and is it worth it".

outfits_comment: it is the only way to get along in my opinion.
long: i left a big business to come into the army and i am glad i did. i would not be any where other than in the army during time of war, when i was of age & my partners can carry on for me. i only hope that the axis nations will be crushed so hard that they can never rise to cause any of our children, or grandchildren trouble, sorrow, and suffering as they  have done now. i don't feel like the war will last too long and we will have a total victory for the allied nations. i only hope that our leaders can put power into the conflict where it is needed the most, and i am sure that they will.

outfits_comment: the white can work with the white race efficiently + vis versa because they understand how his fellow men react + each has different customs + beliefs
long: i don't see why this gov. stands for all this damned nonsense + instead of wasting their time this way do something that would benefit our country more + help end this war. we're humans the same as the civilians but we cannot enjoy the freedom of a civilian. those who are not in the army bragg about what they are doing + how much they make while we can't even spend a night in town without having to be back to the post at an early hour and many other things. many of us are married and although we can get by on our own income we can't live off this post. why not? if it doesn't interfere with our work. a civilian can live home + he isn't giving half as much as we. we are willing to do but how about letting us enjoy life as much as possible while we have it.

hell, i don't know what this is all about but i sure would like to see this war ended, so i could go home and be with my people again because they need me there badly. sometimes i feel like this war business is nothing but a racket, but maybe it's necessary i don't know, i don't think economics will permit it to last over 2 years.

long: negro feel out of place with whites. same as a whites would feel out of place with negro

outfits_comment: i believe that they are happier and in a better position to advance when they are in their own organizations. (note 64)
long: (note question 58) men have they should be treated the same. i realize that much has to be done yet in order to better equalize the white & the negro but since that is not one of the major issues of the war i don't think the war should have any bearing on it. in other words, i feel that the negro & the white should benefit equally from a victory that is achieved by a combined effort & equal . (note question 63) at one time there was an outfit on this field that had combined white & colored and due to better education and leadership qualities and perhaps some discrimination, the white boys were getting all of the promotions even tho the colored boys were trying just as hard.

concerning interest in one's army job (20) some of us come into this army with a high degree of skill in some job the the army can use, in my case needed badly, but are assigned to outfits that have no openings for advancements, so we are doomed to remain privates for a long period. to doom a highly educated or skilled man to the lowest grades is extremely poor administration, because it will break the morale of the men and lessen the interest of the man in his job, this leads to even more inefficiency than is now present, and one look at personnel records of the classification division will show readily how inefficient the u.s. army is already.
too much time + money is being spent training men for some job and then not utilizing the men in the job they were trained for
i should be with my wife and children, but i have nothing against the army.
i do think when we work hard all week we should have the week end off but if we was over the pond we would not expect it. but hear i do but we do get all we can eat swisher

outfits_comment: no
